Job ID: 19013


Position Description:
AMETEK, Inc. is a $4.7B global diversified manufacturer of electronic instruments and electromechanical devices. AMETEK is well positioned in highly competitive market segments, each with compelling growth characteristics, and have 17,000 associates employed across 30 countries.

Controls Southeast Incorporated (CSI) is part of the Thermal Process Management (TPM) business unit with Ametek. For almost 50 years, CSI has been helping customers solve problems in the chemical, petrochemical, and processing industries with engineered thermal maintenance systems and specialty fabrication. Around the world, we are known for the high quality of our work. With each project, we strive to create a great customer experience. Visit www.csiheat.com for more information about our company.

CSI offers our team a great opportunity to make an impact at an decentralized organization that has a small company feel, but large global company resources. We are passionate about building a winning organization, increasing the knowledge or our teams, and empowering our people and creating long term careers.

What you will do as a Project Engineering Intern:

You will work closely with the Operations and Project Engineering teams in supporting the company's project opportunities. Project Engineering is pivotal to our business process and plays an important role of offering engineering, company and customer expertise. The Intern - Project Engineering may help the team with any of these actions:

• Identified projects you will be supporting.
• New Digital Store initiative
• Paperless Shop
• Operational Excellence including but not limited to production time studies, inventory reduction and overall efficiency improvement.
• Health, Safety and Environmental metrics and compliance


Position Requirements:
Education and/or Experience
• Currently pursuing a degree in Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or Business
•Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering, or related
• Ability to quickly adapt approach and style when working with customers and team members
• Strong skill set with data entry and Excel
• Ability to self-manage time and workload, work independently
• Ability to work in a fast paced, constantly changing environment
• Ability to properly prioritize tasks and work under pressure

Location: West Conshohocken, PA
Description: Our client is currently seeking a Market Research Manager

 
POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the general direction of the Vice President of Market Research, and in partnership with cross-functional internal partners, this hands-on role works primarily on Voice of the Customer primary market research and related analysis. This role requires significant coordination with cross-functional stakeholders. The role also coordinates the work of preferred partner vendors to augment the team’s capacity and identifies when an elevated level of expertise is warranted to support project objectives. This role manages the CXI team’s intern and may manage full time direct reports. The Market Manager will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work while exemplifying AmerisourceBergen’s guiding principles. In addition, the market research manager works closely with a number of key roles, stakeholders and functions across the organization to include but not limited to the following: business stakeholders (sales), financial analysts, customer operations, customer solutions, distribution operations and marketing. S/he needs to be a creative thinker and propose innovative approaches to data collection and analyses. The market research manager should know statistical methods and internal data sets to complete research projects. In addition, the market research manager will understand and effectively employ a number of ways to visualize data in a way that is highly effective and persuasive. Finally, the market research manager must be inherently analytical and have a high level of curiosity in getting to next level understanding of insights behind the data. Excellent written and communications skills will also be a necessity for this role.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Reviews research briefs to understand objectives and consults on the design of surveys to ensure the data collected will facilitate the right analysis to generate findings that support the objectives
· Independently programs and tests surveys, including the development of call to action and thank you messages, uploads respondent data, and deploys surveys
· Integrates data from outside sources into Qualtrics and utilizes Qualtrics analytical tools to develop findings
· Builds dashboards, provides training on optimal use, and continuously finds ways to improve data visualizations and incorporate new Qualtrics features within the dashboards
· Calculates required respondents to achieve desired confidence level. Checks and ensures data validity. Identifies when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate.
· Conducts analysis of Voice of the Customer data. Demonstrates strong proficiency with all Qualtrics analytical tools.
· Identifies and integrates secondary data sources into the VOC analysis in order to improve the specificity and actionability of the analysis, findings and recommendations.
· Demonstrates insightful quantitative understanding of a data set. Manipulates, analyzes and visualizes data to reveal trends in customer expectations and customer perceptions of AmerisourceBergen’s performance. Identifies correlations in the data, including value drivers. Elevates key opportunities where improvement will have the greatest impact.
· Actively participates with the CXI team in presentations and workshops where findings and recommendations to improve the CX are discussed and debated. Interprets VOC analysis and effectively communicates statistical concepts in way that makes it easy to understand and is not intimidating to non-technical audiences
· With the hands-on support of the Vice President of Market Research, and preferred partners, prepares findings reports for senior executives. Using Microsoft PowerPoint, develops reports with clear, compelling, and easy to interpret data visualizations along with a narrative that translates the data into insights that convey a story or distinct point of view.
· Becomes AmerisourceBergen’s foremost expert use of Qualtrics, a best-in-class technology for research and analysis. Continuously improves proficiency in utilizing all aspects of the tool, particularly those related to analysis. May support the training other associates. Stays current on knowledge of new features/functionality and proactively brings ideas for how these can be applied to support the team’s goals
· Generates timely and concise communications appropriate for executive leadership to understand project status and pending issues.
· Monitors response rates to surveys and proactively makes recommendations on when additional action is required to accelerate participation
· Maintains a tracking program to report on budget allocated to donations in association with charitable giving for survey incentives
· Collaborates with IT, preferred vendors, and others to problem-solve through data integration requirements, survey deployment decisions, and other operational considerations related to the VOC and customer experience programs
· Manages the intern’s workflow/priorities, reviews all work contributed by intern, and provides guidance and coaching to support the intern’s professional development.
· Proactively recommends ideas to improving efficiency and quality in the team’s workflows, processes, and deliverables
· Builds and maintains strong relationships across the organization through frequent and open communication/collaboration
· Proactively seeks out and manages time to accommodate for continuous learning and development.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Typical Education
· Minimum of bachelors (advanced degree (Masters or PHD preferred) in data analytics, marketing research, statistics or computer science or related field;
· Typically requires 3+ years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience.
· Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
· Knowledge of one or more market research platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth, SPSS, Medallion)
· Proficiency in the use of statistical methodologies (regression, maxdiff, conjoint, Turf analysis, correlation, descriptive variables).
· Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics and multivariate testing
· Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
· Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas.

Work Complexity
· Designs experiments, tests hypotheses and builds statistical models.
· Employs a number of complex research methodologies (correlation matrices, turf analysis, conjoint analysis, max diff)
· Highly skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics

Market Research
· Design, test and program surveys to support VOC programs and other insight projects
· Designs qualitative and quantitative studies and aligns them to the proper use case.
· Identifies audience size, sample size, confidence level and confidence interval necessary to meet statistical validation

Strategic Planning & Project Planning
· Participates in team strategic planning sessions to support annual and long-range objectives.
· Creates and manages research project plans and tracks key milestones

Business Requirements
· Works with commercial and functional stakeholders to define business problems and develop research methodologies to gather the necessary insights that inform recommendations
· Possesses a high-level understanding of one or more business or functional areas.
· Develops key business stakeholder relationships.
· Leverages knowledge of internal and external data sources and leverages this knowledge to solve business problems
Data Requirements
· Works with others to support data collection in support of research projects and integration of internal systems (e.g. Qualtrics with SFDC) to automate data transfer.
· Works to combine customer experience data (e.g. satisfaction) and operational data (e.g. financial) to complete robust analyses and findings.

Analytics
· Solves business analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies.
· Works in iterative processes with business stakeholders and validates findings.
· Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
· Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples.

Communications and Presentation
· Presents and depicts the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business and functional groups.
· Highly effective visual depiction of data, trends, charts, graphs in compelling fashion.
· Communicates and works with stakeholders and other SME’s as required to meet project objectives.

4. What special requirements/skills you would like us to screen for (i.e.: "Must Haves")? See job description as well.
Data analytics skill, statistical modeling skills should be advanced. Intermediate to advanced experience with statistical software (R, SPSS, Qualtrics, Sawtooth etc.)

OVERVIEW

Industrial Staffing is looking for a Technology Intern with a passion for technology, collaboration, and creative problem-solving. The intern will actively contribute to meaningful projects and work under the direction of the IT Operations Lead. As a growing organization you will have an opportunity to come in at ground level and help build an exciting and innovative IT infrastructure.

ACCOUNTABLE FOR

Helping the IT Team with day-to-day process, procedures and projects.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSBILITIES:

  • Organize and maintain IT resources.

  • Support the IT team in maintaining hardware, software, and other systems.

  • Provide support in diagnosing hardware and software issues and troubleshooting activities.

  • Document all processes in reference manuals for training and guidance.

  • Assist with troubleshooting issues and provide technical support.

  • Assist in performing hardware and software installation procedures.

  • Perform software configuration on stand-alone computers and laptops.


ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBLITIES

  • Lend IT support in areas such as cybersecurity, Onboarding, analytics, and Terminations.

  • Client cables and wires for networks and ensure that they are in good working order.

  • Small Projects as needed per company need.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Basic IT knowledge with great customer service skills. Ability to work with others and multi-task.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • Working towards a Computer Science, Information Technology, or Management Information Systems major

  • Familiar with Microsoft Office Suite, basic network skills

  • Strong verbal and written communication

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

  • Ability to work well in teams and independently

  • Dependable and strong work ethic

  • Willingness to learn

Requisition ID:  65482 

Job Function/Category:  Engineering 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Part Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG's internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSEG Long Island Energy Efficiency Area is seeking a Planning and Evaluation Technical intern at our Melville location. This position will offer an opportunity for the intern to expand their knowledge of overall energy efficiency, electric vehicle and non-wire alternative efforts. The intern will be afforded a unique opportunity to work within PSEG Long Island's new and developing Datalake environment and provide opportunities for the intern to develop and demonstrate data science and analysis in support of the aforementioned areas. Assist the Energy Efficiency and Renewable Department in the areas of Electric Vehicle Charging Data analysis, Datalake querying and analysis, Non Wire alternative Request for Proposals development, and support in the launching a Pay for Performance Pilot program. The position will also be requested to support general program planning efforts for 2021 as requested based upon work requirements during the internship period.

The job duties include, but not limited to the following:
• Working with Engineer and Business Support Analyst to develop knowledge base of datalake, LodeStar and Microstrategies structure and functionality. • Developing capability in Tableau writer software capability and functionality. • Developing understanding of Juicebox and Chargepoint portals to support retrieval of customer charging data and export into Datalake. • Interfacing with all members of Planning and Evaluation team to provide data retrieval, analysis and presentation requirements. • Participate and support Energy Efficiency Planning efforts for the 2021 plan year. • Perform cost benefit analysis as requested.
Required Education/Skills : The successful candidate (s) must be actively pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in business, math, engineering, economics, computer science or similar discipline. Candidates must have completed sophomore level course work for consideration. This position requires candidates to be able to commute to the assigned work location in Melville, NY PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education, which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

Preferred Skills :

3.0 GPA

All PSEG internship roles are paid at an hourly rate, however there are no benefits associated with these positions. Candidates are expected to work 40 hours per week over the summer period for the full 10-12 week period. We are targeting currently enrolled students staying in the New York metro area for the duration of the internship and able to commute to the assigned work location. Housing, transportation, immigration Support will not be provided in association with these positions. As an employee of PSE&G or PSEG Long Island, you should be aware that during storm restoration efforts, you may be required to perform functions outside of your routine duties and on a schedule that may be different from normal operations.

This site ( http://www.pseg.com ) is strictly for candidates who are not currently PSEG employees. PSEG employees must apply for jobs internally through empower which can be accessed through the mypseg homepage by clicking on the employee center tab, then under the empower header, choose careers.

Business needs may cause PSEG to cancel or delay filling position at any time during the selection process.

Certain positions at the Company may require you to have access to Part 810-Controlled Information.  Under the law, the Company is limited in who it can share this information with and in certain circumstances it is necessary to obtain specific authorization before the Company can share this information.  Accordingly, if the position does require access to this information, you must complete a 10 CFR Part 810 Export Control Compliance Nationality Request Form, a copy of which will be provided to you by Talent Acquisition if an offer is made.  If there is a need for specific authorization, due to the time it takes to obtain authorization from the government, we will likely not be able to further proceed with an offer.

Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment, including the hiring process, based on any legal protected characteristic. Legally protected characteristics included, race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law in locations where PSEG employs individuals.

Need to request an accommodation?

If you have a disability and need assistance submitting your resume, applying for a position or registering for a test, please call 973-430-3845. Any information provided regarding a disability will be kept strictly confidential and will not be shared with anyone involved in making a hiring decision.

Dealertrack, a brand of Cox Automotive, is currently looking for a UX Research Intern to join our Engineering team in Dallas, TX

Responsibilities:

  • Identify and execute research based on analysis of existing product designs, business needs, project goals, and risks.
  • Continuously gather knowledge about customers (Internal and external) through various channels (e.g. shadowing operations teams, customer interviews/feedback.)
  • Design and conduct user research studies, including surveys, in-depth interviews, and concept/prototype testing.
  • Analyze, synthesize and present findings to all stakeholders with clarity and agility using a combination of various user feedback and research tools and your own methodologies.
  • Communicate findings and opportunities in clear, concise, and compelling ways to stakeholders.
  • Foster collaboration with designers, product managers, marketers, and operations to translate insights into actionable recommendations that inform execution.

During this time you will:

  • Become acquainted with our products, the product goals, and those you will work closely with.
  • Independently start to study and learn the Partner product suite.
  • Start shadowing key operational teams
  • Start participating in User Research Calls.

Qualifications:

  • Currently studying for a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other Technology degree. For Under Grad students, must be a rising junior or rising senior level (at least 2 years college completed). Graduate students in a technology degree may also apply.
  • Solid understanding of best practices for conducting research (qualitative and quantitative) in user experience, product design, or technology contexts. Bonus points if you have done this remotely in the past.
  • Strong analytical and synthesis skills with a proven ability to turn research results into product insights.
  • Strong understanding of statistical concepts and how to apply them in the context of user experience research.
  • Self-motivated and execution oriented. Ability to execute at a high level of quality in a fast-paced, complex environment.
  • Ability to create compelling presentations and confidently convey insights through storytelling.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to influence a range of audiences.
  • Ability to work independently and take initiative to solve problems.
  • Experience conducting remote research is considered a plus.

Internship Criteria:

  • Internship is not eligible for sponsorship
  • Preference is given to rising Seniors, Juniors and Masters students (Dec 2021, May 2022 or May 2023 graduates)
  • Field of study relevant to role
  • Ability to work approximately 10 weeks over summer months
  • Ability to work remotely

Who We Are

About Cox Automotive

Theres nothing ordinary about Cox Automotive. We are people of every background driven by our passion for mobility, innovation, client success and community outreach. We make buying, selling and owning (or simply using) cars easier for everyone. Touching more than 40,000 clients across five continents, we bring together the best brands and the best teams to propel the automotive industry forward. Some of those team members work for our iconic consumer brands like Autotrader and Kelley Blue Book, while others are creating the future of automotive at industry-facing brands like Dealer.com, Manheim and vAuto.

About Cox

We are the Cox family of businesses. Weve been making our mark since 1898 by building and evolving world-class businesses, staying true to our values, and encouraging top talent to always look for growth and impact while building a career with us. Our primary divisions - Cox Communications and Cox Automotive - are driving a new wave of innovation, powering smart cities with powerhouse broadband communications and pioneering greener, more progressive transportation alternatives for individuals and fleet operators. Were also expanding into new spaces like cleantech and healthcare to rev up our momentum toward building a better future for the next generation. Were looking for the talent today who will be our leaders tomorrow. Sound intriguing? Learn more about where we are today, where we hope youll be going with us, and the common purpose that unites us at coxenterprises.com.

Position Overview
 
The Systems Support Analyst ensures successful completion of company objectives at the infrastructure level. The main focus of the Systems Support Analyst is to program and configure company based business systems and support computer Virtualization requirements.        
          
Primary Job Functions
  • Provide Tier 2 Technical Support for internal company systems.
  • Monitor and support LANs, WANs, Internet and intranet systems.
  • Administrate infrastructure, including firewalls, databases and other systems.
  • Supports Virtualized Machines and Systems (ESXi and Hyper-V) for configuration and testing.
  • Analyze and determine both off the shelf and custom software to advance company requirements related to infrastructure.
  • Tests, troubleshoots and provides solutions to technical problems with minimal assistance.
  • Modifies and maintains existing and new internal systems.
  • Develop and support Office365 platform, .NET C++, C#, Visual Basic, Java, HTML applications.
  • Database and SQL Stored Procedure development.
  • Develop Requirements and Specifications documents.
  • Develop Test Plans and User Documentation for all supported systems.
 
Secondary Job Functions
 
  • Support customer applications as necessary.
  • Support internal IT requirements such as computer and printer setup / troubleshooting, network configuration, security and user access as required.
 
Key Competencies
 
  • Leadership
  • Demonstrates and fosters maturity in judgment, ethics and integrity.
  • Builds rapport, mentors and manages effective teams and work groups.
  • Strong decision-making skills, situational awareness and ability to perform under pressure.
  • Understands others and demonstrates cognitive and behavioral flexibility. (Emotional
  • Intelligence)
  • Functional
  • Business/Financial acumen.
  • High level of conflict resolution skills and the willingness to make difficult decisions specific to technology or resource needs.
  • Demonstrates effective organizational, time management and planning skills.
  • Possesses an appreciation of business demands (schedule, scope, budget and customer requirements).
  • Ability to analyze and evaluate work processes, work flow and budgets to maintain successful project delivery.
  • Foundational
  • Demonstrates flexibility/adaptability in changing and challenging situations.
  • Demonstrates a passion for the business and its success
  • Clear and concise verbal and written communication.
  • Demonstrates a focus on customer service and attention to detail.
  • Demonstrates a commitment to continuous personal, peer and process improvement.
  • Fosters positive energy, creativity and teamwork across all departments/locations with the goal of furthering the company values and mission.
 
Requirements
 
  • Bachelor’s Degree and 1 year of Systems Programming or Networking (Electrical, Computer Science, Information Systems) experience, or a minimum of 5 years of Systems Programming or Networking experience (includes relevant intern, co-op, or basic work experience).
  • Proficient with Office365 platform and multiple programming languages such as .NET, C#, Java, HTML, and SQL.
  • VMWare Certified Professional or the ability to obtain within 6 months of employment.
  • Valid driver’s license.
  • Reliable personal transportation with valid liability insurance.
  • Fluent in verbal and written English.
  • Available for after-hour, weekend and holidays.
  • Available for overnight and extended travel.

Deliver business value through Right and Fast partnership

HBS installs, integrates and maintains the systems that keep facilities safe, secure, comfortable, productive and energy efficient. You will work with critical building management, HVAC and security systems  with the opportunity to work on a range of commercial and government buildings, health care facilities, airports and correction facilities. In this role you will provide support to our ICT/ Cyber specialists to design, engineer, configure, implement and commission Information

 

 

Have the opportunity to assist on high-level designs using the best of breed technology to support Honeywell systems, including servers, storage, virtualization, and networking. Exposure to/knowledge of virtualization technologies like VMware ESX and/or Microsoft Hyper-V to implement designs will be very beneficial.

 

Assist with technical OT/IT knowledge required to support integration requirements to support customer sites with a heavy focus on securely integrating systems via open building protocols into Honeywell software platforms.  Understanding of emerging IOT technologies as applies to building control systems (i.e. access controls, temperature sensing, smart lighting, facial recognition, navigation controls, RFID sensor controls, etc.)

 

Provide consulting based on current technical knowledge as to the design, procurement, configuration and implementation of the underlying architecture and technologies for new Honeywell based systems.

YOU MUST HAVE

 

Be in your penultimate (rising senior) year of Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Similar IT/ Systems degree. A major in Security would be highly desirable.

 

Be a citizen or have permanent residence for the United States at the time of your application.

 

Ability to travel locally as required to provide support at customer sites

 

WE VALUE

Self-motivated, ability to meet deadlines and work well under pressure, determine own work priorities, work independently and as part of a team.

Excellent analytical and problem solving skills

Ability to develop innovative and creative solutions in a complex multiple systems environment.

Some basic network fault finding capability

A good understanding of virtualization, networking, servers, storage, and enterprise applications

Excellent effective communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills, along with proven ability to interact professionally with clients

position: Summer 2021 Technical Intern - Electric Asset Strategy; Project Origination
description:
Requisition ID:  65465 

Job Function/Category:  University Recruiting 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Part Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG's internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSEG is seeking a summer intern to work in the Electric Asset Strategy - Project Origination team

• Support the Utility Business Plan with pipeline projects by providing engineering support for feasibility studies • Perform 2D layout designs, 3D modelling design, Building Information Modeling (BIM), Augmented Reality (AR), and Virtual Reality (VR) projects • Training on drawing and modeling in Microstation Connect, using a 3D printer and other technology • Learn how to use VR software and apply it to an ongoing engineering project • Participate in team substation site visits and training sessions to review engineering drawings (i.e. one-line, control drawings, general arrangements, bus plans, foundation plans, etc.) • Learn basic fundamentals of transmission and distribution substation equipment • Develop a time-lapse video to highlight part-making with a 3D printer • Create and manipulate a substation in 3D using Microstation Connect • Develop 3D parts for Project Origination's substation equipment library • Print a station using 3D printer • Plot a station in both augmented and virtual reality and apply metadata to components • Conduct a station review meeting utilizing AR and/or VR • Develop presentation and video brochure for final presentation • Shadow another AMCS intern in the program and present on what they learned
Required Education/Skills: The successful candidate (s) must be actively pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or similar related major. PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education, which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

3.0 GPA; .

All PSEG internship roles are paid at an hourly rate, however there are no benefits associated with these positions. Candidates are expected to work 40 hours per week over the summer period for the full 10-12 week period. Housing, transportation, immigration Support will not be provided in association with these positions. As an employee of PSE&G or PSEG Long Island, you should be aware that during storm restoration efforts, you may be required to perform functions outside of your routine duties and on a schedule that may be different from normal operations.

This site ( http://www.pseg.com ) is strictly for candidates who are not currently PSEG employees. PSEG employees must apply for jobs internally through empower which can be accessed through the mypseg homepage by clicking on the employee center tab, then under the empower header, choose careers.

Business needs may cause PSEG to cancel or delay filling position at any time during the selection process.

#LI-EZ1

POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the general direction of the Vice President of Market Research, and in partnership with cross-functional internal partners, this hands-on role works primarily on Voice of the Customer primary market research and related analysis. This role requires significant coordination with cross-functional stakeholders. The role also coordinates the work of preferred partner vendors to augment the team's capacity and identifies when an elevated level of expertise is warranted to support project objectives. This role manages the CXI team's intern and may manage full time direct reports. The Market Manager will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work while exemplifying the company's guiding principles.

In addition, the market research manager works closely with a number of key roles, stakeholders and functions across the organization to include but not limited to the following: business stakeholders (sales), financial analysts, customer operations, customer solutions, distribution operations and marketing. S/he needs to be a creative thinker and propose innovative approaches to data collection and analyses. The market research manager should know statistical methods and internal data sets to complete research projects. In addition, the market research manager will understand and effectively employ a number of ways to visualize data in a way that is highly effective and persuasive.

Finally, the market research manager must be inherently analytical and have a high level of curiosity in getting to next level understanding of insights behind the data. Excellent written and communications skills will also be a necessity for this role.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Reviews research briefs to understand objectives and consults on the design of surveys to ensure the data collected will facilitate the right analysis to generate findings that support the objectives
Independently programs and tests surveys, including the development of call to action and thank you messages, uploads respondent data, and deploys surveys
Integrates data from outside sources into Qualtrics and utilizes Qualtrics analytical tools to develop findings
Builds dashboards, provides training on optimal use, and continuously finds ways to improve data visualizations and incorporate new Qualtrics features within the dashboards
Calculates required respondents to achieve desired confidence level. Checks and ensures data validity. Identifies when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate.
Conducts analysis of Voice of the Customer data. Demonstrates strong proficiency with all Qualtrics analytical tools.
Identifies and integrates secondary data sources into the VOC analysis in order to improve the specificity and actionability of the analysis, findings and recommendations.
Demonstrates insightful quantitative understanding of a data set. Manipulates, analyzes and visualizes data to reveal trends in customer expectations and customer perceptions of company's performance. Identifies correlations in the data, including value drivers. Elevates key opportunities where improvement will have the greatest impact.
Actively participates with the CXI team in presentations and workshops where findings and recommendations to improve the CX are discussed and debated. Interprets VOC analysis and effectively communicates statistical concepts in way that makes it easy to understand and is not intimidating to non-technical audiences
With the hands-on support of the Vice President of Market Research, and preferred partners, prepares findings reports for senior executives. Using Microsoft PowerPoint, develops reports with clear, compelling, and easy to interpret data visualizations along with a narrative that translates the data into insights that convey a story or distinct point of view.
Becomes the company's foremost expert use of Qualtrics, a best-in-class technology for research and analysis. Continuously improves proficiency in utilizing all aspects of the tool, particularly those related to analysis. May support the training other associates. Stays current on knowledge of new features/functionality and proactively brings ideas for how these can be applied to support the team's goals
Generates timely and concise communications appropriate for executive leadership to understand project status and pending issues.
Monitors response rates to surveys and proactively makes recommendations on when additional action is required to accelerate participation
Maintains a tracking program to report on budget allocated to donations in association with charitable giving for survey incentives
Collaborates with IT, preferred vendors, and others to problem-solve through data integration requirements, survey deployment decisions, and other operational considerations related to the VOC and customer experience programs
Manages the intern's workflow/priorities, reviews all work contributed by intern, and provides guidance and coaching to support the intern's professional development.
Proactively recommends ideas to improving efficiency and quality in the team's workflows, processes, and deliverables
Builds and maintains strong relationships across the organization through frequent and open communication/collaboration
Proactively seeks out and manages time to accommodate for continuous learning and development.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
Typical Education
Minimum of bachelors (advanced degree (Masters or PHD preferred) in data analytics, marketing research, statistics or computer science or related field;
Typically requires 3+ years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience.
Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
Knowledge of one or more market research platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth, SPSS, Medallion)
Proficiency in the use of statistical methodologies (regression, maxdiff, conjoint, Turf analysis, correlation, descriptive variables).
Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics and multivariate testing
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas.

Work Complexity
Designs experiments, tests hypotheses and builds statistical models.
Employs a number of complex research methodologies (correlation matrices, turf analysis, conjoint analysis, max diff)
Highly skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics

Market Research
Design, test and program surveys to support VOC programs and other insight projects
Designs qualitative and quantitative studies and aligns them to the proper use case.
Identifies audience size, sample size, confidence level and confidence interval necessary to meet statistical validation

Strategic Planning & Project Planning
Participates in team strategic planning sessions to support annual and long-range objectives.
Creates and manages research project plans and tracks key milestones

Business Requirements
Works with commercial and functional stakeholders to define business problems and develop research methodologies to gather the necessary insights that inform recommendations
Possesses a high-level understanding of one or more business or functional areas.
Develops key business stakeholder relationships.
Leverages knowledge of internal and external data sources and leverages this knowledge to solve business problems
Data Requirements
Works with others to support data collection in support of research projects and integration of internal systems (e.g. Qualtrics with SFDC) to automate data transfer.
Works to combine customer experience data (e.g. satisfaction) and operational data (e.g. financial) to complete robust analyses and findings.

Analytics
Solves business analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies.
Works in iterative processes with business stakeholders and validates findings.
Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples.

Communications and Presentation
Presents and depicts the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business and functional groups.
Highly effective visual depiction of data, trends, charts, graphs in compelling fashion.
Communicates and works with stakeholders and other SME's as required to meet project objectives.

Ideally this would be someone with healthcare experience and has done B2B work. Familiar with SPSS, Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth and other market research, statistical software.

description:

Web publishing and development skills in HTML and XML are a plus. Familiarity with the Microsoft Office suite desired. A valid/clear driver's license is required.

Job Purpose:

This position is responsible for the management, development, and user support of the GIS and other engineering systems and tools that are used in support of the outside plant and access network planning. Additionally, this position is responsible for designing, developing, deploying and maintaining a data base system for dashboards and reports within the engineering organization. These systems directly support the corporate strategic direction in the planning and design of CBT's evolving access and outside plant network to provide the best customer experience along with capital efficiency, ease of service and network reliability. This position has a direct impact on the success of corporate's network initiatives by supporting complex business problems through use of systems and data from multiple resources.

Essential Functions:

  • Perform advanced GIS functions including models, scripting and application development
  • Utilize GIS and associated software to produce, display, and analyze geographic information; creates case maps for internal and external customers
  • Develops ArcGIS Pro projects/layouts for the fulfillment of data requests as necessary

  • Prepare, update, and maintain graphic displays, databases, reports, statistical information and maps as requested

  • Build compelling, interactive and actionable reporting and dashboards on top of structured data models that help in deriving meaningful business insights
  • Support the full lifecycle from requirements analysis through design and development as well as release and support phases
  • Produce models incorporating multiple data sources into reports and make recommendations which enable decision making
  • Provide ad-hoc reporting support and activities in a collaborative environment

Education:

  • Four years of College resulting in a Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
  • Bachelor's Degree in Geography, GIS, Computer Science, Planning, Engineering, Surveying or related field

General Work Experience:

2 to 3 years

Previous Work Experience:

  • Experience in the use and administration of Esri ArcGis as well as advanced GIS functions including models and scripting
  • Advanced knowledge of GIS-related software, products and services: Python, C#, Sql.
  • Experience with visualizations within Power BI (or similar) using multiple sources such as SQL server, Excel, Esri ArcGis
  • Skill in researching, compiling, and summarizing statistical data and information materials
  • Utility industry background preferred with knowledge of utility infrastructure components
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships and communications with internal and external customers
  • Ability to work remotely, organize work, establish priorities, meet established deadlines, and follow up on assignments with a minimum of direction
  • Python, JavaScript, Java, SQL preferred

Special Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Esri ArcGis experience is required
  • Oracle and Sql database experience required

Supervisory Responsibility:

Co-op, intern or contractor resources as needed

We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

Primary Job Duties and Responsibilities (Essential Job Function)

Development of technical or vocational college students who are pursuing an associate degree in applied science in a technical discipline. A Pipeline Technician Intern will be exposed to a variety of pipeline and compressor station operations, pipeline maintenance and other project activities that will provide an opportunity to apply knowledge and skills learned in college and demonstrate abilities in the workplace.

Typical Duties

Under the direction of the operations manager or team leader, support the teams and region specialists with daily operations, maintenance tasks, project activities or administrative duties.

Perform any additional responsibilities as requested or assigned.


Technical Skill Areas
Pipeline Technician Interns are multi-skilled employees who support Northern’s operational goals in each of the following technical areas based on company needs.

Controls - Install, maintain and troubleshoot programmable logic controllers, human machine interfaces, motor control centers, and medium and low voltage power distribution and pneumatic control devices utilized in pipeline operations.

Measurement - Program, maintain, operate and troubleshoot gas measurement equipment including gas meters, control valves, relief valves, regulators and associated software, as well as monitoring gas and quality control equipment.

Corrosion - Install, maintain and troubleshoot corrosion protection equipment to ensure pipeline integrity. NACE CP1 Tester certification is preferred.

Mechanical - Install, maintain, troubleshoot, overhaul and repair rotating and reciprocating compression equipment.

Liquefied Natural Gas Operations - Ensure reliable operation and maintenance of processes required to make liquefied natural gas.

Underground Storage Operations - Ensure reliable operation and maintenance of processes required to store and deliver natural gas from underground reservoirs.

Compressor Station Operations - Ensure reliable operation of compressor station equipment.

Pipeline - Perform pigging operations, damage prevention measures and pipeline right of way maintenance.

Equipment Operation - Transport, inspect, maintain and operate various mobile heavy equipment including backhoes, boom trucks, semi-trucks, dump trucks, excavators, skid loaders, etc. Additional endorsements for hazmat and liquefied natural gas transportation are available.

Welding - Pipeline welders must be qualified in API 1104 and ASME standards to weld on natural gas pipelines. Structural welders must be qualified in AWS standards.

Environmental - Maintain environmental standards, environmental activities and regulatory compliance for assigned locations.

Student currently enrolled in a technical or associate of applied science degree program from an accredited college. Areas of study include:

-Aviation Maintenance Technology
-Diesel Technology or Diesel Mechanics
-Natural Gas Technology or Natural Gas Transmission
-Natural Gas Measurement
-Gas Industrial Mechanics
-Natural Gas Compression Technology
-Electro-mechanical System Technology or Electrical Maintenance Technology
-Electronic Engineering Technology, Electronic System Technology, Electrical System Technology, Automated Systems Engineering, Instrument & Control Technology or Industrial Automation Technology
-Corrosion Technology

Proficiency with personal computer and various software (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, etc.).

Effective oral and written communication skills.

Effective analytical and problem-solving skills.

Support the company’s employee policies and procedures, including workplace safety rules.

Comfortable operating various computer applications including Microsoft Office programs.

Ability to read and understand pipeline maps and alignment sheets

Mechanical aptitude

Able to work outdoors in all types of climate conditions.

Able to work in close quarters, work while kneeling, squatting, sitting, climbing and standing; also able to climb up and down ladders, stairs and platforms.

Employees must be able to perform the essential functions of the position, with or without an accommodation.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges

Honeywell Quantum Solutions is focused on developing the world’smost advanced quantum computers, with ‘full stack’ capability from userinterface software to the hardware layer and trapped ions. Our team’s expertisein complex hardware and software control systems, advanced optics and lasers,magnetics, cryogenics, atomic physics, and ultra-high vacuum environments isbeing used to design and build systems with unmatched error rates andcapabilities.

We are seeking undergraduate level researchers in physics to joinour theory team and help us understand how to analyze and optimize theperformance of our quantum computers.

You would be working closely with ourOptics team in development and assembly of optical assemblies, performingoptical experiments on breadboards, analyzing and summarizing data fromexperiments, and performing analysis and/or calculations associated with theoptical systems.

Explore integrated photonics ideas for next generation Beam Delivery

Collaborate with the larger Opto-Mechanical team and provide creative solutions.

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, an MS or PhD degree in the field of Physics, Optical Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Experience with theoretical and practical aspects of imaging and laser optics, including micro optics
Experience with scientific programming languages or optical simulation tools such as Matlab, Python, COMSOL, or similar
Interpersonal skills: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration

WE VALUE

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG's internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSE&G is seeking a Utility Technology intern for the summer of 2021.

Summer interns will assist engineers on various DSCADA projects which include supporting Energy Strong II.

• RTU Asset Database - Record SCADA devices in the asset database for inventory tracking

• Energy Strong II Reporting - help automate reporting in SQL (for example, perform SAP data dumps for cost control purposes)

• Assist with ServiceNow Tickets by tracking open tickets and work engineers to resolve

• Assist team member on SCADA data metric reporting and automate process

• Assist with Remote Device Management (RDM) project activities and other SCADA projects

Assist in providing business support to the Distribution SCADA (D-SCADA) initiatives which includes but is not limited to:

• Work with the Engineers within GE&C on Energy Strong 2 to support project schedules, budgets, and associated reporting • Analyze reports to ensure functionality and performance meet all product and service level requirements • Provide support on asset tracking • Use tools such as SQL to automate reporting and assist with data governance • Applies Agile concepts, practices, and procedures

Candidates need to be able to meet deadlines, juggle competing priorities, operate independently while knowing when to ask for help or guidance, and view all work from a customer's perspective..

PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education, which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

Housing, transportation, immigration Support will not be provided in association with these positions.

Nearest Major Market: New Jersey
Job Segment: Architecture, Intern, Utility, Engineer, Engineering, Entry Level, Energy, Operations

The Role

The Vice President will be responsible for building the analytics backbone for the TV sales distribution business, develop pricing models and advanced analytics techniques to support TV’s most strategic deals; help define deal strategies and collaborate with the teams around the world to obtain support and adoption of techniques and tools. The candidate must have

  • Exceptional analytical and financial modelling skills; background in business analytics and experience with data visualization tools.
  • Significant experience in bringing together business and analytics to deliver impact.
  • Ability to structure complex analytical problems and bring clarity in ambiguous situations.
  • Experience deriving and presenting insights to executives; be able to tell data stories through visuals.
  • Big picture thinker but also hands on and willing to dive into details. 

The Vice President will have three direct reports and an intern and will collaborate with regional analytics team members. The position will have an opportunity for international travel.

The Responsibilities
DEAL ANALYTICS & STRATEGIC INTIATIVES (40%):

  • DEAL ANALYTICS: Work with Sr Sales leaders to support major local/pan-regional deal negotiations. Provide Sales with actionable insights through deal analysis, title performance analysis and deal ROI analysis. Collaborate with various teams to provide recommendations on pricing, title curation and deal structures. Work cross functionally with sales strategy, sales planning, finance and research; build strong working relationships with Sr. executives in these teams.
  • STRATEGIC INTIATIVES: Lead efforts to provide analytics and tools/capabilities for SPE’s strategic initiatives. Work directly with the senior leaders driving these initiatives, pro-actively asses needs, succinctly communicate and get alignment and work cross-functionally to deliver outputs.

INNOVATION & TOOLS (40%)

Be a data and analytics evangelist in the organization. Promote and enable data-driven decision-making across the organization by creating capabilities that solve business problems.

  • DATA: Work with IT, Finance, Research and other internal teams as required to obtain needed data sources. Guide the team to clean and structure data such that it can be used rapidly for custom analysis and support tools. Guide with business logic along to shape technical path.
  • SELF-SERVICE TOOLS: Translate the analytics solutions for high impact business problems into self-service tools. Create business logic that the team then implements using data and analytics technologies (Tableau, Alteryx/Predictive Modeling Techniques, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence)
  • PRICING – Enhance methods/models used for pricing and deal valuations.
  • o Bring thought leadership on emerging businesses of AVOD and SVOD - including strategies and tools for pricing and title curation. 
  • o Bring analytical rigor on pricing and analytical frameworks. Develop techniques to evaluate SVOD title categorization and determine the percent and value of unsold product.
  • SPECIAL DATA PROJECTS – Work with other teams on strategic data projects.

BEST PRACTICES & THOUGHT LEADERSHIP (20%)

Push the organization towards new and improved ways to use data to draw insights and improve negotiations.

  • Lead discussions and annual conferences with Sales and Planners regarding new tools, analysis techniques that can help improve negotiations.
  • In collaboration with the regional teams capture best practices. 
  • Mentor Sales and Planning by packaging case studies and conducting regular sessions to share ideas/ approaches.

EDUCATION  

  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Statistics, Physics, Math, Engineering, Economics, Management, Finance, Data Science or Computer Science.
  • 7-10 years’ work experience.
  • Prior experience in management consulting or similar strategic roles (ideally with experience of running analytics projects or modules) and/or experience in an analytics role at an entertainment company.

SKILLS

  • Experience and skills to manage and nurture a team.
  • Ability to interact confidently with senior executives, be receptive but also have a point of view.
  • Ability to create a culture of collaboration with regional analytics teams by providing mentorship as needed.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills. Ability to tell a clear, concise, and actionable story with data.
  • Attention to the layout and design of how analytical information is presented.
  • Strong intellectual curiosity and love of problem-solving with a passion for getting involved to drive action for direct impact on business outcomes.
  • Self-motivated and able to operate independently with limited guidance and direction.
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, taking the initiative, managing multiple projects, and working under tight timeframes.
  • Has the courage to challenge ideas.

Description:

Sr. Software Engineer

We are currently seeking a Sr. Software Engineer for our Lafayette, LA location.

**This position can sit in Lafayette, LA OR be remote with travel required**

We are seeking a talented Senior Software Engineer to help us improve our world class autonomy platform. We are a fast-paced team specializing in building next generation autonomy for surface vessels employing state of the art technology from a variety of fields – operator interfaces, sensing, planning, and hardware control. Our product allows naval vessels to operate fully autonomously while safely reacting to the world around it. With over 100 vessels in operation and 2,000 days logged at sea our product is one of the best solutions in the world and we are leading the effort toward naval autonomy in commercial and defense spaces.

Our software developers are a team of highly talented individuals. We take pride in the quality of our product, and we encourage all our developers to take ownership and personal responsibility. We have a strong culture of review and mentoring as part of our collaborative commitment to excellence. Our goal is to provide an extremely accessible work environment that empowers developers to tackle hard problems. We value the best ideas, whether from an intern or a lead, and every individual can have a significant impact on our success.

Our success is due to the people we employ – if you’re smart, adaptable, highly productive, a team player, and relish the challenge that comes with solving difficult problems, join us.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, document, develop, integrate, and test software using C++
  • Participate in peer reviews of design and software
  • Participate in requirements development
  • Participate in system architecture development
  • Participate in project estimation, scheduling, and tasking
  • Provide technical supervision and mentoring of developers

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering or related field
  • Must be a US Citizen with the ability to obtain a US DoD Secret clearance
  • At least Six (6) years of professional software development experience
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Strong working knowledge of computer science theory and practice
  • Strong working knowledge of software development using modern C++ and STL
  • Strong working knowledge of collaborative software development in a Linux environment
  • Knowledge of design patterns
  • Ability to travel 10% of time.

In compliance with Colorado’s Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the salary range for this role in Colorado is $87,500 - $162,000. This is not a guarantee of compensation or salary, as final offer amount may vary based on factors including but not limited to experience and geographic location. L3Harris also offers a variety of benefits including: health and disability insurance, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, EAP, education assistance, parental leave, paid time off, and company-paid holidays. The specific programs and options available to an employee may vary depending on date of hire, schedule type, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

position: Sr. Assembler Programmer DB2 - Sr. Software Engineer
description:
Sr. Assembler Programmer DB2 – Sr. Software Engineer

 

Sr. Assembler Programmer Job Description Summary

The Senior Software Engineer designs, develops, troubleshoots, debugs, and sets the direction for the design and implementation of software features/functionality/enhancements, correction of defects, and/or the creation of new products. Develops software tools including operating systems, compilers, routers, networks, utilities, databases, and Internet-related tools. Determines software’s compatibility with hardware and/or influences software's design in relation to hardware.

Sr. Assembler Programmer Job Overview

The Senior Software Engineer designs, develops, troubleshoots, debugs, and sets the direction for the design and implementation of software features/functionality/enhancements, correction of defects, and/or the creation of new products. Develops software tools including operating systems, compilers, routers, networks, utilities, databases, and Intern et-related tools. Determines software’s compatibility with hardware and/or influences software's design in relation to hardware.

Sr. Assembler Programmer Essential Duties & Responsibilities

  • Review and provide feedback on designs.
  • Takes ownership of the design and development of features within their component.
  • Recognizes and practically solves for anti-patterns.
  • Good understanding of how his/her work aligns with high-level use cases and team deliverables.
  • Define (more than a feature, less than a product) a component that fits into an architecture.
  • Describe and defend design decisions for components owned by the team.
  • Optimize software design to leverage platform capabilities.
  • Acts as the technical subject matter expert for a product domain.
  • Quantify and communicate work estimates and risks to direct management
  • Handle multiple competing priorities with minimal help
  • Understand features as a whole and able to break down larger stories and features into tasks
  • Familiar with most of the technologies we focus on and what markets they target
  • Takes ownership of customer issues and effectively communicate with Support/SEs to resolve field questions/issues
  • Discuss with customers what larger concerns and problems they are trying to solve, over and above the immediate technical concerns
  • Willingness to teach and grow junior team members
  • Excellent listening skills
  • Effectively works within the team and across teams
  • Ensures all tasks are completed thoroughly and that any work done is tested, unit tested, documented, and ready for customers
  • Takes identified problems and concerns and create a plan to fix the problem and prevent it from occurring again
  • Follows through on all tasks
  • Reliably delivers expected work products and outcomes
  • Imparts a sense of urgency on junior team member s
     

Sr. Assembler Programmer Required Qualifications

  • 8+ years of software engineering experience
  • Assembler language programming.
  • A minimum of 8 years hands-on, consistent experience with z/OS / mainframe computers
  • A minimum of 8 years experience in DB2 performance tuning for z/OS
  • Mastery of data structures and algorithms.
  • Able to select data structures and algorithms to solve technical problems.
  • Able to write high-quality code rapidly.
  • Able to present a track record of solving problems of increasing complexity
  • Good understanding of trade-offs in solving problems that have variable levels of complexity.
  • Deep understanding of memory allocation and management mechanism, security mechanisms, processing allocation mechanisms of target operating systems.
     

Sr. Assembler Programmer Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with at least 1 of the following: Java, C, Web app programming, JavaScript/dojo, CSS, HTML
  • Writes code faster than the average developer.
  • Outstanding quality with few bugs in generated code.
     

Sr. Assembler Programmer Education

Bachelors/ Masters’ degree in Computer Science or equivalent

Sr. Assembler Programmer Travel Requirements

0-10%

TITLE:                            Senior Data Scientist/Engineer

 

COMPANY:                    AMI Group, LLC

 

REPORTS TO:               Chief Executive Officer

 

SALARY RANGE:        $120,000 - $140,000

 

JOB SUMMARY

 

Primarily responsible for providing data science support for various projects within Chicago Parking Meters, LLC (“CPM”).  The Senior Data Scientist assists in overseeing the activities of the data analyst(s) and provides advanced expertise and guidance on statistical and mathematical concepts for the data and analytics team. The Senior Data Scientist applies and inspires the adoption of advanced data science and analytics across the business.

The Senior Data Scientist synthesizes and leverages CPM’s data to enhance the business’ capabilities for overall goal achievement. The Senior Data Scientist is instrumental in helping the business continue its evolution into an analytical and data-driven culture.

This role of the Senior Data Scientist supports relevant stakeholders through quantitative analytics, and the application of appropriate advanced analytics for CPM’s key initiatives.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

 

  1. Provide advanced analysis, recommendations, and support for various projects within CPM. Projects include the rollout and ongoing performance measurement for CPM’s parking meter system and process improvements. The position will support and contribute to the success of these projects, including one or more of the following functions:

 

  1. Collect and manage project data, organize, analyze, and prepare reports on vendor and system performance.
  2. Develop statistical models in key areas of parking data including enforcement and demand.
  3. Assist in identifying and measuring Key Performance Indicators in numerous operational areas.
  4. Develop an understanding of the parking meter system requirements and project goals. Drawing upon this understanding and the collected project data, investigate options, draw conclusions and/or make recommendations as required.

 

  1. Manage the collection of meter data, which is supplied through the operator and meter equipment software and provide analysis of this data. As required, provide input and recommendations for leveraging this data to drive improved asset performance.

 

  1. Develop and support profitability analyses and models, including potential revenue, projected cost-savings, and operating efficiency maximization models. Recommend and develop automated processes for collecting data and managing output for these models. Participate in the development of industry leading work process, technology, revenue collection, and profitability analysis initiatives. 

 

  1. Implement and handle end-to-end data science products and analytics.

 

  1. Manipulate and extract ‘big data’ from large, disconnected datasets that can require complex queries and advanced knowledge of SQL with familiarity in a variety of databases.

 

  1. Work closely with team members and assist in developing the technical, statistical, and analytical skillsets of the data analyst(s). Direct and review the work of data analyst(s) and intern(s) to complete projects as required.

 

 


SKILLS, EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

 

At least five years of data science experience, preferably working as a Senior Data Scientist and/or Data Engineer.  The candidate must also have had substantial experience working on strategy or full-life cycle data science as well as experience working with data mining tools such as Python, SQL and R. A suitable candidate for this position will also have had experience in data mining and predictive modeling including linear and non-linear regression, logistic regression, and time series analysis models. Statistical machine learning experience is preferred.   The candidate will also have had experience working with deep learning algorithms and large datasets as well as experience working with unstructured data and experience cleaning and manipulating data.

The Senior Data Scientist should have at least a bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or any other related quantitative field.  A master’s degree in a similar analytical field is preferred. 

 

The candidate must have the ability to organize and prioritize work, and to interpret and present information clearly and professionally.  Must be proactive, meet assigned deadlines, be able to work both independently and as part of a team, must have a strong ability to mobilize people and work with both internal and external contacts.

 

 


All applicants will be afforded equal opportunity without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identification, marital status, national origin or ancestry, age, physical or mental handicap unrelated to ability, or an unfavorable discharge from military service.

 

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

position: New Grad- Product Development- Cloud Management Performance Engineer
description:
VMware Product Intern and New Graduate Opportunities:

VMware recognizes that today’s students are tomorrow’s trailblazers and we value the opportunity to benefit from your fresh perspective. If you thrive in an open, innovative, technology-driven culture, VMware could be the place for you! You will be exposed to a wide range of software platform technologies that are utilized by customers all over the world.

Business Summary

The VMware Engineering Services team ensures our internal and external customers enjoy a high-quality experience across the entire product portfolio. Our goal is to provide compelling, innovative, scalable, and seamless engineering services, which will protect VMware’s brand reputation by continually improving customer satisfaction. We bring together key R&D functions such as build, performance, security, release management (and more), which frees up R&D business units to focus on product innovation. Our priorities include investing in R&D talent, sharing best practices, and driving scale and agility in VMware products. 

Job Role and Responsibility 

As a New Graduate at VMware, you’ll create innovative solutions and solve complex problems. You’ll take ownership of meaningful, big-picture projects and springboard into an impactful career. At VMware, you will become immersed in all aspects of our innovative and collaborative culture, and ensure you get the full VMware experience. You’ll interact with industry thought leaders and enjoy networking, community service, and career development events.

In VMware’s Performance Engineering team, you will drive scalability and performance of VMware’s management suite of products, that consists of vCenter Server (VC) and emerging cloud management software. You will learn in-depth about the existing solutions and products, new upcoming technologies and hardware trends. You will develop solutions to improve performance and scalability, write benchmarks to evaluate performance and identify and root cause performance issues. You will also be working with various cross functional teams with the opportunity to research ways to stress next generation software architectures for performance and cloud scale. You will have the opportunity to innovate in multiple ways.

  • Study workload characteristics to create a balanced suite of performance workloads

  • Develop standard benchmarks for performance measurement

  • Develop and automate performance measurement and data analysis tools

  • Develop performance diagnostics tools in the products

  • Analyze product performance and scalability across a variety of hardware and software configurations

  • Understand the products in depth to be able to identify bottlenecks in code/design/architecture

  • Root-cause performance problems and implement solutions to resolve them

Required Skills:

  • Pursuing Bachelor’s, Master’s in Computer Science or equivalent 

  • Coursework (in some) of the following: Operating systems, computer architecture, algorithms, storage, networking or distributed systems. 

  • Strong programming skills in Java. Go and Python is a plus.

  • School and/or industry projects involving significant design and development

  • Strong written and spoken communication skills

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience in performance measurement and analysis

  • Experience with application profiling tools such as Yourkit/JProfiler/Jprobe or Zoom/xperf

  • Experience in cloud management or micro-service architecture and related technologies like Docker, Kubernetes etc.

  • Previous internship experience is a plus

  • Interest to grow your career under a progressive team that emphasizes teamwork
