position: Staff Scientist, Ingredient Technology Development R&D
description:
Job Location: Hershey, PA
 


 


 


Summary:  
The Staff Scientist uses food science principles to lead ingredient technology development research projects and programs.  One key focus area of current research will be program leadership of chocolate, sweets, and/or snacks ingredient technology development research related to better for you initiatives and sugar reduction, from benchtop to pilot scale, and commercialization supporting both ingredient development and finished product.  Additionally, he/she will lead program technical strategy development, project design and methodology, test ideas through experimentation, and determine next steps through problem solving.  The successful candidate will be leading projects and programs of higher complexity and apply technical rigor to ensure project goals and business objectives are achieved.  He/she will need to be able to prioritize his/her work and contribute to strategic directions within R&D.  He/she will progress technical research, by disciplined application of the scientific method through the project management process and the transfer of knowledge to Product Development, Commercialization and/or Operations teams. Hands-on skills involving running laboratory and pilot plant equipment is required.  In addition to working with R&D team members, the staff scientist is expected to be able to work along side our cross-functional partners in Marketing, Product Development, Sensory, Manufacturing, Legal, Engineering, Quality and other Supply Chain  departments as well as our M&A partners.  This staff scientist will also need to demonstrate excellent organizational and communication skills as he/she develops technical strategies and shares proposals and updates with cross functional teams and leadership across our organization.



Major Duties/Responsibilities:  
Project and Program Leadership for Technology Development        
-Actively seek new technologies and innovation opportunities. 
-Lead chocolate technology development worksteams for both ingredient development and finished products from bench top to pilot to commercial scale which may focus on BFY goals.
-Test ideas through experimental design, collect and analyze data using analytical process tools to provide recommendations.
-Determine next steps through problem solving. 
-Collaborate with cross-functional groups to ideate, identify, develop solutions, and commercialize new technologies. 
-Have a good understanding of current ingredient technologies across snacks and confectionery industry and continue to explore new and breakthrough opportunities.
-Mentor and guide junior scientists and engineers within R&D. 
-Provide leadership and instruction to technicians. 
-Ability to connect and interact with peers from other within and other industries  to exchange information and ideas in area of expertise where appropriate.


Ingredient Technology Development; lab & pilot-plant equipment operation
Operate or direct the operation of lab and/or pilot-plant equipment in the
performance of  tests or experiments. Lead the development of new 
ideas through research and experimentation to deliver project results.
Hands-on work involving running lab, and pilot plant product manufacturing and characterization equipment. 
Research design/data analysis/report writing/ presentation  
Design and execute experiments, analyze data and provide conclusions using an appropriate statistical tool. Prepare all project reports as required. Make presentations of significant results to drive business decisions.



Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:  
•Experience leading a cross-functional team in a development of new ingredient technologies. 
•Sound technical knowledge and capability of applying knowledge to research projects. 
•Understanding of the fundamentals of chocolate including formulations, manufacturing, forming, and downstream processes. 
•Understanding of the impact of the key processing parameters in the conversion of raw ingredient and in-process material to finished product. 
•Demonstrated excellence in project leadership and decision making ability.
•Comfortable with operating pilot plant and/or lab equipment. 
•Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
•Demonstrated mathematical and statistical skills. 
•Possesses computer skills (basic knowledge of Word, Access, Excel, Exchange)
•Ability to work in a team environment and independently in a flexible work environment with changing priorities. 



Minimum Education and Experience Requirements:  
Education:BS in Food Science, Food or Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, or related field required. MS preferred but not required. 
Experience:10+ years (B.S. food science / food engineering) or 7+ years (M.S.) in R&D environment, or 4+years (PhD) in R&D environment. Product development experience strongly preferred. Confectionery experience in chocolate, sweets and/or snacks is strongly preferred.  Intern and prior research project work will be considered.

position: Computer Science Intern - Alliance Animal Health - Stamford, CT
description:
Company Description

Alliance Animal Health is a multi-site business partner to veterinarians across the US. Our network of general practice and emergency hospitals is as individual as you, and we like it that way! Our team of highly skilled partners and associate veterinarians work hard to deliver the quality of personalized care and attention that our profession deserves. We pride ourselves on maintaining a culture of open communication and collaboration to remain innovative and cutting edge in today’s veterinary environment without disrupting the medical autonomy of our qualified veterinarians.

The Computer Science Intern is responsible for assisting with automation across multiple verticals within the business. The position will utilize abilities in engineering and computer science to drive efficiency and speed up time-consuming processes including financial reporting, KPI dashboards, weekly clinic production/revenue reports, and more.

Job Description

  • Create algorithms that can be run easily to automate reporting processes

position: Deep Learning Intern- Smart Data Selection
description:
Company Description

_The Bosch Research and Technology Center North America with offices in Sunnyvale, California, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and Cambridge, Massachusetts is part of the global Bosch Group (_ _www.bosch.com_ _), a company with over 70 billion euro revenue, 400,000 people worldwide, a very diverse product portfolio, and a history of over 125 years. The Research and Technology Center North America (RTC-NA) is committed to providing technologies and system solutions for various Bosch business fields primarily in the areas of Human Machine Interaction (HMI), Robotics, Energy Technologies, Internet Technologies, Circuit Design, Semiconductors and Wireless, and MEMS Advanced Design._


_The Bosch Center for Artificial Intelligence (BCAI) was founded in early 2017 to deploy cutting-edge AI technologies across Bosch products and services creating solutions that are "Invented for life." This position will be in the BCAI team in Sunnyvale, CA. In this intern role, you will explore, exploit, and invent the state-of-the-art computer vision and deep learning technologies. By leveraging big and unique dataset among Bosch business units, you will solve challenging industrial computer vision problems that will be adopted in the practical applications within Bosch. To name a few applications_ – _autonomous vehicles/robotics, automated optical inspection, and video survelliance systems._


Job Description


+ Research and develop real time image selection using active/semi-supervised learning strategies for automated scene identification eg. from a fleet vehicle.

+ Benchmark developed solution against state-of-the-art methods from the literature.

+ Collaborate with other deep learning teams across business units for joint development.

+ Integrate the proposed solutions onto Bosch hardware.

+ Summarize research findings in high-quality paper and/or patent submissions.


Qualifications

_Required:_


+ Pursuing a PhD or Master degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Electrical Engineering, or Mathematics

+ Solid understanding of fundamental and cutting edge computer vision and deep learning

+ Strong general programming skills with Python

+ Strong deep learning programming skills with TensorFlow, Keras, or PyTorch

+ Ability to work independently

+ Excellent communication skills


_Desired:_


+ Solid knowledge and experience with semantic segmentation, object detection e.g., YOLO, SSD, RetinaNet etc.

+ Solid knowledge and experience with active learning, semi-supervised or weakly supervised learning methods.

+ Publication record in top AI conferences (CVPR/ICCV/ECCV/NIPS/ICLR/AAAI, etc)

  • Familiarity or experience with Agile/SCRUM.

Fincantieri Marine Group currently has an opportunity for an Information Technology Programmer Analyst Intern at the De Pere, Wisconsin location. This Internship position will be one year in length.

Fincantieri Marine Group (FMG) is the United States subsidiary of Italian shipbuilding giant Fincantieri, one of the world's largest shipbuilders, employing more than 19,000 shipbuilding professionals in 20 shipyards on four continents. Fincantieri has a rich history dating back more than 230 years and a track-record of delivering more than 7,000 ships. Fincantieri Marine Group is comprised of three Great Lakes Shipyards: Fincantieri Marinette Marine, builder of Freedom Class Littoral Combat Ships for the United States Navy; Fincantieri Bay Shipbuilding, specialists in construction, repair and conversion of United States Coast Guard (USCG) and commercial vessels; and Fincantieri ACE Marine, a state-of-the-art, climate controlled aluminum construction facility purposefully designed for assembly line manufacturing of aluminum vessels, using innovative modular construction techniques and component manufacturing.

The Programmer Analyst Intern will provide application software development services or technical support of existing applications for the Data and Analytics Team. This includes new and existing custom software applications built in C#, workflow systems and solutions built in Nintex (K2), and Business Intelligence solutions using MS SSIS, Qlik Sense and nPrinting.

* Demonstrate a consistent sense of urgency on high priority open issues to ensure timely resolution.
* Abide by and enforce all organizational policies and procedures.

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Knowledge/familiarity with programming languages (C#, Microsoft .Net)
* Exposure to K2 Workflow (Nintex), Qlik, Tableau, Power BI, Python or R is desirable but not required
* Excellent written and oral communication
* Demonstrated problem solving capabilities
* Ability to work independently and in a team environment
* Experience with Microsoft .Net, C#, SQL query writing
* Ability to work in Green Bay, WI for the duration of the Internship

SKILLS:


* Basic to Intermediate coding proficiency (.Net preferred)
* Basic to Intermediate MS SQL Server 2012-2016 knowledge and experience

Job Posting Title

Information Technology Intern


The Adventure

The Information Technology Internship offers those with a passion for information technology the opportunity to grow their leadership skills, business acumen and technology aptitude, while building a career with unlimited potential. Program interns lead by doing gaining frontline experience by working on important and challenging projects alongside some of the brightest technical minds in the world.


Information technology (IT) is critical to the future of GE Appliances, a Haier Company (GEA). GEA IT represents a major area of focus and investment across the company and is essential to maintaining our leadership, competitiveness and success. For those with a passion for technology, no other company offers the diversity of experience and career potential that GE Appliances, A Haier Company does.


GEA’s Information Technology Internship is a key entry point for IT professionals at GEA and designed to attract high-potential candidates looking to further develop their technology ability and business acumen. The Information Technology Internship is the key pipeline for the full-time program.


Our Information Technology Development Program professionals gain hands-on experience in system implementation, technical design and architecture, and operational excellence as they transition from academia to the working world. Program members get access to choose rotations in a variety of disciplines (e.g. system implementations, technology design/architecture, and operational excellence), accelerating their future at GEA. And as part of GEA, they are supported by the scale and resources of one of the world's greatest companies.


What you will Learn & Do


Essential Duties & Responsibilities:


IT Intern assignments, generally 10 -12 weeks, vary widely in terms of the business functions/processes impacted and the type of work required. Possible assignments may include:


+ Application development (Web, client server, standalone, mobile) utilizing Agile and Waterfall methodologies

+ Systems management and optimization

+ Business process re-engineering

+ Infrastructure management and environmental design/build out

+ Security/controllership

+ GE Appliances will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position

+ Positions located in Louisville, KY; a remote experience may be determined based on ongoing healthy & safety evaluations of the external environment

+ Housing & Relocation benefits available for onsite positions.


Interns have significant exposure opportunity to key IT and business leaders at GEA as well as current full-time DLDPs. Interns also have extracurricular opportunities to engage in various activities both socially and from a professional development perspective.


What you need to Succeed


Required Qualifications


+ Pursing Bachelors or better in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, Software Engineering, Management Information Systems, Computer Information Technology, Computer Information Systems, Informatics, Data Analytics or related field

+ Candidate must be enrolled and be in good academic standing in a minimum of a four-year technical degree in one of the above majors

+ Cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.0/4.0

+ Unrestricted authorization to work in the United States both now and in the future


Desired Qualifications


+ Prior intern, co-op, or research experience in technology

+ A strong commitment to a career in technology and passion/aptitude for IT

+ Strong analytical and technical skills

+ Demonstrated problem solving abilities

+ Leadership experience inside and/or outside the classroom

+ Well-developed written and verbal communication skills

+ General business / finance understanding

About Gro:

Gro Intelligence is tackling two of the biggest problems facing the world today: food security and climate change. We understand and quantify the complex interplay between food, weather, trade, agriculture, and macroeconomic conditions in a world upended by climate change, a growing population, and more. The team at Gro has built a platform that allows businesses, non-profits, and governments to better plan for and adapt to these changes. With offices in both Nairobi and New York, Gro has the financial backing of prominent investors such as TPG Growth, Intel Capital, Data Collective, and GGV. Gro is a diverse, intellectually curious team of technologists, scientists, and business professionals united by a shared commitment to build AI that addresses agriculture, food, and our climate on the most fundamental level.

  • Assist in competitive market analysis and fleshing out persona details

  • Help to identify key product opportunities and help define product requirements

  • Understand customer experience; propose a feature/solution; creating a prototype of such a solution

  • Update documentation related to user touchpoints; create impact on user experience

  • Leadership experience through jobs, projects, or extracurriculars.

  • Relevant experience in technology, finance, or software development.

  • Proficiency with Python, SQL, Jupyter, and APIs

  • Familiarity with Plotly Dash, Excel, Tableau, and PowerBI

  • Pursuing a degree in computer science or related field.

Internship format:

  • Full-time, 40 hours per week
  • Remote and/or Gro NYC office
  • June 1 – August 15 2021


Gro was founded in 2014 and currently has offices in Nairobi and New York City. The company was built on diversity and the knowledge that artificial intelligence is only as good as the human intelligence behind it. Gro’s team represents the world it is modeling. At the company, we speak more than 27 languages and we comprise a wide range of experts, from agronomists and crop scientists, to mathematicians, engineers, data scientists, market research analysts, designers, historians, and philosophers. Our culture fosters collaboration between people of extremely different backgrounds that allows us to accomplish things that would otherwise seem impossible.

Knowledge gained from the Integrative Sports Performance (ISP) programs aim to integrate into other departments within the Milwaukee Brewers Baseball Operations (MBBC) to enhance player performance and evaluation.

+ Explore MBBC ISP data sets as it pertains to medical, performance, and/or scouting to appropriately integrate ISP data to better assist in identifying potential risk of injury, changes in performance, and identification of future high-level talent.

If you find science, speed, and success exhilarating, you have come to the right place.

Novavax, Inc.(Nasdaq: NVAX) is a late-stage biotechnology company that promotes improved health globally by discovering, developing, and commercializing innovative vaccines to prevent serious infectious diseases. Novavax is uniquely qualified to address the enduring need for innovative vaccines. We utilize our proprietary recombinant technology platform, which combines genetic engineering's power and speed to efficiently produce highly immunogenic nanoparticles designed to address urgent global health needs. We have more than a decade of experience contending with some of the world's most devastating diseases, including COVID-19, seasonal influenza, RSV, Ebola, MERS, and SARS. Hard-won lessons and significant advances illustrate that our proven technology has tremendous potential to make a substantial contribution to public health worldwide.

This position is expected to work primarily remote.

The candidate may work on one or more of the following, but not restricted to:

  • Prepare statistical analysis plans; analyze experimental and historical data.
  • Create design of experiments and perform various types of statistical analyses to develop predictive models and optimize conditions for processes, methods, and drug product/drug substance storage.
  • Perform stability analysis to identify degradation rates and expiration dates.
  • Prepare the statistical section of technical reports and presentations.
  • Automating the data collection process and transferring data into a format more appropriate for analysis
  • Creating new, experimental frameworks to collect data
  • Correlating similar data to find actionable results
  • Creating reports and presentations for business uses
  • Manage one's projects effectively, and meet deadlines with high quality of standards

Duration: 8 weeks; Summer 2021

Minimum requirements:

  • Currently seeking a degree in Statistics/Biostatistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • The candidate should have hands-on experience with one or more of the following: statistical software packages (e.g. JMP, SAS, and R), programming languages e.g. Python, visualization and business intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau), Microsoft power apps.
  • Familiarity with ICH guidelines and the drug development field is preferred.
  • Must be an effective team player, able to thrive in a fast-paced team environment, and also work independently on projects.
  • Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills.

Novavax is headquartered in Gaithersburg, Maryland with additional facilities in Uppsala, Sweden and Bohumil, Czech Republic. Novavax is traded on the Nasdaq Stock Market under the symbol NVAX and is dedicated to developing novel vaccines to address infectious disease.

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG's internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSEG is seeking a Social Media/Digital Analytics Intern at our Newark NJ location.

This position will be supporting the Social Media/Digital Analytics in the Customer Technology area. This team works in our social media channels, mostly Facebook and Twitter, and responds to customer inquiries and concerns. We strive to help every customer that reaches out to us in a timely manner. The other responsibility of the team are digital analytics. All the digital channel analytics are developed and maintained in this group. We work mainly with Google Analytics 360 and Sitecore Analytics as well as SAP and Salesforce.

Job Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:

• Monitor social media channels for customer needs and brand concerns.

• Perform routine social media tagging, user management, and conversation management tasks

• Testing new website tagging and maintaining tagging documentation for Google Analytics and Sitecore Analytics

• Assist digital product teams test system changes, particularly with regard to the analytics associated with each product

• Propose and collaborate on the creation of content for digital products, subject to review and approval

• Support our understanding of customer behavior on digital channels through reporting and analytics

• Optimization Techniques - Personalization and A/B testing

Required Education/Skills: The successful candidate (s) must be actively pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in Computer Science, Marketing, Communications, Alalytics, or similar related major. Candidates must have completed sophomore level course work for consideration. PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

Desired:
• Interest in Digital Channel Analytics - such as Google Analytics
• Superior written and verbal communication skills
• Highly collaborative, able to work across business units to achieve desired outcomes
• Prior experience running reports using common tools such as Excel, Tableau, or Access
• Proficiency in MS Word and PowerPoint

All PSEG internship roles are paid at an hourly rate, however there are no benefits associated with these positions. Candidates are expected to work 40 hours per week over the summer period for the full 10-12 week period. We are targeting: Currently enrolled students wi, staying in the NJ/NY/PA metro area for the duration of the internship and able to commute to the assigned work location. Business needs may cause PSEG to cancel or delay filling position at any time during the selection process.

MotionPoint is seeking a software engineer intern to work 16 to 32 hours per week for 10 weeks during the Summer of 2021 (June 1 – Aug 6) at our corporate offices in Coconut Creek, Florida. Due to Covid-19, the internship will likely start as remote work and it may convert to onsite work at our corporate office later in the Summer. The intern will report to a software engineering manager. This is an excellent opportunity for individuals interested in Software Engineering careers. Highlights include:

  • Paid internship with competitive wages of $22/hr.
  • Professional software development work environment.
  • Casual work environment.
  • Open-door management policy.
  • Potential full-time employment.

Responsibilities will include hands-on, real-world tasks and projects that will have a direct impact on the ongoing growth of our company:

  • Develop code for application in cloud platform using Java, JavaScript, Python and SQL.
  • Participate in development sprint planning and prioritization.
  • Create and maintain continuous integration and development processes.
  • Become involved in managing DevOps tools in creating system integration infrastructure in a cloud platform.

  • Learn agile methods (Scrum/Kanban).

  • Ability to code in functional or Object-Oriented Programming language. (Java/JavaScript/Python/Groovy).
  • Knowledge of OOP, Data Structures, Unix, and SQL.

Financial Data Analyst Intern
Orange County Waste & Recycling

This recruitment is open to the public and will be open for five (5) business days. This recruitment will close on Friday, April 30, 2021 at 11:59 PM PST. Interested applicants are encouraged to apply immediately. 

OC WASTE & RECYCLING

OC Waste & Recycling (OCWR) is an organization dedicated to providing waste management services, protecting the environment, and promoting recycling in order to ensure a safe and healthy community for current and future generations. OCWR operates three active regional landfills, four household hazardous waste collection centers, monitors 21 closed landfills, and administers municipal solid waste collection, recycling and planning for County unincorporated areas. OCWR is a nationally renowned waste management department responsible for a network of sanitary landfills. The Department is committed to its exceptional record of regulatory compliance and excellence. 
 
THE OPPORTUNITY

The Financial Data Analyst Intern will be assigned to the Financial Services Section of OCWR. Under Financial Services, the intern will work on data analysis of major projects such as; OCWR Fee Booth transactions, OCWR Capital Projects transactions, and Heavy Equipment Purchase analysis.

 

Duties on these projects may include one or more of the following:


  • Input and collect information from various County or OCWR internal systems such as Paradigm's CompuWeigh system and Disposal Reporting System, CAPS+, and e-Builder 
  • Generate various system reports from databases
  • Determine linear regression and trend identification for each of the above listed projects
  • Prepare final reports for each project
  • Research cost and create cost analysis report for purchase of heavy equipment
 

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
This internship recruitment is open to the public who are currently enrolled in an accredited college or university working towards earning their Associate's (AA) or Bachelor's degree (BS/BA); or have graduated in the last six (6) months from an Associate's or Bachelor's degree program in the following fields of study; Data Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science,Mathematics, or a similar field. 

 

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

OC Waste and Recycling is seeking applicants with the following qualifications:

 

  • Advanced knowledge of SQL and Microsoft Office including Microsoft Excel
  • Experience in calculating statistics and linear regression
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Highly organized and dependable
  • Eager to gain professional experience
  • Able to complete assignments in a timely manner
  • Reliable, outgoing and able to work independently

 

TIME COMMITMENT
This internship is available for immediate placement and will last for 3 months. This internship will be a hybrid of in-person and remote work. (Please note that costs associated with remote work such as a computer/laptop or internet services are not reimbursable by the County of Orange) The internship may be extended up to 12 months based on the needs of the department. 


Candidates must be available for at least 20 hours per week, Mondays through Fridays. Applicants who indicate that they are not able to meet this time commitment will not be considered.

 

BENEFITS AVAILABLE TO THE INTERN

  • Earn academic credit while applying classroom knowledge to a professional workplace 

  • Build resumes/hands-on experience and explore a career in local government 

  • Network with professionals in their fields of interest

     

APPLICATION PROCEDURE
Applicants must attach a cover letter, resume, and unofficial transcripts to their application. The cover letter is an opportunity for students to describe career and academic goals, to elaborate upon personal and academic accomplishments, and to identify what type of internship experience they are seeking.  Learn more about what to include in a cover letter HERE


Applications that do not include a cover letter, resume, and unofficial transcripts will not be considered.


REQUIRED BACKGROUND SCREENING/REFERENCE CHECK

Prior to placement, applicants will be asked to submit to a background screening, which requires a state issued driver's license or ID card and a social security number. All internships with OC Public Works require a background screening against local, state and national criminal databases. Applicants will be required to submit their full legal name, physical address, date of birth and Social Security number.

Welcome to Valmont, where a world of opportunity awaits. When you join our team, you become part of a passionate group dedicated to changing lives and conserving resources around the globe. A Brief Summary of This Position:

Valmont is seeking a Data Analyst Intern to join the Irrigation division. The Data Analyst goal is to drive understanding and decision making from data, on a strategic and tactical level. The Analyst is accountable for planning, supporting and launching efficient business and operations systems/processes to the Sales team, with focus on quality improvement, data management, and process improvement and/or re-engineering.  This includes gathering and analyzing data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements. Other tasks include cleaning large datasets and assist in building a data validation process. Our ideal candidate has the ability to work on multiple business projects simultaneously and translate business data into digestible information that improve processes.

Valmont’s internship program mission is to provide a hands-on learning experience through project work, leadership development, job shadowing and interaction with senior leadership.

Essential Functions:

  • Perform analysis of data sets to identify trends, relationships and insights
  • Collaborate with subject matter experts and data engineers to develop new data products
  • Implement modifications to existing workflow processes to improve systems 
  • Address any data discrepancy issues across all open projects
  • Take on ad hoc projects and cultivate your own ideas
  • Deliver findings through impactful data visualizations and effective storytelling techniques
  • Experience in Power BI a plus

Required Qualifications of Every Candidate (Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities):

  •  Working towards a degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Finance, or any quantitative discipline 
  • The ability to dedicate 20-25 hours a week
  • A keen eye for detail and dedication to accuracy and quality
  • A strong working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and Power Point
  • Self-starter and ability to work well in a team environment
  • An analytical mind and inclination for problem solving
  • Passion and integrity with the drive to excel and deliver exceptional results

Benefits:

  • Great opportunity to gain career related course work experience from an industry leader
  • Paid Internship – Valmont values you
  • Potential development into a regular full-time position
  • Flexible full-time day shift hours during the summer
  • A thriving culture in a growing business
  • Interactive group activities with intern peers

Working Environment and Physical Efforts:

Work is typically performed in an office setting.  The incumbent is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time, as well as talk and listen on the phone and in personal conversations or meetings.    Environment is fast paced and demanding most of the time.  No travel requirements for this position.  The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms while working in the office with various files and forms and while working on the computer.  The employee is occasionally required to move about the office.  Incumbent must utilize proper ergonomic safeguards such as monitor height and positions, keyboard location and height and proper wrists rests. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds in working with large files, binders, and computer equipment.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, and depth perception.

Intern (Radiology Informatics) - (2100016F)

Description

 

The IT Intern is an entry level role responsible for providing, with guidance, IT services and support to enhance departments’ operational efficiencies, patient safety and departmental workflow needs.  The expectation for this position would be to gain experience and abilities required for an IT role in a healthcare organization.  Under direct supervision, the IT Intern responsibilities include:

 

  • Participates, with guidance, in needs assessment, software design, development, implementation, support, and reporting.
  • Assists with data collection from subject matter experts, to facilitate design which will represent an improved system workflow.
  • Assists with the design of system workflow in conjunction with clinical and business partners; workflows will focus on improved efficiencies, as well as incorporating quality initiatives.
  • Provides desktop or technical support.
  • Participates in change management activities to support successful system deployments and enhancements.
  • Participates in unit and integrated testing of the software to ensure that the design objectives are met.
  • Assists with the development of end-user training materials and supports training efforts. 
  • Assists other team members in ensuring good documentation standards; including the creation of functional design specifications.
  • Provides input into escalation of issues with appropriate internal resources.
  • Assists in the development of policies and procedures in collaboration with clinicians, business personnel, other team members, and IT manager.
  • Assists with the development and maintenance of system documentation.
  • Works tickets assigned through the Service Desk ticket tool.
  • Troubleshoots issues with vendor assistance, to resolution.
  • Supports/troubleshoots Hospital Information Systems inbound/outbound interfaces as appropriate.
  • Creates reports as needed and works problem tickets. 
  • Works with other application analysts to insure system integrations.
  • Utilizes and maintains appropriate change control procedures and standards.
  • Prepares detailed flowcharts/diagrams to assist with design decisions and problem analysis.
  • Rotates to various IT teams for exposure and experience. 
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

*This role may encounter Protected Health Information (PHI) as part of regular responsibilities.  UH employees must abide by all requirements to safely and securely maintain PHI for our patients.  Annual training, the UH Code of Conduct and UH policies and procedures are in place to address appropriate use of PHI in the workplace.

 

Qualifications

 

Experience & Knowledge:

  • Must have strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Must be detail-oriented and organized, with good analytical and problem solving ability. 
  • Notable client service, communication, andrelationship buildingskills required. 
  • Ability to work in hospital clinical and office areas where patient safety and confidentiality are core values required.
  • Must have reliable transportation and be flexible to work varying shifts.

Special Skills & Equipment Knowledge:

  • Demonstrated ability to use PCs, Microsoft Office suite, and general office equipment (i.e. printers, copy machine, FAX machine, etc.) required.

Education:

 

  • High School diploma or GED required.
  • Active college student or recent graduate with a Bachelor degree in any of the following, or comparable: Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Management, Healthcare- related degree, Programming, Engineering, required.

Company Description

Guardant Health is a leading precision oncology company focused on helping conquer cancer globally through use of its proprietary blood tests, vast data sets and advanced analytics. The Guardant Health Oncology Platform leverages capabilities to drive commercial adoption, improve patient clinical outcomes and lower healthcare costs across all stages of the cancer care continuum. Guardant Health has launched liquid biopsy-based Guardant360®, Guardant360 CDx and GuardantOMNI® tests for advanced stage cancer patients. These tests fuel development of its LUNAR program, which aims to address the needs of early stage cancer patients with neoadjuvant and adjuvant treatment selection, cancer survivors with surveillance, asymptomatic individuals eligible for cancer screening and individuals at a higher risk for developing cancer with early detection.

Job Description

To help Guardant Health fight cancer through data, our Enterprise Software Team is seeking a highly motivated Summer Intern – DevOps Engineer to join our team.  Our DevOps team works as a key part of our software development lifecycle to address zero downtime release management.  The team uses state of the art tooling and software on large scale Kubernetes clusters to manage our operating environments in a flexible and secure fashion.  If you want to learn a broad set of core software engineering principles on modern stack in a fast-paced and highly collaborative team setting then this is the role for you!

At Guardant Health, you will be at the forefront of combining personalized medicine with software and data innovations to improve patient care. You will interact with a diverse team of experienced software developers, testers and operations specialists to help advance our technology to improve the care of cancer patients around the world.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Working under the supervision of Senior DevOps Engineers, you will:

Help scale our software engineering processes and practices through developing tools and extending cloud platforms;

Maintain services live in production, using advanced logging and monitoring techniques;

Create automation tools to increase speed and quality of complex software deployments;

Present updates orally, write reports and updates, and participate in technical discussions.

Learn and have fun through completing technical project work!

Qualifications

  • Completed coursework in Computer Science
  • Some experience in Object oriented programming, SQL, DevOps functions, or Technical support.
  • Experience with Linux is a plus
  • Knowledge in life science is a plus

Education: 

Students close to or recently completing BS, MS in CS/EE, or a related field with some programming experience.



Additional Information

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Looking for an internship program where you'll make a real difference - rather than just completing busy work? Then you've come to the right place. Cigna's Summer Internship Program is designed to assign you projects that have a lasting impact on our business - which touches millions of people across the globe.

As an intern, you'll get an inside look at your desired field, while working next to some of the best in the industry. Program activities, including an executive speaker series, volunteer events, and career development workshops, give you the opportunity to network with employees across the organization and prepare you for a full-time career.

Where You'll Work

The Data Science Internship is an opportunity to be part of the most exciting company in healthcare, making medicine smarter and more affordable using data science. The internship will involve using data science techniques that include predictive modeling, machine learning, text mining, segmentation and clustering to help in developing solutions to increase revenue and improve Member Experience.

During this internship, the intern will utilize machine learning for developing the next generation of predictive models for targeted business solutions, support the team in the application of Text Mining to mine VoC data, and develop supervised/unsupervised algorithms for making business processes efficient.

Qualifications

• Must be working towards Masters Degrees or a Ph.D. in quantitative disciplines such as Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Econometrics, Finance, Engineering, Operations Research, Bioinformatics, Information Systems, Computational Linguistics or related quantitative disciplines or other similar degrees

• Excellent ability to query large datasets using ANSI SQL and working with relational databases

• Proficient programming skills either in SAS, R, or Python

• Proficient in Basic Probability and Statistics

• Preference is given to students with a 3.0 GPA or above with demonstrated proficiency in quantitative subjects.

Experience Desired

• Proficiency with one or more quantitative data analysis languages such as R, Python

• Demonstrated coursework/ real-world application of analytical methods such as Regression, Naïve-Bayes, Decision trees, experimental designs, support vector machines, machine learning and text mining, and Natural Language Processing

• Proficiency with relational database concepts and SQL preferred

• Proficiency in data manipulation, cleansing, and interpretation

• Knowledge of Big Data Technologies like Hive, Spark, Scala, HDFS

• Experience with visualization tools like Tableau, Shiny, ggplot, Matplotlib

• Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite

The following competencies/behaviors will be expected for incumbents in this position:

• Motivated self-starter

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

• Attention to detail with excellent analytical skills

• Able to quickly pick up new ideas and new technologies

• Some Project Management knowledge helpful but not mandatory

This position is not eligible to be performed in Colorado.

Company Description

Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins works with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate.Eurofins believes it is a global leader in food, environmental, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies.

In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 47,000 staff across a network of more than 900 independent companies in over 50 countries and operating more than 800 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialised clinical diagnostics testing.

 In 2019, Eurofins generatedtotal revenues of EUR € 4.56 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.

  • Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, keep accurate records, follow instructions, and comply with company policies, logical thinking, and deductive reasoning

Position is full-time, Monday - Friday 8:00am - 5:00pm.  Candidates currently living within a commutable distance of Lancaster, PA are encouraged to apply.

position: Client Support Analyst Intern- Publisher Products
description:
Who we are

DoubleVerify is a leading software platform for digital media measurement, data, and analytics. DV’s mission is to be the definitive source of transparency and data-driven insights into the quality and effectiveness of digital advertising for the world’s largest brands, publishers, and digital ad platforms. DV’s technology platform provides advertisers with consistent and unbiased data and analytics that can be used to optimize the quality and return on their digital ad investments. Since 2008, DV has helped hundreds of Fortune 500 companies gain the most from their media spend by delivering best in class solutions across the digital advertising ecosystem, helping to build a better industry. Learn more at www.doubleverify.com.

What you’ll do

As a Client Support Analyst Intern, you will work with DoubleVerify’s Publisher product team and work with cutting edge technology. This role is a 8-week, full-time, virtual engagement that runs from June 14th- August 13th, 2021

What you’ll do

  • Interact with existing customers communicating ad server connection health and providing assistance where needed. 
  • Proactively keeps customers informed of how and when problems are resolved with focus on retention and reference ability. 
  • Increase customer satisfaction both directly and indirectly through department staff. 
  • Maintains and improves upon the database with most current customer contact information.
  • Assists in identifying possible improvements related to work processes and tools.
  • Participates in special projects providing improvements to the established knowledge base. 

Who you are

  • Self-starter and self-motivated individual who prides themselves on attention to detail
  • Must possess strong critical thinking, decision making, and problem solving skills 
  • Interested in learning more about digital advertising and the ad tech industry
  • Must take your work seriously, be able to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines 
  • Maintain a professional manner and tone among clients and internal team
  • Currently pursuing or received a Bachelor or Master of Science Degree in Computer Science or a related field

Who we are

DoubleVerify is a leading software platform for digital media measurement, data, and analytics. DV’s mission is to be the definitive source of transparency and data-driven insights into the quality and effectiveness of digital advertising for the world’s largest brands, publishers, and digital ad platforms. DV’s technology platform provides advertisers with consistent and unbiased data and analytics that can be used to optimize the quality and return on their digital ad investments. Since 2008, DV has helped hundreds of Fortune 500 companies gain the most from their media spend by delivering best in class solutions across the digital advertising ecosystem, helping to build a better industry. Learn more at www.doubleverify.com.

What you’ll do

As a Data Engineer Intern, you will work with DoubleVerify’s versatile Engineering and Product teams on mission-critical systems that process billions of real-time transactions a day and solve/address complex challenges with Big-Data processing and analytics at scale. This role is a 8-week, full-time, virtual engagement that runs from June 14th- August 13th, 2021


Responsibilities include:

  • Research, Conceive and Build Software and Data-Intensive applications that contribute to and extends DoubleVerify’s suite of Social Viewability and Brand suitability measurement products
  • Work on cutting edge big data technologies to build large scale batch and streaming pipelines using Cloud and big-data technologies on the Google Cloud Platform.
  • Work in multi-functional agile teams with end-to-end responsibility for product development and delivery. Take ownership of the product under the guidance of your mentor and work in tandem with product manager interns.
  • Improve data quality through testing, tooling, and automation.
  • Help maintain and support mission-critical services. Research, Conceive, and Build a new Operations Console Center by working in tandem with Social Product interns.
  • Work in multi-functional agile teams with end-to-end responsibility for product development and delivery. Take ownership of the product under the guidance of your mentor.

Who you are

  • Currently pursuing or received a Bachelor or Master of Science Degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Passionate about Data and a creative problem solver
  • You have a deep understanding of data structures and algorithms and experience writing code in languages such as C++, Java, Scala, or Python.
  • You have good knowledge of SQL and RDMS
  • Experience with/knowledge of Distributed Systems and Frameworks such as Hadoop and Spark

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Our Technology Professional / Sr Technology Professional are a multi-level posting. Selection will be dependent upon the candidate's knowledge, skills, competencies and experience.

PSEG Nuclear Application Support department is looking to fill several openings located in Hancocks Bridge, NJ. This position reports to the Manager Applications Solutions and will work closely with Business Analysts and Group Product Managers to understand the business requirements that drive the analysis and physical design of technical solutions. Also will be involved in the full systems life cycle and responsible for designing, coding, testing, implementing and supporting application software and systems.

This position provides opportunity to be involved several product developments and will:
•Learn to execute projects through the PSEG's Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and CMMI inclusive of identifying, specifying and analyzing business requirements and processes and managing progress throughout the application design, test and implementation process using Agile and 2 Pizza concepts. •Work with Product teams in Two Pizza Team approach similar to Amazon product development and CICD model. •Develop and implement process improvements, Next Best Actions, Automation opportunities, and Pro-active communications for customer care applications. •Become a subject matter expert (aka Product Consultant) for technical and solution architectures. •Configure, Design, Develop using Visualforce, Apex, API, SOQL, Workflows, MuleSoft, and other development tools provided by PSEG •Analyze end-user needs and designs, develop and test software to satisfy demand. Perform build versus buy analysis for business demands. •Partner with Business Analysts to translate business requirements to application requirements. May evaluate existing applications and platforms and provide recommendations for improving application performance by conducting gap analysis, identifying feasible alternative solutions, and assisting in the scope of modifications. •Create process flowcharts, diagrams, and other related documentation; Develop technical workflows using different modeling techniques. •Collaborate with enterprise architects and infrastructure to integrate applications and hardware. •Ensure that the design and application implementation meets security and QA standards. Suggests fixes to issues by doing a thorough analysis of root cause and impact of the defect. •Analyze application reports to ensure that the functionality and performance meets all product and service level requirements. •Code applications using a disciplined development process. Works on coding tasks that require skills in multiple technical environments and knowledge of a specific business area. •Provide daily support with resolution of escalated tickets. Apply operation break fixes and other proactive maintenance activities until permanent solutions can be implemented. Supports and participates in the software deployment process for new modules, upgrades and fixes to the production environment

Required : •Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or Information Sciences preferred, or relevant experience. •Minimum 3.0 GPA •Level of experience required ranges from internship to 4 years of relevant experience within the IT industry with reliance on technical expertise •Overall strong technical proficiency in information technology/computer disciplines •Strong MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access) •Programming Experience working with or related coursework .NET, HTML, SQL, Java, Java scripting, Ajax, NODE.JS, JQuery, REST API's, Angular or Object Oriented Design, •Self-starter with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly. •Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills •Good written and oral communication skills. •Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with clients, IT management and staff.

Required Additional Information :
This position is a member of the PSEG Nuclear Application Support team and the candidate must: •Be available for 24X7 coverage for Nuclear application support when needed. •Be available for assignment for 24X7 scheduled coverage during for Nuclear refueling outages. •Be able to fulfill and maintain PSEG Nuclear requirements for unescorted access to PSEG Nuclear plants. •Be able support PSEG Nuclear Emergency Preparedness program drills and events •Be able fulfill the requirements for access to 10 CFR Part 810 Export Control information. •Be able to obtain Amazon Web Services (AWS) certification •Certain positions at the Company may require you to have access to Part 810-Controlled Information. Under the law, the Company is limited in who it can share this information with and in certain circumstances it is necessary to obtain specific authorization before the Company can share this information. Accordingly, if the position does require access to this information, you must complete a 10 CFR Part 810 Export Control Compliance Nationality Request Form, a copy of which will be provided to you by Talent Acquisition if an offer is made. If there is a need for specific authorization, due to the time it takes to obtain authorization from the government, we will likely not be able to further proceed with an offer.

Desired Skills:
Experience developing business process flows and soliciting business requirements •Knowledge of Agile development and project management •Able to write software code in both web and client/server environments using the following examples: •Software Languages: Java, .Net, C, C++, HTML, XML, SQL, VBA •Operating Systems: Windows, Linux •Relational Databases: SQL Server, Oracle, Aurora, Postgres, MongoDB •Experience designing graphical user interfaces using graphical design tools (e.g. Photoshop, MS Visio) •Relevant certification is preferred such as Amazon Web Services (AWS)

description:

Edwards is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer including protected Veterans and individuals with disabilities.


Edwards Lifesciences is the global leader in patient-focused medical innovations for structural heart disease, as well as critical care and surgical monitoring. Driven by a passion to help patients, the company collaborates with the world's leading clinicians and researchers to address unmet healthcare needs, working to improve patient outcomes and enhance lives. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Edwards Lifesciences has extensive operations in North America, Europe, Japan, Latin America and Asia and currently employs over 15,000 individuals worldwide.


For us, helping patients is not a slogan - it's our life's work. From developing devices that replace or repair a diseased heart valve to creating new technologies that monitor vital signs in the critical care setting, we focus on helping patients regain and improve the quality of their life.

Digital Diagnostics is looking for an AI/ML Summer Intern to advance our diagnostic products and algorithm development capabilities.

About Digital Diagnostics:

At Digital Diagnostics, we’re on a mission to transform the quality, accessibility, and affordability of global healthcare through the automation of medical diagnosis and treatment.

Our flagship product – IDx-DR – is an artificial intelligence algorithm where the computer, not the physician, performs the diagnosis.  Built on a series of patented machine learning algorithms, our FDA cleared software platform detects early signs of diabetic retinopathy, a debilitating eye disease that impacts 30+ million people with diabetes in the US. 

We are using everything we’ve learned from IDx-DR to expand our AI platform across different therapeutic areas like skin cancer.  To deliver on our mission, we need to expand our team of highly skilled and motivated team members to help us change healthcare for the better!

Who We Are:

Working for Digital Diagnostics in the R&D team offers you the opportunity to:

  • Work with world-renowned computer scientists and clinicians to create AI diagnostics that can improve the quality and accessibility of healthcare for millions of people.
  • Tackle complex projects for audiences that include the FDA, world-leading healthcare providers, and leading industry partners.
  • Get a front-row seat in what it takes to be the market leader in FDA-cleared AI diagnostics.

Who You Are:

If you’re someone who:

  • Enjoys applying your AI/ML skills to new and challenging problems
  • Works well independently but likes to brainstorm with and bounce ideas off of collaborators
  • Wants a peek behind the scenes of AI/ML development at a leading digital health company
  • Is interested in working with and learning from the AI/ML team that built the first FDA-cleared AI diagnostic

Then apply to be our next AI/ML Summer Intern!

At DXS AI/ML interns work closely with the machine learning and AI team to prototype new algorithms for incorporation into our existing products and translate the latest machine learning research for application with real world medical data onto concrete applications.

Qualifications (aka what we’ll ask you about in your interview):

  • A track record of learning new technologies and tools
  • Pursuing or completed a degree in computer science, AI, or a related field
  • Familiarity with deep learning platform(s) (e.g. PyTorch, MXNet, TensorFlow)
  • Python programming experience

Feeling over or underqualified but still think we’re cool? Have a specialty that doesn’t quite line up with this posting? We are recruiting at a number of levels for all sorts of specialties: Check out our career page at https://dxs.ai/about/careers/current-openings/

Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor an immigration case for employment at this time (for example, H-1B or other employment-based immigration cases).

28800 Ida St Valley Nebraska 68064-8016

Why Valmont
 

Welcome to Valmont, where a world of opportunity awaits. When you join our team, you become part of a passionate group dedicated to changing lives and conserving resources around the globe. We want problem solvers who roll up their sleeves to foster progress and innovation for all people. At Valmont, we provide infrastructure, irrigation, tubing and coatings to the world. We strengthen cities. We nourish croplands. We design, manufacture and coat. Our products and services make a difference. Join us, and BUILD YOUR WORLD.

A Brief Summary of This Position:

Valmont is seeking a Data Analyst Intern to join the Irrigation division. The Data Analyst goal is to drive understanding and decision making from data, on a strategic and tactical level. The Analyst is accountable for planning, supporting and launching efficient business and operations systems/processes to the Sales team, with focus on quality improvement, data management, and process improvement and/or re-engineering.  This includes gathering and analyzing data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements. Other tasks include cleaning large datasets and assist in building a data validation process. Our ideal candidate has the ability to work on multiple business projects simultaneously and translate business data into digestible information that improve processes.

Valmont’s internship program mission is to provide a hands-on learning experience through project work, leadership development, job shadowing and interaction with senior leadership.

Essential Functions:

  • Perform analysis of data sets to identify trends, relationships and insights
  • Collaborate with subject matter experts and data engineers to develop new data products
  • Implement modifications to existing workflow processes to improve systems
  • Address any data discrepancy issues across all open projects
  • Take on ad hoc projects and cultivate your own ideas
  • Deliver findings through impactful data visualizations and effective storytelling techniques
  • Experience in Power BI a plus

Required Qualifications of Every Candidate (Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities):

  •   Working towards a degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Finance, or any quantitative discipline
  • The ability to dedicate 20-25 hours a week
  • A keen eye for detail and dedication to accuracy and quality
  • A strong working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and Power Point
  • Self-starter and ability to work well in a team environment
  • An analytical mind and inclination for problem solving
  • Passion and integrity with the drive to excel and deliver exceptional results

Benefits:

  • Great opportunity to gain career related course work experience from an industry leader
  • Paid Internship – Valmont values you
  • Potential development into a regular full-time position
  • Flexible full-time day shift hours during the summer
  • A thriving culture in a growing business
  • Interactive group activities with intern peers

Working Environment and Physical Efforts:

Work is typically performed in an office setting.  The incumbent is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time, as well as talk and listen on the phone and in personal conversations or meetings.    Environment is fast paced and demanding most of the time.  No travel requirements for this position.  The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms while working in the office with various files and forms and while working on the computer.  The employee is occasionally required to move about the office.  Incumbent must utilize proper ergonomic safeguards such as monitor height and positions, keyboard location and height and proper wrists rests. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds in working with large files, binders, and computer equipment.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, and depth perception.

If you have a disability and require any assistance in filling out the application for employment email EEOCompliance@Valmont.com.

Data Scientist Intern Fall Internship (August 2021 - December, full-time work schedule, Monday- Friday 40 hours per week) Meraki is making IT easier, faster, and smarter. As a business unit of Cisco Systems, Meraki is the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world with products and technology architecture that are changing the face of enterprise networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality. At Cisco Meraki, we’re on track to be the most successful acquisition in Cisco’s history (and certainly the most fun). Our office makes working here pretty special too. If you’re looking for a company that really commits, how about our onsite gym with weekly fitness and yoga classes, and paid time off to volunteer and give back to the community? All in all, what truly makes Meraki special are the people - people who keep the culture strong and make working here exciting, meaningful, and rewarding. As a Data Science intern, you will be a key partner in Meraki’s data ecosystem, responsible for analyzing operational data to build predictive models that drive key decisions for Meraki's internal operations teams. At Meraki, we have business problems that require us to apply machine learning and pattern recognition against large scale datasets of operational and machine-generated data. We're looking for help in solving them. As part of this role, you will develop relationships across Meraki's teams such as support, operations, business operations, and product. Ideal candidates will have an analytical mindset, mathematical, and programming skills, and a bias for action. You don't wait for change - you embody the change you want to see in the world! EXAMPLE PROJECTS OF A DATA Scientist: ● Analyze network logs over time to recognize performance issues. Can we build a machine learning model to sift through live log streams and proactively detect issues? ● How do we use historical data to accelerate sales growth? Can we predict which Meraki partners are likely to grow their business over a certain period? ● How can we use ML to optimize hardware inventory levels? Can we forecast product demand on a monthly basis a year out? ● How can we optimize the rollout of a new product? Can we calculate the probability of product acquisition for each of our customers with no historical sales data? MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: ● Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, economics, finance, or a technical (STEM) field ● An understanding of machine learning algorithms and basic statistical concepts (e.g. correlation, causation, regression analysis) ● Proficiency in SQL and python programming ● Ability to take initiative and work autonomously ● Strong analytical and critical thinking skills INTERN PROGRAM OVERVIEW: Meraki interns join the team for a 12-week program and are placed directly onto subteams. During the program, interns have the opportunity to work on various projects, such as integration and implementation of new tools. Projects are cross functional, which allow insight into new languages and technologies, help encourage professional growth within engineering, strategy, and support, and allow a sense of ownership within the team. Meraki’s teams place a high emphasis on mentorship. Each intern is matched 1:1 with a mentor who provides continual feedback and guidance throughout the duration of the program. Mentors help with introductions to other team members, overviews of tools and processes, and provide a seamless integration into Meraki life. JOB TITLE: Machine Learning Intern

PROJECT OVERVIEW:

WBB is seeking applicants with strong software development skills, and a keen interest in machine learning to join our team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop state of the art machine learning algorithms and deploy them in the big data stack.

JOB DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Using your creative and technical skills, implement cutting edge machine learning algorithms in Python, Java, C++, or other object-oriented languages as appropriate
  • Implement these algorithms in the Big Data stack, including Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Storm, and MongoDB
  • Collaborate with co-workers, leadership, and clients to understand client problems, identify solutions, and demonstrate their software solutions
  • Collaborate with co-workers to execute standard software development activities including design, development, implementation, test, documentation, and support using standard established software engineering principles
  • Eagerly pursue the current and emerging trends in software development best practices, service-oriented architectures, web development, and cloud computing

REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

  • US citizenship with the ability to obtain a clearance
  • Working towards a Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Studies, Human Computer Interaction, Mathematics, or other related discipline
  • Academic or professional experience in some or all of the following areas preferred: Object-oriented software design and development in Java technologies, web design (Javascript, HTML/CSS, MVC), or cloud computing (Hadoop, MapReduce, MongoDB)
  • A demonstrated interest in machine learning through course work or experience
  • Applicants must be able to work 40 hours per week
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

DESIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3.0 GPA or above
  • Working knowledge of version control systems such as Subversion or Git, and bug tracking tools such as JIRA (School experience is sufficient)

WORK LOCATION: Crystal City, VA or Remote

TRAVEL: None

KEY WORDS: Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, data mining, python, java

Job Function/Category:  Information Technology 

Employment Type:  Non-Exempt Full Time 

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Job Summary

Technology Professional:
The technology professional will be involved in the full systems life cycle and responsible for designing, coding, testing, implementing and supporting application software and systems. Technology Professionals will work closely with Business Analysts and Group Product Managers to understand the business requirements that drive the analysis and physical design of technical solutions.

Job Responsibilities

Responsibilities:
• Analyzes end-user needs and designs, develops and tests software to satisfy demand. Performs build versus buy analysis for business demand.
• Partners with business analysts to translate business requirements to application requirements. May evaluate existing applications and platforms and provides recommendations for improving application performance by conducting gap analysis, identifying feasible alternative solutions, and assisting in the scope of modifications.
• Creates process flowcharts, diagrams, and other related documentation; Develops technical workflows using different modeling techniques.
• Collaborates with enterprise architects and infrastructure to integrate applications and hardware.
• Ensures that the design and application implementation meets security and QA standards. Suggests fixes to issues by doing a thorough analysis of root cause and impact of the defect.
• Analyzes application reports to ensure that the functionality and performance meets all product and service level requirements.
• Codes applications using a disciplined development process. Works on coding tasks that require skills in multiple technical environments and knowledge of a specific business area.
• Provides daily support with resolution of escalated tickets. Applies operation break fixes and other proactive maintenance activities until permanent solutions can be implemented. Supports and participates in the software deployment process for new modules, upgrades and fixes to the production environment.
• Documents functions and changes to new or modified modules and test activities/results.
• Makes modules production-ready by moving them to libraries, completing forms, following procedures, completing version control documents, etc.

Job Specific Qualifications

Required Skills:

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or Information Sciences preferred, or relevant experience.
• Level of experience required ranges from internship to 4 years of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise.
• Basic knowledge of the practical application of role specific engineering science and technology including applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services.
• Experience working with or related coursework to write software code in both web and client/server environments such as:
- Software Languages: Java, .Net, C, C++, HTML, XML, SQL, VBA, Node.js, Swift
- Operating Systems: Windows, Linux
- Relational Databases: SQL Server, Oracle, Aurora, Postgres, MongoDB
- Experience designing graphical user interfaces using graphical design tools (e.g. Photoshop, MS Visio)
- Experience with mobile app development (iOS, Android)
- Alexa skill development
• MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access
• Ability to work independently and multi-task effectively.
• Flexible and willing to accept a change in priorities as necessary.
• Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly.
• Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Ability to learn new business and technical concepts.
• Good written and oral communication skills.

Desired Skills :

Overall strong technical proficiency in information technology/computer disciplines.
• Relevant certification is preferred such as Amazon Web Services (AWS)
• Experience with translating business requirements into system functional and non-functional requirements.
• Experience with business and system process flow techniques using UML (e.g. Use Case Diagrams, Activity Diagrams, Entity Relationship Diagrams).
• Experience with specific phases of the software development life cycle, especially Agile, Iterative, and Waterfall.
• Ability to create both technical and non-technical end-user documentation.
• Basic knowledge of the practical application of role specific engineering science and technology including applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services.
• Demonstrated understanding of projects from the perspective of both client and business.
