This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Job Summary

The technology professional will be involved in the full systems life cycle and responsible for designing, coding, testing, implementing and supporting application software and systems. Technology Professionals will work closely with Business Analysts and Group Product Managers to understand the business requirements that drive the analysis and physical design of technical solutions. Candidates must be a graduate of Workforce Opportunity Services (WOS) and must have PSEG work experience.

Job Responsibilities

•Analyzes end-user needs and designs, develops and tests software to satisfy demand. Performs build versus buy analysis for business demand. •Partners with business analysts to translate business requirements to application requirements. May evaluate existing applications and platforms and provides recommendations for improving application performance by conducting gap analysis, identifying feasible alternative solutions, and assisting in the scope of modifications. •Creates process flowcharts, diagrams, and other related documentation; Develops technical workflows using different modeling techniques. •Collaborates with enterprise architects and infrastructure to integrate applications and hardware. •Ensures that the design and application implementation meets security and QA standards. Suggests fixes to issues by doing a thorough analysis of root cause and impact of the defect. •Analyzes application reports to ensure that the functionality and performance meets all product and service level requirements. •Codes applications using a disciplined development process. Works on coding tasks that require skills in multiple technical environments and knowledge of a specific business area. •Provides daily support with resolution of escalated tickets. Applies operation break fixes and other proactive maintenance activities until permanent solutions can be implemented. Supports and participates in the software deployment process for new modules, upgrades and fixes to the production environment. •Documents functions and changes to new or modified modules and test activities/results. •Makes modules production-ready by moving them to libraries, completing forms, following procedures, completing version control documents, etc.

Job Specific Qualifications

Required Skills:
•Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or Information Sciences preferred, or relevant experience. •Candidates must be a graduate of Workforce Opportunity Services (WOS) and must have PSEG work experience. •Level of experience required ranges from internship to 4 years of relevant experience within the IT field or an industry with reliance on technical expertise. •Basic knowledge of the practical application of role specific engineering science and technology including applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services. •Experience working with or related coursework to write software code in both web and client/server environments such as • Software Languages: Java, .Net, C, C++, HTML, XML, SQL, VBA, Node.js, Swift •Operating Systems: Windows, Linux •Relational Databases: SQL Server, Oracle, Aurora, Postgres, MongoDB • Experience designing graphical user interfaces using graphical design tools (e.g. Photoshop, MS Visio) •Experience with mobile app development (iOS, Android) •Alexa skill development •MS Office skills (i.e. Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Access •Ability to work independently and multi-task effectively. •Flexible and willing to accept a change in priorities as necessary. •Self-starting with the demonstrated ability to learn new technical concepts quickly. •Detail oriented and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills. •Ability to learn new business and technical concepts. •Good written and oral communication skills.

Description

Cuberg is commercializing a next-generation lithium metal battery to power the rise of electric mobility. Our battery technology provides huge benefits in terms of energy density, power, and safety, all in a format that allows for rapid scaling. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the future of electric mobility.

We are currently seeking motivated Interns in the areas of materials science, engineering, data, and test. These positions require strong knowledge in chemistry, engineering, data, or science.

We are looking for candidates who have a passion for making an impact in our sustainable energy future and who will thrive in a rapidly evolving, close-knit, and dynamic early-stage startup environment. The ideal candidate will think independently, be unafraid to take on major responsibilities, and perform all tasks with diligence and care.

Join us in building the future of energy.

About

Cuberg is commercializing next-generation battery technology to power the future of electric mobility. The company was acquired in 2021 by Northvolt, a global supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems. As Northvolt's Advanced Technology Center operating in Silicon Valley, Cuberg is developing and commercializing lithium metal batteries, building an innovation ecosystem around lithium-ion technology, and leveraging Northvolt's state-of-the-art manufacturing capabilities to rapidly scale up production of advanced batteries.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze experimental results to understand the impact of cell materials on cell performance
  • Assist scientists and engineers with material preparation, cell assembly, and testing
  • Prepare reports, present and share results with team members
  • Work closely with the battery modeling team members

Requirements

  • Currently pursuing a B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, Applied Physics, Chemistry, or related area
  • Fundamental knowledge of Li-ion cell electrochemistry and mechanisms
  • Strong background in mathematical modeling and data analysis
  • Excellent communication skills and team-oriented attitude
  • Comfortable with initiating and taking ownership of the projects
  • Advantageous Experience with Python and/or MATLAB
  • Experience in building and maintaining databases

Benefits

Paid time off, holidays

Description

Cuberg is commercializing a next-generation lithium metal battery to power the rise of electric mobility. Our battery technology provides huge benefits in terms of energy density, power, and safety, all in a format that allows for rapid scaling. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the future of electric mobility.

We are currently seeking motivated Interns in the areas of materials science, engineering, data, modeling, and test. These positions require strong knowledge in chemistry, engineering, data, or science.

We are looking for candidates who have a passion for making an impact in our sustainable energy future and who will thrive in a rapidly evolving, close-knit, and dynamic early-stage startup environment. The ideal candidate will think independently, be unafraid to take on major responsibilities, and perform all tasks with diligence and care.

Join us in building the future of energy.

About

Cuberg is commercializing next-generation battery technology to power the future of electric mobility. The company was acquired in 2021 by Northvolt, a global supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems. As Northvolt's Advanced Technology Center operating in Silicon Valley, Cuberg is developing and commercializing lithium metal batteries, building an innovation ecosystem around lithium-ion technology, and leveraging Northvolt's state-of-the-art manufacturing capabilities to rapidly scale up production of advanced batteries.

Responsibilities

  • Mathematical modeling of transport processes and electrochemical behavior of Li-ion cells
  • Analyze experimental and simulation results to understand the impact of cell materials on cell performance
  • Prepare reports, present and share results with team members
  • Work closely with the battery development and test team members

Requirements

  • Currently pursuing a B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, Applied Physics, Chemistry, or related area
  • Fundamental knowledge of Li-ion cell electrochemistry and mechanisms
  • Strong background in physics-based modeling of electrochemical or general transport processes
  • Preferred: Experience with multiphysics simulations in COMSOL
  • Excellent communication skills and team-oriented attitude
  • Comfortable with initiating and taking ownership of the projects
  • Advantageous: Experience with Python and/or MATLAB

Benefits

Paid time off, holidays

    • Perform research and acquire new knowledge and skills on new technologies, processes, and tools for use in data management
    • Document developed tooling and processing for sustainable reuse

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, abilities, and competencies required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Self-starter, detail and process oriented individual, with a strong desire to learn an Data Engineering and related skillsets
  • Requires ability to:
    • Create and maintain strong working relationships with colleagues and/or customers
    • Behave in a trustworthy & transparent manner
    • Monitor and check work related information and deliverables ensuring high quality and accuracy and paying strong attention to detail  
    • Work cooperatively with others and be part of a team
    • Communicate ideas, facts and data in writing using appropriate grammar and syntax
  • Requires initial exposure to:
  • SQL storage technologies, with a preference for Microsoft SQL server
  • Relational data modeling
  • Data integration and processing
  • Software Engineering practices and processes
  • Configuration management & deployment
  • Exposure to basic programming languages such as: C#, python, HTML/XHTML, XML/XSLT, .NET, JavaScript
  • Willingness to learn new technology and possibly merge together many different technologies into a single solution

 

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE

  • Currently pursuing a Baccalaureate degree in an appropriate IT field such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Management Information Systems from an accredited U.S. college or university, equivalent foreign institution, or equivalent experience.

 

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

DISCLAIMER

This description is intended to describe the type and level of work being performed by a person assigned to this position.  It is NOT an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities required by a person so classified. The job may require additional hours beyond the normal 40-hour workweek.

Company Overview

Teledyne Scientific Company (TSC) has a legacy of over 50 years of advanced research and technology development. Our customer base consists of DARPA, ONR, AFRL, ARL, and other government and proprietary customers. TSC’s Intelligent Systems Laboratory in North Carolina is a state-of-the-art research and development research facility, dedicated to R&D in the areas of computational neuroscience, deep learning, machine learning, persistent surveillance, autonomous systems and computer vision. The laboratory currently is host to world-class scientists and engineers, with advanced degrees in computer science, mathematics, electrical engineering, neuroscience, chemistry, biomedical engineering and mechanical engineering.

Position Summary and Responsibilities

Teledyne Scientific Company is seeking candidates for an internship to support advanced research and development in algorithm and software development for machine learning applications. This position is at our research laboratory in Research Triangle Park, Durham, North Carolina.

 

Primary Responsibilities:

The position involves learning and performing tasks related to mathematics, computer software development, laboratory experiments and demonstrations.  Specific duties include:

  • Design, develop and test mathematical algorithms for various projects involving signal processing
  • Design, develop and test software related to signal and image processing
  • Participate in regular meetings with staff
  • Work closely with mentor to learn techniques and tools needed to perform technical tasks
  • Prepare and present results to technical staff

Qualifications

Skills/Experience:

  • Proficient with Microsoft Office applications
  • Familiarity with computer programming languages, software and/or firmware development and the required tools such as compilers, debuggers and development environments
  • Able to organize perform and coordinate project related tasks and communicate progress to project team members
  • Strong oral and written communication abilities
  • Able to work independently with minimal supervision

 

Education:

  • Junior status in a relevant BS program (Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Engineering)

 

Security Clearance:

  • Candidates are required to be U.S. Citizens
  • A security clearance is not required

position: IT Service Support Intern - Cyber Security Start Up
description:
Varmour is driven by a culture of excellence and collaboration. Every day we are motivated and challenged by our brilliant colleagues and our customers who number some of the most technologically advanced Global Fortune 500 companies on the planet. We believe in architecture and creativity while remaining agile in our ability to bring innovations to market ahead of our competitors. Our Application Controller pioneers the automation of application security within hybrid and multi cloud environments.

Opportunity

We are seeking a qualified candidate to work as an integral part of our IT team. They will learn business skills as well as gain valuable experience with MacOS, and Windows systems provisioning and lifecycle management, Active Directory (AD) administration and troubleshooting, call handling and dispatch as well as process creation and implementation in a fast paced professional environment. The qualified candidate will be enrolled or will have recently completed an Information Technology program and possess strong troubleshooting and communications skills.  

What you will do

  • Identify, research, and resolve technical problems or requests

  • Assist in development of automation of common operational functions

  • Respond to telephone calls, slack messages, email and walk-ups for Technical support

  • Document, track, and monitor all problems using existing ticketing system to ensure a timely resolution of the incident or request

  • Support, monitor, test, and troubleshoot hardware and software problems

  • Interface with vendors to schedule hardware repairs

  • Install and configure associate’s workstations using standard provisioning process.

  • Provide end users support for all standard applications

  • Assist with data recovery, using backup or data recovery tools

  • Systems patching and Virus / Malware remediation

  • Perform other duties or special projects as requested related to area of responsibility

  • Perform endpoint asset management

What you will bring

  • Must be enrolled in a college or university Computer Science or Information Technology program or have recently completed a technical certified program. 

  • Must be familiar with basic computer and networking technology

  • General knowledge of Microsoft Windows 10, Mac OS X. Some knowledge of Linux is a bonus

  • Some scripting knowledge which you will be eager to apply and develop

  • General knowledge of Google Apps and Office 2019

  • Familiarity with computer networking (LAN, Wi-Fi, VPN)

  • Must have a strong work ethic, organization skills, the desire to learn and is not afraid to ask questions

  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

  • Ability to maintain confidentiality at all times

  • Ability to travel as required to our Los Altos office and Data Center (Co-lo) in Santa Clara

Perks

  • Competitive salary

  • Great culture and team spirit

  • Ability to work from home

About Varmour
Varmour delivers simple and intuitive application security for the most demanding hybrid cloud environments. We’ve been doing this for the biggest enterprise customers all around the globe – financial services, service providers, and critical infrastructure. Our software protects banking payment systems, global telecommunications, the electrical grid, and automated medical systems.

At Varmour, we take hard problems and make them simple. We work in an entrepreneurial, creative, and collaborative environment. Our leadership is clear, open, and honest, and every employee makes a big impact. If you have a passion for pushing your own limits and making those around you better, you’ll find yourself at home at Varmour.

Based in Los Altos, CA, the company is backed by top investors with customers around the globe. Come join our team of brilliant, innovative people who bring collaboration, hard work and fun to the next generation of multi-cloud application security. We are dedication to an open, inclusive diverse culture.

The Voith Group is a global technology company. At Servco, we’re committed to providing valuable mobility solutions to empower people through the freedom of movement and opportunity. From Australia to California, and of course, Hawaii, Team Servco is a collective of over 2,000 like-minded individuals guided by our four Core Values of Respect, Service, Teamwork, and Innovation. For over 100 years, we have been dedicated to superior service, to both our customers and team members. We look forward to helping you create Life:Moments that matter to you.

 

Servco’s internship program is an opportunity for top students to gain relevant work experience in various areas. Internship positions are only available in Hawaii. The program offers interns challenging and meaningful work that allows them to demonstrate their abilities, apply knowledge acquired through college courses, and be evaluated for possible future employment opportunities within Servco. Our internships create opportunities for interns to establish important relationships with experienced professionals.

 

This is a full-time (40 hours per week) internship program which spans over a period of 8 weeks.

 

The Software Development team at Servco supports the Digital Strategy team by providing technical requirements, technical design, software architecture and programming resources for various types of projects. These include customer-facing web development, native app development, internal business tool web app development as well as backend API and database work. The team is an Agile group of developers that work with many different business departments throughout the organization. Our interns get involved with real projects and, when possible, are mentored and shadowed by experienced team members; however, there are times when the intern will also have to work independently and research their own proposed solutions to real-world problems. The team is energetic, passionate and enthusiastic about their work and committed to delivering quality products.

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science (or a related field in Math, or Engineering)

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

Viking Enterprise Solutions has a rich history of leadership in providing storage and storage server platforms to hyperscale and enterprise data centers worldwide. The division leads the market with ultra-high capacity and high-end flash systems.  Viking Enterprise Solutions provides advanced data center products including solid-state memory and disk-based storage server appliances, JBOD storage systems and related products for a variety of data center and storage applications. Viking Enterprise Solutions products are tailored for integration into OEM, System Integrator and data center products.

​

Viking Enterprise Solutions is proud to be part of the Sanmina family. Sanmina is recognized as a technology leader, providing end-to-end design, manufacturing and logistics solutions, maintaining a global footprint of design and manufacturing operations in 23 countries on six continents. 

 

Firmware Test Intern

In this role, the Firmware Test Intern will participate in firmware test activities for the Viking Enterprise Solutions firmware engineering group in support of cutting edge data storage products and server product design in Colorado Springs. They will participate in storage/server firmware test case development using scripts (Python, Perl, Shell), execute test cases and report test results to leads or the firmware manager.  They will also help in lab system setup and configuration, as well as software or operating system installation on these systems.   The ideal candidate is someone who has Linux operating system skills, has some scripting or c programming knowledge and is willing to dive in and pick up new knowledge from other team members.

  • OS/Software/firmware code installation on lab systems

Education and Experience:

  • Linux Operating System experience

  • C –programming or Linux Kernel experience is plus
  • Some test process experience is also a plus

LinkUp is a Minneapolis-based job search engine with a singular vision of delivering perfect job market information to our clients and users. We do this through proprietary and sophisticated technology that allows us to index millions of jobs directly from company websites around the world every day. As a result of this unique approach to the online job space, we deliver compelling job search, candidate sourcing, and job market data solutions to job seekers, employer advertisers, and data clients.

We are seeking an individual who will be a key contributor to our data management team to support the ongoing growth of the company.

About the role
You'll work as part of a fun team, using your growing skill set to help us scour the internet to build the world's best index of job opportunities.

Location
Typically, this position is located at our office in downtown Minneapolis. Due to COVID-19, this position will start as work-from-home and may or may not remain so for the duration based on how events unfold. As such, you'll want to make sure the following are available to you:

  • A relatively distraction-free environment to work in
  • Reliable internet connection for working and participating in video meetings

While not strictly required, we're favoring candidates more local to the area. Unfortunately, at this time we cannot facilitate candidates who are international/require a work visa/et cetera. Equipment to work on will be provided to you. For security reasons, you will not be permitted to work from your own PC/laptop/device.

Compensation
This is a paid internship ideal for non-traditional students working on a technical degree. The pay is $20 per hour and planned to be about 20 hours per week.

Length of Internship
This posting is for a 6–8 month internship position.

To be successful, you'll need the following

  • Working towards a degree (or equivalent experience) in computer science or related field
  • Some experience programming in one or more modern programming languages (you'll learn PHP here if you don't already know it)
  • A baseline understanding of web technologies and protocols
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • The ability to work collaboratively or independently

Someone that would be a great fit

  • Gets excited about metrics and analytics
  • Loves to write code and manipulate data
  • Sees data in everything and wants to take things apart and tinker
  • Has a natural tendency to automate and streamline things
  • Has a habit of setting measurable goals and blowing past them
  • Knows the importance of clean, consistent, documented code
  • Can read and understand code written by other people
  • Loves being a critical part of a team doing meaningful work

A little bit about us
We take pride in a great company culture that is based on our core principles: work hard, have fun, think big, solve problems, and do good. To be blunt (and brag a bit), LinkUp is a great company filled with outstanding people that are incredibly talented, extremely dedicated, and really fun to work with. Along with some of our office perks such as stand-up desks, scooters, volunteer opportunities, and free snacks, we offer competitive pay, health / dental benefits, paid time off, 401k, and employee stock options.

position: Data Scientist Intern - Applied Research Team
description:
SparkCognition catalyzes sustainable growth for their clients throughout the world with proven artificial intelligence (AI) systems, award-winning machine learning technology, and a multinational team of AI thought-leaders. Clients are trusted with advancing lives, infrastructure, sustainability, and financial systems across the globe. They partner with SparkCognition to understand their industry’s most pressing challenges, analyze complex data, empower decision-making, and transform human and industrial productivity. With leading-edge artificial intelligence products—Darwin®️, DeepArmor®️, SparkPredict®️, and DeepNLPTM—SparkCognition’s clients can adapt to a rapidly changing digital landscape and accelerate their business strategies. 

We are seeking a Data Science Intern to join our team of Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers on the Applied Research Team. At SparkCognition, you will develop the latest tools in Machine Learning and Deep Learning to solve challenging real-world problems. Specifically, the project involves exploring a hard problem involving seismic imaging. Experience in seismic interpretation for oil exploration is desired. This is a paid internship that requires a highly motivated and results-driven personality who will thrive in a fast-paced environment. This is an excellent opportunity for an individual who wants to work as part of a skilled team to gain valuable experience with a variety of products and industries.

Who you are

 

You’re a junior or above pursuing a degree in Computer Science with a Data Science concentration or Masters/PhD candidates in Math/Physics/Statistics and are interested in crafting solutions to complex problems. Alternatively, you’re an advanced student in geoscience and you have experience using Machine Learning for seismic imaging. You are a highly motivated and results-driven individual who thrives in fast-paced environments.

 

What you’ll do

  • Work on our Research team of data scientists and machine learning engineers on solving inverse problems involving seismic imaging.
  • Work on a supercomputer running massive Machine Learning jobs.
  • Be paired with a data science mentor to guide you throughout the internship

 

What we’re looking for

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelors, Masters, or PhD in Computer Science (or related field) or Geosciences with experience using Machine Learning
  • Positive attitude and a strong team player
  • Available to work full-time for 10 weeks during the Summer
  • Expertise with Python or similar Machine Learning languages/packages
  • Expertise with Machine Learning algorithms and techniques
  • Familiarity with neural networks and at least one deep learning framework (Tensorflow, PyTorch)
  • Detail-oriented self-starter who can independently manage deadlines in a remote environment

Location: West Conshohocken, PA
Description: Our client is currently seeking a Market Research Manager

 
POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the general direction of the Vice President of Market Research, and in partnership with cross-functional internal partners, this hands-on role works primarily on Voice of the Customer primary market research and related analysis. This role requires significant coordination with cross-functional stakeholders. The role also coordinates the work of preferred partner vendors to augment the team’s capacity and identifies when an elevated level of expertise is warranted to support project objectives. This role manages the CXI team’s intern and may manage full time direct reports. The Market Manager will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work while exemplifying AmerisourceBergen’s guiding principles. In addition, the market research manager works closely with a number of key roles, stakeholders and functions across the organization to include but not limited to the following: business stakeholders (sales), financial analysts, customer operations, customer solutions, distribution operations and marketing. S/he needs to be a creative thinker and propose innovative approaches to data collection and analyses. The market research manager should know statistical methods and internal data sets to complete research projects. In addition, the market research manager will understand and effectively employ a number of ways to visualize data in a way that is highly effective and persuasive. Finally, the market research manager must be inherently analytical and have a high level of curiosity in getting to next level understanding of insights behind the data. Excellent written and communications skills will also be a necessity for this role.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Reviews research briefs to understand objectives and consults on the design of surveys to ensure the data collected will facilitate the right analysis to generate findings that support the objectives
· Independently programs and tests surveys, including the development of call to action and thank you messages, uploads respondent data, and deploys surveys
· Integrates data from outside sources into Qualtrics and utilizes Qualtrics analytical tools to develop findings
· Builds dashboards, provides training on optimal use, and continuously finds ways to improve data visualizations and incorporate new Qualtrics features within the dashboards
· Calculates required respondents to achieve desired confidence level. Checks and ensures data validity. Identifies when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate.
· Conducts analysis of Voice of the Customer data. Demonstrates strong proficiency with all Qualtrics analytical tools.
· Identifies and integrates secondary data sources into the VOC analysis in order to improve the specificity and actionability of the analysis, findings and recommendations.
· Demonstrates insightful quantitative understanding of a data set. Manipulates, analyzes and visualizes data to reveal trends in customer expectations and customer perceptions of AmerisourceBergen’s performance. Identifies correlations in the data, including value drivers. Elevates key opportunities where improvement will have the greatest impact.
· Actively participates with the CXI team in presentations and workshops where findings and recommendations to improve the CX are discussed and debated. Interprets VOC analysis and effectively communicates statistical concepts in way that makes it easy to understand and is not intimidating to non-technical audiences
· With the hands-on support of the Vice President of Market Research, and preferred partners, prepares findings reports for senior executives. Using Microsoft PowerPoint, develops reports with clear, compelling, and easy to interpret data visualizations along with a narrative that translates the data into insights that convey a story or distinct point of view.
· Becomes AmerisourceBergen’s foremost expert use of Qualtrics, a best-in-class technology for research and analysis. Continuously improves proficiency in utilizing all aspects of the tool, particularly those related to analysis. May support the training other associates. Stays current on knowledge of new features/functionality and proactively brings ideas for how these can be applied to support the team’s goals
· Generates timely and concise communications appropriate for executive leadership to understand project status and pending issues.
· Monitors response rates to surveys and proactively makes recommendations on when additional action is required to accelerate participation
· Maintains a tracking program to report on budget allocated to donations in association with charitable giving for survey incentives
· Collaborates with IT, preferred vendors, and others to problem-solve through data integration requirements, survey deployment decisions, and other operational considerations related to the VOC and customer experience programs
· Manages the intern’s workflow/priorities, reviews all work contributed by intern, and provides guidance and coaching to support the intern’s professional development.
· Proactively recommends ideas to improving efficiency and quality in the team’s workflows, processes, and deliverables
· Builds and maintains strong relationships across the organization through frequent and open communication/collaboration
· Proactively seeks out and manages time to accommodate for continuous learning and development.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

Typical Education
· Minimum of bachelors (advanced degree (Masters or PHD preferred) in data analytics, marketing research, statistics or computer science or related field;
· Typically requires 3+ years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience.
· Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
· Knowledge of one or more market research platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth, SPSS, Medallion)
· Proficiency in the use of statistical methodologies (regression, maxdiff, conjoint, Turf analysis, correlation, descriptive variables).
· Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics and multivariate testing
· Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
· Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas.

Work Complexity
· Designs experiments, tests hypotheses and builds statistical models.
· Employs a number of complex research methodologies (correlation matrices, turf analysis, conjoint analysis, max diff)
· Highly skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics

Market Research
· Design, test and program surveys to support VOC programs and other insight projects
· Designs qualitative and quantitative studies and aligns them to the proper use case.
· Identifies audience size, sample size, confidence level and confidence interval necessary to meet statistical validation

Strategic Planning & Project Planning
· Participates in team strategic planning sessions to support annual and long-range objectives.
· Creates and manages research project plans and tracks key milestones

Business Requirements
· Works with commercial and functional stakeholders to define business problems and develop research methodologies to gather the necessary insights that inform recommendations
· Possesses a high-level understanding of one or more business or functional areas.
· Develops key business stakeholder relationships.
· Leverages knowledge of internal and external data sources and leverages this knowledge to solve business problems
Data Requirements
· Works with others to support data collection in support of research projects and integration of internal systems (e.g. Qualtrics with SFDC) to automate data transfer.
· Works to combine customer experience data (e.g. satisfaction) and operational data (e.g. financial) to complete robust analyses and findings.

Analytics
· Solves business analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies.
· Works in iterative processes with business stakeholders and validates findings.
· Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
· Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples.

Communications and Presentation
· Presents and depicts the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business and functional groups.
· Highly effective visual depiction of data, trends, charts, graphs in compelling fashion.
· Communicates and works with stakeholders and other SME’s as required to meet project objectives.

4. What special requirements/skills you would like us to screen for (i.e.: "Must Haves")? See job description as well.
Data analytics skill, statistical modeling skills should be advanced. Intermediate to advanced experience with statistical software (R, SPSS, Qualtrics, Sawtooth etc.)

Job Description

At Keysight, we help companies address their toughest challenges with precision and confidence. We offer the most precise electronic measurement tools in the industry, with advanced software to match. Our employees leverage their insight and passion to revolutionize electronic measurement and make a difference in the world.

Job Qualifications

Overview

Keysight Technologies was founded 80 years ago by Bill Hewlett and Dave Packard in the original Silicon Valley garage as an electronics instrument company. Since its inception, Keysight has designed, refined, and produced solutions that have enabled the Information Era and its world changing innovations. Keysight continuously adapts and evolves to remain the industry leader in a now software-centric world. We are looking for team-oriented, technically curious self-starters to join our IT College Program for an exciting internship where you will develop the skills of the next generation of Software Engineering talent to pioneer technologies that will enable world changing solutions and take Keysight into the next 80 years.

 

Job Description

Launch into your 2021 summer internship working remotely with a team primarily located in Colorado Springs, headquarters for our global IT delivery center. From day 1, you will work with your peers to work on knock-out products with real business value spanning analytics, cloud solutions, mobile apps, compute & network engineering, cyber security, and web development. You will be introduced to our business and technical environments, with support along the way as you work with different technology-enablers across the organization to develop a software solution that drives business value. Within this environment, you will have ample opportunities to experience different technologies within our IT delivery framework, from using your technical savvy to blow away our end-users with beautiful front ends, powerful back ends, or brilliant hardware architectures. At the end of your internship, you will feel confident and ready to take on any future challenge!

Job Function

  • We’re looking for diverse technical interests, students with the type of background who:

    • Know the difference between Java and JavaScript, between C++ and C#, between Python and Perl, between Xamaran and Appcelerator
    • Get excited about multi-TB in-memory analytics systems

Acrisure Technology Group (ATG) is a fast paced, AI-driven team building innovative software to disrupt the $6T+ insurance industry.  Our mission is to help the world share its risk more intelligently to power a more vibrant economy. To do this, we are transforming insurance distribution and underwriting into a science. 

At the core of our operating model is our technology: we're building the premier AI Factory in the world for risk and applying it at the center of Acrisure, a privately held company recognized as one of the world's top 10 insurance brokerages and the fastest growing insurance brokerage globally. By using the latest technology and advances in AI to push the boundaries of understanding risk, we are systematically converting data into predictions, insights, and choices, and we believe we can remove the constraints associated with scale, scope, and learning that have existed in the insurance industry for centuries. 

We are a small team of extremely high caliber engineers with a diverse background across industries and technologies. Our engineers have worked at large companies like Google and Amazon, high frequency trading companies like TwoSigma and Jump Trading, and a variety of smaller startups, including successful startup founders.

 

The Role

As an AI Engineer Intern, you'll help move artificial intelligence out of the labs and into production in a way that transforms the insurance industry. You'll help build cutting edge AI systems that aid our customers in ways they might not deem possible. As a successful candidate, you combine machine learning and deep learning experience with strong computer science fundamentals and software engineering experience. You will take full advantage of state-of-the-art algorithms and tools, conceiving of new ones when the right solution does not yet exist. You work with modern ML tools such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, Spark, Kubeflow, and MLFlow to create robust, scalable, state-of-the-art products. You are driven by a passion for improving the world through technology. Help us to turn vision into reality. 

Our technology runs on Google Cloud and is configured with Kubernetes, leveraging various services in that environment. Our data storage layer includes BigQuery, BigTable, and Postgres. We code primarily in Kotlin, Python, Java, and JavaScript and make use of many frameworks, including Dataflow, Cloud AI Platform, KubeFlow, Spring, and React.

 

Here are some of the ways in which you'll achieve impact:

  • Build efficient and reliable technology with a customer-first mindset.
  • Develop and deploy production ML models to solve business problems
  • Participate in model reviews alongside a leading team of AI researchers and AI engineers, helping to grow a world-class center of excellence for applied AI
  • Assist in designing and maintaining our tech stack, building when it makes sense, inventing when necessary, and upgrading as tools evolve.
  • Identify, adopt, and evangelize best practices.
  • Measure the effectiveness of new features, find and address performance issues, and drive continuous improvement.
  • Work collegially and effectively as we grow a world-class, diverse engineering team.
  • Design and conduct experiments, solving complex measurement challenges.

 

You may be fit for this role if you:

  • Possess exceptional knowledge of machine learning, computer science fundamentals, and software engineering principles.
  • Possess theoretical understanding and practical experience with machine learning algorithms for regression, classification, clustering, and unsupervised learning.
  • Have experience putting quantitative models into production, including by using deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch, workflow tools such as Kubeflow, etc.
  • Take a scientific, data-driven approach to problems, with a solid understanding of statistics (Frequentist and Bayesian) and applied mathematics.
  • Have an ability to measure, understand, and debug complex integrated systems.
  • Are product and customer focused, with a passion for delighting the end user.
  • Possess empathy, kindness towards others, a positive attitude, and self-awareness.
  • Obtaining a Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Are willing and able to work remote for Summer 2021.
  • Are excited to work for an early stage company to experiment, discover product-market fit and are focused on maximizing business impact.

 

It's not expected that any single candidate would have expertise across all of these areas. If you are a solid engineer and eager to work on data- or insurance-related platforms/products, we are eager to talk!

position: Summer Research Intern - Human-Computer Interaction Institute
description:
Job Description

Summer Research Intern - Human-Computer Interaction Institute

Description:

The Human-Computer Interaction Institute (HCII) is a living laboratory where we investigate the relationship between computer technology, human activity and society. Founded in 1993, the HCII is a place where we work to understand and craft technology that harmonizes with and improves human capabilities, goals, and social environments through interdisciplinary research and education in design, computer science, and behavioral and social sciences. We research how people work, play, and communicate within groups, organizations, and social structures, then we design, craft, and evaluate technologies and tools to support human and social activities.


Are you someone who is passionate about making a positive impact? Our HCII department is seeking a Summer Research Intern to join this dynamic team.

Strong oral and written communication skills.

Job Description:


This position supports the IS Security Team by performing assigned tasks or assisting with assigned projects, allowing the intern to gain an understanding of the business function.


Paid - $15/hr - full time for up to 1 year. Internship starts now in Salt Lake City, Utah.


Scope


Generally, the internship is a required or preferred component of an undergraduate or graduate studies program. This position allows a student to gain work experience in one or more non-clinical roles. The work experience and projects should be related the student's field of study and support Intermountain's mission, vision and values. Internships require a business justification from each department and / or facility and must support projects or processes that add value to Intermountain. Linode’s Security Engineer Intern is responsible for working on the analysis and implementation of tools and leveraging a mix of open source solutions as well as commercial off the shelf software to strengthen the security posture at Linode. An individual in this role is expected to do a comparative study on the feasibility of different reactive and proactive tools for security analytics, intrusion detection and prevention, and vulnerability detection through static, dynamic, and dependency analysis. There will be an emphasis on the concise documentation of feasibility and efficacy before initiating the implementation of potential solutions.

The ideal intern will be a fast-learner to understand the current process and security posture at Linode and help Linode’s agile culture to a Secure agile culture to mitigate future threats through optimized security controls, procedures, and automation.

Technologies

You don't have to have experience with all of these, but you should have experience with some of them and an interest to learn others:

  • SIEM tools like the Elastic stack
  • Salt Stack
  • Hashicorp products such as Vault, Consul,and Terraform
  • Automation experience using Python, Go, or Shell scripting
  • Osquery
  • FreeIPA
  • Vulnerability scanning tools such as Nessus, or Openvas

Primary Responsibilities

  • Build proof of concepts or proof of value security control prototypes within the scope provided by the CISO and senior security engineers.
  • Participate in security projects including but not limited to: Ongoing Asset inventory & Classification, Identity & Access Management,SIEM, vulnerability management, configuration hardening/attack surface reduction.
  • Triage vulnerabilities submitted by security researchers through Hackerone and other threat/vulnerability sources.
  • Analyze & monitor external threats and develop mitigation solutions to protect Linode’s services.
  • Conduct advanced security research and development as requested.
  • Implement, maintain, and improve the accuracy of existing automation tools (SAST/DAST, DevOps, configuration hardening, etc.) to help reduce false positives.
  • Research & propose avenues to add security solutions from code editors (where code writing starts) through production (where code finally rests) – CI/CD pipeline through scripts.
  • Identify hardware-related vulnerabilities and develop solutions to mitigate them.
  • Help in the gap analysis if compliance-related audits emerge within the tenure.
  • Instill a secure-by-design culture throughout the entire company by educating security best practices using effective principle-based persuasion techniques.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Obtained or working towards a degree closely related to this position (Computer Science, CyberSecurity, etc)
  • Understanding of Linux, virtualization, and networking concepts
  • Computer Science fundamentals like complexity analysis, computational logic, and standard sort/search algorithms.
  • Strong communication skills to work with collaborative cross-functional teams of peers and departments within the company (product development, operations, networking, etc.)

Work With Us

  • Philadelphia Office: HQ is one of the coolest tech buildings in Philly; join us on N3RD street! (https://www.linode.com/press-release/past-meets-future-in-old-city-philadelphia/
  • Flexible work hours: We have remote work options and flexible start times.
  • A MacBook Pro: to use around the office and at home.
  • Free hosting service: Take advantage of some Linode service - we’ll pick up the tab
  • Competitive salary: It all begins with fair compensation. We believe in paying people well and rewarding those who go the extra mile.

Equal Employment, Equal Treatment, No Judgment

Linode is committed to a culture that creates a sense of inclusion and belonging. We understand that teams perform their best when they include people with diverse backgrounds and differing perspectives, but also that to achieve greatness, people need to feel like they can be themselves; they need to be equal, included, and comfortable in order to perform at their best. Linode stands for equal pay, equal treatment, and equal experiences for all of our people, past, present, and future, regardless of age, race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexuality, socioeconomic class, disability status, or any other differentiating factor. We strive to make sure every last person we interact with feels like they belong and has the same opportunities as everyone else.

About Linode

Since 2003, Linode has been providing cloud computing services to customers around the world. Linode offers compute, storage, and networking services from ten data centers in regions spanning across North America, Europe, Asia, and Oceania. We are committed to making Linode the most simple, powerful, and reliable hosting provider that thousands of customers—from the fastest-growing startups to established enterprises—trust. This industry moves fast, but we strive to hire the kind of people who can stay a step ahead and keep us - and themselves - at the top. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming workplace for all.

position: Intern - Security, Arms Control, and Force Protection Engineering (iSAFE) - R&D Graduate Year-Round
description:
What Your Job Will Be Like

 

The Interns for Security, Arms Control, and Force Protection Engineering (iSAFE) Institute is one of the premier Intern Institutes at Sandia National Laboratories.  We are seeking outstanding graduate students majoring in Chemical Engineering, Cognitive Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Explosives Engineering, Geophysics, Materials Science, Mathematics, Mechanical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Physics, Seismology, Statistics, Nuclear Engineering, Systems Engineering, a concentration in Human Factors or related fields of study.  Our Interns will work on high-caliber, multi-discipline, cohesive teams to support programs and projects related to United States National Security. These projects include but are not limited to, critical asset protection and security, nuclear weapons and force protection, and weapons of mass destruction nonproliferation and cooperative threat reduction, energy and homeland security, intelligence science, and reliability engineering.

On any given day, you may be called on to:

  • Work with your team in designing, developing, implementing, testing, and delivering advanced data processing and exploitation software
  • Work with your team in designing, developing, and conducting tests and experiments related to our NS missions
  • Work in a collaborative and learning environment and assume significant responsibilities for assisting in the development of first-of-a-kind software solutions and data exploitation methods to solve challenging technical problems for national security needs
  • Utilize your knowledge, skills, and abilities to deliver quick and accurate solutions to complex and nationally significant problems
  • Develop new skills that focus on addressing needed capabilities for our projects
  • Contribute to data analysis and review in support of our NS mission projects
  • Contribute to reports and papers on technical topics
  • Help to identify and implement new tools and approaches to solving complex technical problems
  • Work with other Sandia National Laboratories Intern Institutes on shared projects.
  • Develop product or human/system interface designs that improve usability, enhance performance, and prevent errors
  • Contribute to multi-scale understanding of human decision making in high-consequence scenarios

Posting Duration

 

This posting will be open for application submissions for a minimum of seven (7) calendar days, including the ‘posting date’. Sandia reserves the right to extend the posting date at any time.

Qualifications We Require

 

You bring the confidence and skills to be eligible for the job by meeting these minimum requirements:

  • Earned bachelor's degree
  • Currently attending and enrolled full time in an accredited science, engineering, or math graduate program
  • Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0
  • Ability to work up to 30 hours per week during the academic year, and up to 40 hours per week during the summer
  • U.S. citizenship

Qualifications We Desire

 
  • Working knowledge and understanding of an engineering or science-related field as listed in the required section
  • An existing U.S. Government granted security clearance
  • Self-motivated, hard-working, detail-oriented and thorough
  • Ability to work well in a team environment
  • Experience with the following: Electro-mechanical systems; Control systems; Software programming; MATLAB; LabVIEW; National Instruments Veristand; Test instrumentation and troubleshooting
  • Experience with the following: Test designing, planning, execution and documentation; Data analysis and statistical methods; Digital signal processing; Mechanical structural analysis; Computational Fluid Dynamics analysis
  • Experience with modeling; SolidWorks, Pro/E, Creo, Finite Element Analysis
  • Knowledge in programming and scripting languages such as C, C++, C#, Java, Python, Ruby, PHP, SQL
  • Knowledge of tools and approaches related to human systems analysis or experimentation

 

About Our Team

 

The Interns for Security, Arms Control, and Force Protection Engineering (iSAFE) Institute provides the opportunity to develop next-generation systems for compelling national security missions. Our interns work on complex and challenging problems to lower the risk posed by high-consequence events, such as nuclear and biological proliferation, terrorist threats, catastrophic incidents, and potentially destabilizing world and national events. Our projects range from small R&D and data analysis efforts to large, multidisciplinary team collaborations on complex multidimensional national security deliverables. Sponsored by Sandia’s Global Security Division, iSAFE offers our interns the opportunity to work with highly competent technical mentors and staff members which enhances the intern's experience at Sandia, while contributing to challenging national security mission problems. The mission of iSAFE is to identify and attract highly skilled interns to Sandia National Laboratories and provide contributions to national security through the effective use of science, technology and full-spectrum system solutions to lower the risk posed by high-consequence events.  iSAFE’s objective is to create a pipeline of highly skilled and competent STEM interns for possible future employment at Sandia.

About Sandia

 

Sandia National Laboratories is the nation’s premier science and engineering lab for national security and technology innovation, with teams of specialists focused on cutting-edge work in a broad array of areas. Some of the main reasons we love our jobs:

  • Challenging work with amazing impact that contributes to security, peace, and freedom worldwide
  • Extraordinary co-workers
  • Some of the best tools, equipment, and research facilities in the world
  • Career advancement and enrichment opportunities
  • Flexible schedules, generous vacations, strong medical and other benefits, competitive 401k, learning opportunities, relocation assistance and amenities aimed at creating a solid work/life balance*


World-changing technologies. Life-changing careers.  Learn more about Sandia at: http://www.sandia.gov

*These benefits vary by job classification.

Security Clearance

 

Sandia is required by DOE to conduct a pre-employment drug test and background review that includes checks of personal references, credit, law enforcement records, and employment/education verifications. Applicants for employment need to be able to obtain and maintain a DOE L-level security clearance, which requires U.S. citizenship. If you hold more than one citizenship (i.e., of the U.S. and another country), your ability to obtain a security clearance may be impacted.

Applicants offered employment with Sandia are subject to a federal background investigation to meet the requirements for access to classified information or matter if the duties of the position require a DOE security clearance. Substance abuse or illegal drug use, falsification of information, criminal activity, serious misconduct or other indicators of untrustworthiness can cause a clearance to be denied or terminated by the DOE, resulting in the inability to perform the duties assigned and subsequent termination of employment.

EEO

 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status and any other protected class under state or federal law.

Overview and Summary

Urban Science is a business-solutions company focused on supporting the needs of the sales and marketing function of the automotive industry. We leverage a scientific methodology to help our client partners sell more vehicles, improve profitability and increase customer loyalty.  And we do that by helping solve their toughest challenges including planning an optimal dealership network, improving individual dealer performance and efficiently converting sales leads into sales. In short, we guide business through science—and we’ve been doing this since 1977.

 

OVERVIEW

The Data Engineering Intern will assist with functions of the Global Data Services team for daily data processing operations and supporting software tooling.  The intern will aid in specific project work and enhance their skillset.

 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Data Processing
    • Interact with Urban Science client databases, utilizing Urban Science proprietary software and commercial tooling
    • Execute ongoing and ad hoc processing of data
    • Troubleshoot data processing issues
    • Apply data analysis methods and tools to enhance data cleansing and readiness for use
    • Create and generate data reports and deliverables
    • Follow data confidentiality and regulatory compliance standards
  • Data Tooling Implementation
    • Develop maintainable data pipelines, including the required software technologies
    • Employ a variety of languages and tools (e.g. scripting or compiled languages) to marry systems and sources together
    • Apply software engineering best practices, data management fundamentals, data storage principles, recent advances in distributed systems, and operational excellence best practices
    • Perform research and acquire new knowledge and skills on new technologies, processes, and tools for use in data management
    • Document developed tooling and processing for sustainable reuse

Qualifications - Education and Experience

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, abilities, and competencies required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Self-starter, detail and process oriented individual, with a strong desire to learn an Data Engineering and related skillsets
  • Requires ability to:
    • Create and maintain strong working relationships with colleagues and/or customers
    • Behave in a trustworthy & transparent manner

position: Data Science Intern (New York, NY, US)
description:
Data Science Intern - 86563

Data Science - USA New York, New York 

 

Nielsen is looking for Data Science Interns to join our summer internship program.  Data Science is core to what Nielsen does, and our projects have high visibility in directly affecting the results of our business and our clients.   

 

WHO ARE WE?
Nielsen Global Media  is the world leader in media measurement for brand advertising on TV, Radio, and Digital. Nielsen is not just a TV ratings company anymore. We have evolved into the leading media data technology company. We help the biggest names out there, from Amazon, Google, and Sony to the hottest new contenders. From Hollywood to Bollywood, Streaming to Broadcast, and Gaming to Sports, everything we do revolves around audience and content.

 

We have strong strategic partnerships with Facebook, Google, Amazon, Adobe, and others setting our measurement products apart from any others in the industry.

 

We are hyper-focused on our ability to be an agile cutting edge organization, always looking for the next best thing when it comes to open-source software, frameworks, tools, and cloud-computing services


WHAT KIND OF DATA SCIENCE INTERN ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

 

Joining our Data Science Internship program  means you will:

 

Begin with an introduction to learn about our strategies, products and systems, as well as an overview of our data science community.

 

Dive head-first and gain hands-on experience creating innovative solutions that make a difference for our customers, clients and employees.


LOCATIONS YOU MAY JOIN: New York Metro, NY; Chicago, IL; Columbia, MD; Oldsmar, FL

 

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

 

If you’re ready to put your passion for data science to work in a way that makes a real difference, you’ll find your place in our  Internship program.

Key skills include:

  • Education background in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Sociology (Quantitative), Graduate and PHd level preferred
  • Foundational knowledge of programming languages (e.g.,  Python, Spark, Scala, SQL and large-scale databases), databases, data structures, and algorithms
  • Relevant internship experience and/or leadership in school or community organizations
  • A well-rounded academic background with a preferred minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0
  • Open-minded and excited to learn and grow technology skills
  • Ridiculous attention to detail and pride in the work you do
  • Strong communication and relationship management skills
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment

#LI-MJ1

ABOUT NIELSEN

As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what’s true, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth. 

Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!

Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, which provides a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries. The Group believes it is the world leader in food, environment, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and for supporting clinical studies. In addition, Eurofins is one of the leading global emerging players in specialty clinical diagnostic testing.

In 2020, Eurofins generated 4.2 billion Euro proforma turnover in 800 laboratories across 50 countries, employing about 50.000 staff.

Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. The Merchant Support Department assists Fiserv’s merchants regarding their merchant processing account. The group handles all updates to merchant accounts, both financially impacting and otherwise. position: Intern, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
description:
Intern, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning


Location US-CA-San Diego (Shoreham)


Job ID 15864


Overview of Job Function:


This AI/ML Research Intern position is based within the Verint Da Vinci AI group. The position will be focused on building and implementing machine learning models, as well as testing and improving the current algorithms, developed by our data scientists in areas of NLP (text/speech analytics), forecasting, and general machine learning. This work will involve data organization, exploration, analysis, algorithm design, implementation, and testing. Areas of research for the Da Vinci AI group include: sentiment analysis, anomaly detection, text summarization, redaction, keyword extraction, intent recognition, and forecasting.


Principal Duties and Essential Responsibilities:


+ Review literature to explore the state of the art of AI/ML solutions for the given business problem

+ Identify available techniques to use for implementation/adoption

+ Gather and organize data from available resources

+ Normalize and prepare data for consumption into models

+ Implement algorithms with product-quality code

+ Perform necessary testing and tuning to optimize model performance

+ Develop new model(s) in various areas including text analytics, intent recognition, forecasting, and sentiment analysis

+ Document model, implementation, and testing


Minimum Requirements


+ Currently pursuing a master’s or doctoral degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, statistics, or relevant quantitative disciplines.

+ Understanding of current state-of-the-art algorithms in deep machine learning

+ Strong experience with Python and important python packages (Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib, scikit learn, etc.)

+ Working knowledge of and familiarity with Pytorch or Keras or Tensorflow

+ Strong data wrangling skills

+ Ability to commit to a 10-12 weeks internship

+ Successful completion of the background check process, including but not limited to employment, education, criminal convictions, OFAC, SS Verification and credit, where available and in accordance with federal and local regulations


Preferred Requirements:


+ Experience developing advanced machine learning algorithms for NLP problems

+ Knowledge of cloud-based platforms such as AWS SageMaker, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, etc.

About the team:

The SuccessFactors Tech Strategy team is seeking a Project lead for a project that defines clear outcomes & KPIs to measure progress of SuccessFactors technology focus areas. The measurements are tied towards the goal of a defined target state of tech capabilities that in turn drive business outcomes. In this role you’ll work with engineering leadership as well as technical PMs to create a culture of outcome-based work. A successful candidate should have good communication skills, be able to work independently, as they will be coached and supported on an ongoing basis, but not supervised daily.

Position Title : SAP SuccessFactors iXp Intern – Technology Strategy

• Give insights into creating outcome-based accomplishments.

• Establish a lightweight governance of Tech standards process with Architects


Who you are:


We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

• Understand how tech drives the business

• Understand the concept of fishboning & 5-Whys

• Good at follow ups and following through demands from teams

• Ability to co-ordinate across different time zones (Europe, India, China, US East and West coast)

• Be Org savvy to work with higher ups (CTO level)


WHAT YOU GET FROM US


Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. Additional Locations :Virtual - USA

Nevro (NYSE: NVRO)  is a global medical device company headquartered in Redwood City, California. We are focused on providing innovative products that improve the quality of life of patients suffering from debilitating chronic pain.

We started with a simple mission to help more patients suffering from chronic pain. At each stage of development, our research was subject to the highest levels of scientific rigor, resulting in a new therapy that has impacted the lives of over 70,000 patients around the world.

Nevro has developed and commercialized the Senza spinal cord stimulation (SCS) system, an evidence-based, non-pharmacologic neuromodulation platform for the treatment of chronic pain. HF10 therapy has demonstrated the ability to reduce or eliminate opioids in ≥65% of patients across six peer-reviewed clinical studies. The Senza® System, Senza II™ System, and the Senza® Omnia™ System are the only SCS systems that deliver Nevro's proprietary HF10® therapy.


Engineering R&D Intern (Systems Engineering)

The Engineering R&D (Systems Engineering) Intern shall participate in product development activities across the spectrum from concept generation to verification and validation testing of Nevro’s various neuromodulation products. This position involves applying diversified knowledge of engineering principles and practices, and an active role in working with internal and external stakeholders towards executing on project milestones. 

  • Contribute to the design and development of an implantable medical device and associated external components.
  • Work with key stakeholders across the organization to understand user needs and define system architecture and requirements. Generate and evaluate concepts to support user need and system architecture development.
  • Create user interface test methods and drive usability evaluation of multiple aspects of the system.
  • Able to work in a regulated environment in accordance with internal operating procedures and external standards and regulations.
  • Able to do hands-on work remotely or in the R&D lab and help in the assembly, characterization and documentation of Nevro’s products.
  • Other duties as assigned.

  • Working towards an M.S. or B.S. in Biomedical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or similar degree.
  • Equivalent work experience may be substituted for education requirement

  • Have at least two years completed as part of a BS Engineering or equivalent degree.
  • Candidates with 3 years completed preferred.
  • Ability to provide creativity while solving complex problems without known solutions.
  • Ability to communicate clearly in a cross-functional setting.

We're looking for people who are ready to roll up their sleeves and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better.  
 
Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.

Job Description

Who is ServiceNow?

ServiceNow believes in the power of technology to create better ways to get work done, to make the world of work, work better for people.  We are excited and humbled to be named a “Great Place to Work,” a top U.S. employer by LinkedIn, and one of the best midsize employers by Forbes. We’re looking for people who are ready to roll up their sleeves and are passionate about creating products—and a company—that will change the way the world works.

 


Why should YOU intern @ ServiceNow?

Here’s what our “Class of 2020” has to say about working at ServiceNow: 

 

 

 

  • “Work within a scrum team, develop code within a corporate setting, use Git to manage source code, how to read through proprietary documentation to learn about our proprietary APIs and code base, work with the company politics to share my views on the design, implementation, and management of the ServiceNow platform”
  • “The positive vibes in my team, and the very detailed code reviews given by my mentor and colleagues, which helped me learned a lot”
  • “Challenging projects that taught them skills in software development and have a concrete impact on the company”
  • “I was really glad to have important work directed my way rather than a bunch of busywork and leftover tasks”
  • “Face-to-face exposure to senior execs and having candid conversations to learn about the company, helpful team, autonomy to learn and drive my own projects”
  • “I've formed relationship during the summer that I know I will maintain throughout life. Putting yourself out there and letting your ambition shine results in the most rewarding experiences” 
  •  

Our internship opportunities:
Engineering Ops, Product Operations, Technical Program Management

 

 

  • Execute large, complex, cross-functional projects
  • Apply solid judgment across multiple competing priorities
  • Engage and build relationships with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to ensure successful software development delivery, on time with high quality
  • Learn and apply an array of soft skills, working to shape and influence the culture of your teams, departments, and the company as a whole
  • Provide risk management tracking and clear status reporting to leadership team​​​​​​​

 

 

 

 

Qualifications

Who YOU are:

  • Actively enrolled in an accredited university as a full-time student, pursuing a degree (Bachelors or Masters) in Computer Science or a related field
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience with data analytics methods and software (e.g. Excel)
  • High levels of creativity, curiosity, determination, and problem-solving capabilities
  • Ability to obtain and maintain work authorization and commit to a 12-week internship in summer 2021 (May-August, or, June-September)
  • Experienced with Agile methodology and the Software Development Lifecycle
  • Preferred: Demonstrated software engineering experience from previous internship, academic or personal projects, coding competitions, or publications
  • Preferred: Experience with languages such as Java, C, Javascript, Python, or HTML/CSS

 



Additional Information

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.
