Explore an exciting opportunity to work with a global 3D visionary leader!

Our FARO University Internship Program is designed to equip students with the tools needed to succeed in the 3D world. You will be part of a cohort of students and work on meaningful projects that will add to your professional portfolio and skills. Internships can often lead to professional roles after graduation.

Our interns use their education and newly gained skills on real projects and are embedded in our teams, working side by side with FARO professionals. 

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will be developing the next generation of software that powers the FARO laser tracker.  You will work in a multi-disciplinary team developing efficient and innovative algorithms in the fields of 3-dimensional metrology and geometric processing.  You will perform research and development of new functions in software workflows, APIs and user-interface to provide increased data quality and create a human-centered product for our users.

In this internship, you will GAIN KNOWLEDGE – Become familiar with core processes and develop working knowledge of industry terminology. You will BUILD RELATIONSHIPS – Experience the business rhythm of the organization through participation in department meetings and observation of team role models.   • Open and innovative team culture
  • Expert networks to drive the technology of tomorrow

  • Availability for part time internship between January 2021 - May 2021
  • Ability to work some of the time in our facility in Lake Mary (this is not a remote position)
  • GPA of 3.0 or higher
  • Have a good grasp of Object-Oriented Programming
  • C# and .NET Framework / Core at least 3 years
  • Web API development on ASP .NET Core 2 or up (we are using version 3.1) and deployed at least one API to production
  • Experience using SQL to communicate with the database
  • Windows Desktop development, preferable WPF but WinForms should be good too

Desired Skills:

  • Docker
  • ASW Services (VPC, Route 53, S3, CloudFront, ECS, ECR, RDS, EC2, Cognito)
  • CI/CD

Key Behaviors:

  • Applicants need to work well with numbers, data, and units of measure.
  • Organization skills, attention to detail, effective communication skills (written and oral), and ability to multitask in a dynamic environment are a must.

The FARO internship program should be open-minded and curious about the world, seeking a potential career opportunity at a global company, and anxious to contribute to a challenging and diverse environment.  

Inclusive

At FARO, we are committed to encouraging different perspectives and ideas that foster innovation.  We believe that we are strongest with a diverse team of employees.  Our locations are free to respond to local needs to create a culturally sensitive workplace for everyone. In doing so, we want every FARO employee to feel our commitment to showing respect for all and encouraging open collaboration and communication.

FARO is an equal opportunity employer and provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. FARO is a government contractor and will take affirmative action as called for by applicable laws and Executive Orders.

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we're committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other's success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!

Role:

Do you have a passion for building data-driven products? Do you want to be part of an innovative team that is building the next generation of data-driven products for IT, Security, and Business Analytics? The Core Products group at Splunk is looking for a product management intern to work closely with our PM and engineering teams to help define and implement best-in-class data experiences for our customers.

You thrive in a dynamic environment and have a track record of technical expertise and product responsibility. You will get to work with a super smart bunch of folks who are doing state of the art development work (both native mobile and mobile back-end) in areas of machine learning, data analytics, and event correlations across silos to build best-in-class business analytics software.

  • Building out user scenarios and identify key personas (some persona creation may be applicable)
  • Supporting end user research including usability testing, user interviews, and metrics analysis to inform designs

Requirements:

  • You enjoy working well with others in a fast-paced environment
  • You enjoy working within an agile environment
  • Strong communication skills, verbal and written
  • You bring enthusiasm for solving interesting problems

Education:

Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or a related technical field, and strong record of academic achievement.

What We Offer You:

  • The opportunity to work with a set of extraordinarily talented and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support. Splunk flourishes with disruption and diversity.
  • A constant stream of new things for you to learn and an opportunity for growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.
  • A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment.

We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Quadratic provides advanced analytics, digital platform enablement, architected data solutions, and end-to-end relationship marketing services to more than 100 class-leading clients across a wide range of verticals.


Our rapidly growing digital analytics team is looking for a Summer intern who is ready to jump start a career in analytics. This is an awesome opportunity to learn the ins-and-outs of technical implementations, while honing your problem-solving and analytical skills. You will have the opportunity to gain exposure to a number of marketing analytics tools, like Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager, Adobe Analytics, and Tealium, receiving mentorship and training along the way.


But this won’t just be about learning, you will also be in a position to make an immediate and direct impact on our clients’ work––placing tags, validating data, running analyses, building and presenting reports, supporting website test development, and consulting clients on their marketing technology investments. 


Since our digital analytics team sits at the forefront of an ever-evolving digital landscape, we gravitate toward candidates who are equal parts left-brained and right-brained. If you’re ready to jump into one of the fastest growing career fields and excited to join a team of tireless learners within a growing company, you belong with us!


What you’ll do

  • Learn the foundations of digital analytics, starting with tag creation, tag implementation, and ongoing tag maintenance
  • Support the digital analytics team while gaining valuable skills for a long-term career in digital analytics
  • Maintain and optimize analytic platform integrations
  • Ensure integrity and reliability of data through ongoing quality control and data monitoring using various methods and tools
  • Extract and analyze data from Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, and other marketing analytics platforms for use in reports
  • Deliver impactful analyses to internal teams and key business owners, turning data into actionable recommendations
  • Participate in ongoing discussions concerning data collection, tagging, and data analysis
  • Anticipate client needs and work with team to proactively develop solutions to address them
  • Gather business requirements and help other members of the digital analytics team translate those into technical specifications and solutions
  • Support digital analytics team members in development of website tests and personalized digital experiences through creation and maintenance of test roadmaps, plans, and results decks
  • Integrate with internal teams and external stakeholders to drive cross-team collaboration


What you bring

  • A bachelor’s degree with a focus in a quantitative field (e.g., mathematics, statistics, arts and sciences, or business administration), marketing field, or computer science field – or equivalent years of work experience
  • Strong communication skills comfort communicating with clients to help bridge the gap between technology and business stakeholders
  • Genuine curiosity of the evolving digital landscape and the role of analytics in improving digital experience
  • An eagerness to learn and humility to ask for help when you don’t have the answer
  • A desire to be a self-starter, balanced with a desire to be a team player
  • Experience developing and presenting reports or data visualizations (Tableau, Google Data Studio, etc.) with an emphasis on telling a cohesive and compelling story
  • Agency, analytics, media, or advertising experience a plus (this could be a career change for someone in web development or a business analyst role)
  • Experience in one or more tag management systems, such as Adobe Launch/DTM, Google Tag Manager, or Tealium, a plus

Knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS a plus

description:
About NICE America Research Inc:

NICE America Research, Inc. is an established R&D Incubator in Silicon Valley, a subsidiary of the National Institute of Clean-and-low-carbon Energy (NICE) in Beijing, China. NICE is the corporate research arm of China Energy Investment Corporation which is an integrated energy company and a member of the Global Fortune 500.

 

We are currently building teams to develop cutting-edge Power Plant Smart Management (PPSM) platform based on digital twin and machine learning technologies, to improve the operating efficiencies of existing power generation plants, so to reduce the plantsâ€™ OPEX and emissions to protect the environment, and mitigate climate change by reducing the plantsâ€™ carbon footprints. We have carved out some exciting projects in Power Plant Smart Management platform software/UI development for an Intern. .

 

Job Responsibilities:

The PPSM project team aims to develop a software applying digital twin and machine learning technologies to provide online performance monitoring and assessment optimization guidance for power plants.  The successful intern candidate, under the direction of a senior scientist, is expected to:

 

  1. Work with the team to develop software/UI which can process and visualize the power plant operating data and the digital twin simulation data, undertake the data communications on demand in between live data, database storage, digital twin, and PPSM platform. 
  2. Develop a web browser type PPSM platform user interface (UI) which takes user inputs for digital twin and fetch data from database and provide data visualization on demand.
  3. Develop protocol for data communication in between MS excel and database (Oracle or MySQL), code excel macros using VBA,
  4. Develop and code ML (machine learning) algorithms to couple with existing physics-based digital twin models.

 

Required Qualifications:

  1. Enrolled in or completed degree program in Computer Science or related fields
  2. Experience with website coding development
  3. Proficiency in MS Excel VBA/Python/C/PHP/JSON.
  4. Proficiency in Oracle, MySQL
  5. Eager to learn and contribute.

Desired skills:

  1. Coding expertise in MS Excel VBA, Python/C/PHP/JSON.
  2. Knowledge of Oracle, MySQL
  3. Project documentation through reports
  4. Good communication skills in written, oral, and presentations.

 

Powered by JazzHR

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with scripting languages such as PowerShell, Bash and Python
  • Experience with virtualization, scripting automation and storage systems
  • Exposure to performing server, network and storage systems design, implementation and administration
  • Windows and Linux OS administration experience
  • Exposure to traditional enterprise platform management, server administration or relational databases  
  • Experience with infrastructure-as-a-service platforms such as AWS and Google Compute Engine
  • 3 or more years of work toward a bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field 
  • Experience with development using GitHub or TFS

Job Summary

Interns at the Rock Family of Companies gain priceless hands-on experience. Here, they learn how it feels to be in the workplace, participate in events and become a valuable member of our team.

Responsibilities 

  • Pair with engineering teams to support on-prem infrastructure
  • Help document processes and procedures  
  • Work with a mentor to learn and design automation of procedures and or tasks using tools such as PowerShell or Terraform, etc.
  • Assist with management and support of cloud infrastructure as well as on-prem servers   
  • Assist with driving infrastructure as code and configuration management communities of practices across the organization
  • Help perform routine maintenance of owned infrastructure such as patching and OS upgrades
  • Work with a mentor to help migrate systems from on-prem to cloud
  • Work with a mentor to help upgrade server OS
  • Identify opportunities to automate processes to help the server team be more efficient and effective in delivery of services
  • Participate during technical incidents to assist with troubleshooting and resolution of system outages
  • Participate during planning discussions with teams to help understand the scope of work required and communicate realistic expectations of what can be provided
  • Effectively research and troubleshoot solutions to problems as well as learn new technologies to assist the business functions
  • Network with teammates across the organization in order to build a comfort level with asking for help and providing help to others

Who We Are

Rock Central is recruiting for 20+ businesses in the Rock Family of Companies for Summer 2021 internships. Interns can expect to gain hands-on experience, learn how it feels to be in the workplace, participate in professional development opportunities and become a valuable member of a team.

Disclaimer 

This is an outline of the primary responsibilities of this position. As with everything in life, things change. The tasks and responsibilities can be changed, added to, removed, amended, deleted and modified at any time by the leadership group.

Overview

The position is for an Algorithm/Artificial Intelligence (AI) Engineering Intern with 0-3 years’ experience, to work on Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence R&D and Rapid Prototyping efforts at the Elbit Systems of America (ESA) Orlando site.  The job is critical to developing, demonstrating, and quantifying AI capabilities across ESA’s product and market portfolio. Algorithm development and deployment are central to this job function.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and analyze highly complex algorithms.
  • Implementation of algorithms in hardware and an understanding of the system design architecture trade space.
  • Provide technical support to customer, user lab, and on-aircraft testing
  • Perform system/product integration.
  • Verification and validation of highly complex system designs to ensure conformance with functional specifications and customer requirements.
  • Produce and/or review technical documents, specifications and standards.
  • Prepare Technical level presentations.
  • Provide outside contact with ESA affiliates and other contractors.
  • An ability to effectively document and communicate designs, results, reports, status and presentations.
  • Work independently and with internal/external organizations
  • Willingness to travel Domestically and Internationally.

Qualifications

  • Current pursuit of a Bachelor's Degree is required, Master’s Degree is highly desired
    • Specific Degree Field: Computer Science, Software Engineering, Systems Engineering, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or related
  • 0 to 3 years of defense, academic, or industrial experience in artificial intelligence, statistical machine learning, deep learning, Computer Vision, and natural language processing.
  • C, C++, Python, Matlab, Java experience
  • Experience implementing algorithms in Cuda (Highly Desired)
  • Unix/Linux OS experience (Highly Desired)
  • Embedded Software experience (Highly Desired)
  • Experience with Image processing / computer vision algorithm development
  • Machine Learning (ML) Network optimization for tactical applications
  • Hardware/software integration
  • Simulation and Modeling
  • User Interface development
  • Experience creating and presenting model output and performance of data to stakeholders.
  • Ability to read recent AI/ML research papers and adapt those into models to solve real world problems.
  • Experience creating and applying advanced statistical methods and complex algorithms such as: regression, clustering, simulation, scenario analysis, neural networks, deep/reinforcement learning, genetic algorithms, and other machine learning techniques.
  • Experience with any deep learning framework, including Tensorflow, Caffe, MxNet, Torch, Theano.

Position Description:

As part of the Ryder IT team, the Data Services Intern will perform a variety of job functions for traditional on premise as well as cloud based environments, including but not limited to, operational and analytical database design, working with structured, semi-structured and/or unstructured data, data profiling/analysis, database, data ingestion, ETL, report and dashboard development, testing, documentation, and production environments support including troubleshooting and break fixes. The position could be extended past the summer internship period and may lead to a temporary position.

Requirements:

  • Senior/Graduate Students pursuing a bachelor's or master’s degree in management information systems (MIS) , computer science, data science or computer engineering preferred
  • Exposure to SQL, database management systems, NO-SQL databases, ETL tools like Informatica preferred
  • Exposure to cloud technologies and platforms desired
  • Exposure to machine learning and predictive modeling desired
  • Knowledge to scripting languages like UNIX shell scripting, Python, R preferred
  • Must be self-motivated, results-oriented and accountable
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Ability to work independently
  • Passionate for learning
  • Good organizational skills
  • Ability to:
  • Write SQL queries
  • Learn new technologies and tools, bring new ideas to the team and be an effective team player
  • Effectively communicate with management and co-workers and customers; strong customer focus
  • Learn, adapt, grow, and be flexible
  • Multitask, demonstrate good organization and time management skills
  • Work well under pressure, successfully meet schedules, work independently as needed to produce high quality work with minimal supervision
  • Operate as part of a cross-functional project team that will organize, plan and execute varying scale projects from vision to implementation
  • Knowledge of:
  • Data Warehouse Dimensional model structures, including facts and dimensions preferred
  • Information technologies
  • Cloud platform like Microsoft Azure desired
  • BI tools (e.g. MicroStrategy, Power BI, Tableau, Cognos, etc.)
  • Certificate in Cloud based data ingestion, storage and analytics tools like Azure Data Factory, BLOB Storage, Power BI etc. completed or in progress desired
  • Certificate in database management systems or business intelligence completed or in progress preferred
  • Robotic Process Automation (RPA) knowledge desired
  • Windows and UNIX operating systems

Responsibilities:

  • Work with on premise and cloud based solutions and platforms
  • Analyze and document data requirements including facilitation of sessions with business
  • Data analysis and profiling
  • Collaborate with the technical team, in any given product development cycle, on data requirements
  • ETL source to target documentation including business matrix and functional requirements
  • Develop and test data ingestion and ETL processes
  • Troubleshoot data ingestion, ETL and data issues
  • Design, develop, and support interactive visual dashboards and reports
  • ​Ability to write SQL queries to profile data and validate solutions delivered against data sources
  • SQL troubleshooting
  • Develop and test scripts to support ETL jobs execution
  • Understand that the end user is the primary reason for the technology and therefore strive for full customer satisfaction
  • Partner with key members of various departments to determine the definitions of essential data elements
  • Work with data architects to review and implement logical and physical database models
  • Support the mapping of source system data to target models into data warehouse and data lake
  • Define and capture metadata and rules associated with the calculation of metrics
  • Test automation
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Job Category

Intern

When you choose Ryder, you get access to industry-leading technology, one of North America’s largest fleet of trucks, an expansive infrastructure of maintenance facilities and warehouses, and some of the most talented people in the industry.

description:
SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE…

  • Develop professional-grade department websites that can be accessed by corporate customers, suppliers, and internal users.
  • Responsible for planning, developing, and managing information placed on the websites.
  • Create easily usable features to find information the users need to make decisions quickly and efficiently.
  • Determine effective data transfer methods with data source owners.
  • Set Up different security levels based on user privilege level.
  • Visualizing the data to allow end-users, including the senior management team, to review and understand trends, outliers, and patterns in data.
  • Set up weekly tasks, milestones, deliverables, and timelines for each assigned project.
  • Report challenges along with alternative solutions to minimize impact to the overall schedule.

WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO BRING TO THIS ROLE...

  • Experienced in programming languages such as JAVA, React, Angular, C, C++, and Python.
  • Knowledge of data gathering, cleaning, and transforming using MySQL and PostgreSQL.
  • Reporting and data visualization skills using software like Tableau and Google Data Studio.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Great writing skills in the English language.
  • Good communication and presentation skills.
  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters program in Computer Science or related fields with an expected graduation date in or after December 2021.
  • Able to work full-time for 12 weeks during Summer 2021.

Intern - Audio SW Engineering

Deer Park, IL

177854BR

Job Description

Overview:

Continental Voice Solutions team is currently looking for a talented, self-motivated intern to push the state of the art in speech and audio processing algorithms. As a candidate, we want you to have a clear understanding of deep learning architectures, techniques and applications, so convolutional or recurrent networks are trivial concepts for you already, and you usually play around with more complex ideas and developments around generative models, e.g. Normalizing Flows, VAEs, GANs, and others. Additional experience with audio synthesis and neural vocoders will be highly valuable.


Core Responsibilities:

• Collaborate with group of Research engineers in design and development of new technologies in speech and audio processing (Echo cancellation, Noise reduction, Equalization, multi-microphone processing etc.) for automotive environment.

• Implementing, training, and evaluating Machine Learning/AI models

• Proposing and prototyping new research ideas

• Reproducing and extending existing research

• Perform evaluations and compare with the state-of-the-art (possibly reimplementing some of those)

Additional Responsibilities:

• Participate in feature development and debug activities.

• Collect and analyze test results and recommend improvement actions.

• Document and communicate your findings efficiently and in timely manner.


Core Capabilities:

• Ability to work well with minimal supervision

• Passion for Speech processing

• Passionate about building extraordinary products

• Creative, collaborative, & quality focused

Job Requirements

Required Qualifications:

• Must be enrolled in a US accredited degree program

• Must maintain a minimum GPA of a 2.8

• Knowledge in Machine or deep learning

• Knowledge of common ML frameworks and deep learning libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.)

• Good Python/MATLAB programming skills


Preferred Qualifications:

• Pursuing PhD or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Machine Learning, or related areas

• Knowledge on audio signal processing is a plus

Job Type

Internship

Description This supervised position will allow for a college student who is seeking a career in Analytics to develop professionally as well as to enhance their knowledge with regard to the power generation industry, power/gas commodities markets, and all aspects of Calpine functions. This position will require the individual to work a normal day shift. This job will be based out of the Corporate Office (Houston, TX) and may require in-office or work from home hours.

Job Summary:

The Asset Management team at Calpine Corp. works with the commercial and operations groups to analyze plant performance and propose actionable feedback. The team aggregates data and develops models used to assess Calpine’s fleet of power generation assets.
The intern will support Calpine’s Asset Management team in a wide range of analytic projects.

Primary responsibilities can include but are not limited to:
• Support Asset Analytics and Modeling Activities to drive capital investment allocation
• Support Model Development and Automation to help balance Asset use vs Asset sustainability
• Cross function communication between Operations and Commercial groups
• Ad hoc projects with clear commercially advantageous outcomes
Requirements • Candidate should be a rising Junior or Senior working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in a Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Engineering at an accredited college or university.
• Minimum 3.0 GPA required.
• Legally eligible to work in the US now and in the future.
• Strong Excel skills (Vlookup, Sumifs, Pivot Tables, Macros)
• Demonstrated modeling aptitude creating complex Excel models.
• Ability to apply analytical tools such as Tableau
• Knowledge of the energy industry, specifically the power or utility sector, is a plus.
• Strong verbal and written communication skills.
• Good problem solving and analytical ability
• Good organization skills and attention to details are essential

position: Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence Intern - Downtown Austin
description:
Description

ThisWay Global is an Austin-based startup in the recruitment space and we are looking for engineering interns to work with large datasets that will help people find jobs.

We have a suite of products designed to streamline and reduce the headache of sourcing top qualified candidates.Our company builds artificial intelligence and automation technology for the HR tech space, servicing SME and enterprise customers. We are currently looking for a talented Engineering Intern to join the team in our Austin, TX office. For this internship you must be living in the US and also be a US Citizen. Due to the current hiring freeze this is an unpaid, volunteer intern position.


On a daily basis you may be asked to do any one of the following jobs :

  • Analyze datasets and determine best approaches for normalization
  • Define and perform comparative analysis to determine the best algorithms to use for each dataset
  • Propose and code/build (using Kotlin/Java and supporting libraries and systems) various ML/AI/computational algorithms for normalizing the datasets

Requirements

  • Currently pursuing BSc/MSc in Computer Science or related major
  • Fluent in at least one JVM based programming language (Java/Kotlin – Kotlin preferred)
  • Conversant with Spring/SpringBoot and/or willing to learn
  • Experience with AI (ML, Deep Learning) and data science would be a plus, especially Java/Kotlin libraries like Smile, DeepLeaning4J, Jenetics, Krangle
  • Highly motivated to learn and be up-to-date with technology
  • You must be a self-starter with the ability to work autonomously.
  • You need to be able to stay calm and positive when solving a problem with a team.

Benefits

  • You will be developing products that will help people find jobs with great companies, without using outdated job search processes.
  • Tailor-made mentorship program - we are interested in hiring full-time after the internship.
  • Flexible in terms of working schedule.
  • Working with a top-level team that is experienced in building successful startups.
  • We have a great office located downtown Austin. close to restaurants, hike/bike and running trails.

Description

Are you looking to make a difference in a patient’s life?  At AmerisourceBergen, you will find an innovative culture that is patient focused and dedicated to making a difference.  As an organization, we are united in our responsibility to create healthier futures.

This includes gathering requirements, assisting with solution design, and testing. You will have the opportunity to work with multiple development technologies and expand your application development knowledge.

  • GPA of 3.0 or higher.

  • Working towards a bachelor’s degree in MIS, Computer Science, or Information Technology preferred
  • Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing
  • Good project management skills
  • Strong interpersonal, teamwork, and leadership skills
  • Good analytical, conceptual and problem solving skills to evaluate business problems and apply knowledge to identify appropriate solutions
  • Must be eager to learn, self-motivated, flexible, accountable and can effectively handle multiple tasks at one time
  • Excellent organizational and time-management skills

  • Knowledge of application development concepts

AmerisourceBergen is a publicly traded Fortune 10 global healthcare solutions company and is one of the world's largest pharmaceutical services companies. Powered by our associates around the world, we provide pharmaceutical products and business solutions that improve access to care. We operate the backbone of the healthcare supply chain. We drive the future of local care delivery. We guide medical innovations to market. We create healthier futures.

As a Software Engineer Intern, you will work with tenured engineers to develop enhancements to the IdentityNow and Identity AI product/tools and participate within the full development process.

You will encounter a variety of technical challenges that will refine your problem solving skills and work with a wide range of established and emerging technologies.

In our small, Agile engineering teams, you will often collaborate with cross functional team members to shape the future of our products. This opportunity offers excellent exposure to industry best-practices in a fast-paced, highly successful company with a great place to work culture and fun atmosphere.

Responsibilities:

  • Work under the guidance of tenured engineers to develop enhancements to IdentityNow and IdentityAI products, tools and tests
  • Participate within the full development process including design, implementation, test, documentation, review and deployment
  • Implement software and procedures that provide value to the SailPoint team and our customers
  • Work with software and quality assurance engineers, technical writers and product managers to help deliver elegant software solutions
  • Learn about Agile, Angular, AWS, Chef, CSS, Docker, Groovy, HTML, Java, Javascript, Maven, REST, Ruby, Selenium, Scrum, SQL, Tomcat, XML, and others!

 Requirements:

  • Working knowledge of Java, Javascript, UNIX, HTTP
  • Good understanding of computer science fundamentals, data structures and algorithms
  • Good problem solving skills
  • An interest and aptitude for delivering sophisticated and robust product, tool and test solutions

Education:

Recently obtained or upper division student working towards a minimum Bachelor’s degree in CS/EE/MIS or related field

SailPoint is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome everyone to our team.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

COMPENSATION

  • Unpaid
  • College Credit


Essential Functions

  • Performs market analysis on top competitors marketing strategies (including but not limited to social media, event activations, web, etc.) as a part of a competitor research project.
  • Assists with all social media accounts.
  • Assists with database and all Client Relationship Management (CRM) accounts.
  • Assists with preparing printing and promotional items.
  • Assists with Coordinating set up of networking events and all other company events.
  • Assists with website design and maintenance.
  • Assists with web leads – tracking and coordinating response to and assignment of leads to loan terms.  
  • Develop emails, landing pages, forms, lead scoring, segmentation, and nurture flows to support the marketing team.
  • Organizes and assists with maintaining all marketing material.
  • Helps seek out prospective clients through making phone calls and utilizing the Internet and social media.
  • Researches and learns all new emerging technologies and trends.
  • May perform other duties as assigned.
  • Must have strong organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks and projects.
  • Analyze marketing initiatives and provide feedback on next steps.
  • Contribute to overall marketing team responsibilities.

 

Professional Skills

  • Proficient in MS Office Suite - Excel, Power Point and Word
  • Pursuing a University/College degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, or related field
  • Strong technical aptitude necessary
  • A curious mind that’s good at problem solving
  • Strong drive and resilience
  • Familiarity with HTML/CSS/JavaScript a plus
  • Exceptional client services and support skills
  • Exceptional communication, interpersonal and support skills

Job Description

Information Technology Intern 

Job Code: IT2021

The Chicago Metropolitan Agency for Planning (CMAP) is hiring an intern in the Information Technology Division.  The intern will be responsible for providing technical support within the IT division as well as providing first-level technical expertise, advice, and support to all CMAP staff.  Duties for this position includes; providing help desk user support to staff. Assisting with fundamental operations of commonly used software, hardware, and other equipment.  Perform hardware upgrades (memory installs, hard drive upgrades).  Install desktops, laptops, monitors, printers, and other IT related equipment. Assist with configuring and deploying desktop computers and laptops.  Assist in the research and documentation of CMAP computer systems. This internship opportunity will be remote and selected candidate must have personal laptop to use.

Qualifications and skills 

Applicants should have a working knowledge of common operating systems and software applications including Windows 10 and Microsoft Office (i.e., 2016, O365).  Must possess the ability to communicate effectively with team members.  Basic understanding of computers and computer networking is also required.  Knowledge in databases (i.e.,  Microsoft Access, SQL, etc.) is desired, but not required. 

Education and experience

Undergraduate applicants must be entering their junior or senior year in Fall 2021.  Current enrollment in a Bachelor or Masters’ degree program in Computer Science, Business Administration, or Information Systems is recommended.  It is important that applicants have a general understanding of personal computers, printers, troubleshooting, and Microsoft Office software.

Internship timeframe

Depending on the student’s availability, this is a full-time summer position beginning in May or June 2021. It could potentially continue into the 2021-22 school year, but that is not guaranteed.  Minor start and end-date accommodations may be made upon request. 

Equipment

All or part of the work will be done remotely therefore interns will need access to a Windows computer, in good working order.  However, to promote a diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment, and create professional development opportunities for interns, we will support interns with specific technology limitations with the use of a CMAP issued laptop with the expectation that it be returned upon conclusion of the internship. 

This job description in no way sates or implies that these are the only duties performed by the employee occupying this position  Employees may be required to follow other job-related instructions and perform other job-related duties as requested, subject to all applicable state and federal laws.  Certain job functions described herein may be subject to possible modification and accordance with applicable state and federal laws.

Company Description

The Chicago Metropolitan Agency for Planning (CMAP) is our region’s comprehensive planning organization. The agency and its partners are implementing ON TO 2050, a long-range plan to help the seven counties and 284 communities of northeastern Illinois implement strategies that address transportation, housing, economic development, open space, the environment, and other quality-of-life issues. See cmap.illinois.gov/about for more information on the agency’s vision and core values. 

CMAP is always looking for talented, self-motivated individuals to join our team. If you think you are ready to be a part of an exciting team, then we encourage you to continue with this applicant friendly, online job application!

CMAP is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.  The Chicago Metropolitan Agency for Planning does not sponsor H1B visas.

Copart is seeking candidates who desires to intern in the database development and analytics team. The internship will be focused around database modeling, analytics, business intelligence, development and maintenance.

Learning Scope:

* Develop Analytical skills working on data needs from both transactional & reporting application

* Understand data flow as per business needs while supporting projects focused on ETL or data pipeline.

* Develop physical & conceptual data model skills

* Learn Data migration/conversion strategies while working in project with high level of data churning.

* Troubleshoot production data issues. Identify and Cleanup of junk data.

* Program and write SQL code to support the creation of tables, views, stored procedures, functions, reports and triggers.

* Work with application teams to identify ways to optimize the database tier and work to implement improvements for future releases.

Desirable Skills:

Hi, We’re AppFolio.

We’re innovators, changemakers, and collaborators. We’re more than just a software company — we’re a cloud-based powerhouse that creates products to make our customers’ lives easier. We’re revolutionizing the way people do business, and we ​want your ideas, your enthusiasm, and your passion​ to help us keep on innovating.

We love where we work, and you can, too.


What You’ll Do

Build and operate complex data pipelines that provide the data used across our business

Perform data analytics for operational activities

Implement new features and optimize existing parts of our data-pipeline 

Design and create dashboards for teams to monitor our infrastructure and data. 

Work closely with, and incorporate feedback from other engineering team members.

Leverage agile practices, encourage collaboration, prioritization, and urgency to develop at a rapid pace

Research, share, and recommend new technologies and trends


What We’re Looking For

We are hiring a Data Ops Engineer intern to help us create robust data pipeline systems who would monitor our infrastructure and perform quality checks by creating dashboards, writing SQL queries, python scripts, and data scripting. 

You know you’re the right fit if...

  • You love handling data and ensuring it’s delivered reliably into the right hands.
  • You have some experience working with Ruby, Python, or SQL.
  • You’ve heard of Snowflake, Docker, DataDog, Tableau, Git, CI/CD and would love to get your hands dirty. 
  • You love learning about new technologies but understand the value of continuing using something old if it still does everything you need it to do.
  • You care about the codebase’s long-term maintainability and will learn to advocate for refactoring and clean-ups where appropriate.
  • You care about work-life balance and want your company to care about it, too; you'll put in the extra hour when needed but won't let it become a habit.

Must-Haves

  • BS, MS, or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related technical discipline
  • Hands-on work/internship experience with developing web-based applications, data platforms, or creating data pipelines. 
  • Creativity, ability to solve complex problems without a roadmap
  • Experience working across all levels of the development stack
  • Experience with some areas of our tech like databases, Snowflake, DataDog, Airflow, Linux. 
  • Familiarity with Agile software development processes: Scrum or Kanban
  • Familiarity with Test-Driven-Development

Our Story

AppFolio (NASDAQ: APPF) was founded in 2006 with the mission to revolutionize vertical industry businesses by providing great software and service. Our easy-to-use, cloud-based software helps our customers more effectively market, manage, and grow their businesses.

To find out more about what AppFolio has to offer, check out appfolioinc.com/careers.

What We’re Looking For

We are hiring a Web Operations Intern to help build, develop, and maintain our cloud-based infrastructure.  Our goal is to “automate all the things!” and use Infrastructure As Code (IaC) practices. The ideal candidate is excited about building, maintaining, and (yes, occasionally) destroying infrastructure. We work closely with product teams to assess their needs and help them bring applications to fruition to bring value to our customers.


You may be the right fit if:

  • You care about complex systems and how things fit together and share data 
  • You have an interest in databases, how they work, and how to keep data safe
  • You are interested in how computational infrastructure works and have some familiarity with IaC concepts.  If you hear the word Terraform and don’t first think of the planet Mars, you instead think of deploying resources in AWS; this might be a good fit.
  • You have heard about host configuration tools such as Puppet and Ansible and may have an opinion about what’s best.
  • You are interested in helping software development teams successfully run applications in production.
  • You care about building reliable and robust systems
  • You are curious about application performance and the nitty-gritty details that affect performance across the stack 
  • You care about your team and our impact on our customers
  • You love learning about new technologies but understand the value of continuing using something old if it still does everything you need it to do.
  • You care about work-life balance and want your company to care about it, too; you'll put in the extra hour when needed but won't let it become a habit.

Must-Haves

  • BS, MS, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline
  • Hands-on work/internship experience developing web-based applications, preferably in a SaaS environment
  • Creativity, ability to solve complex problems without a roadmap
  • Experience working across all levels of the stack
  • Experience with some areas of our tech like Ruby on Rails, AWS, Linux, SOA
  • Familiarity with Agile software development processes: Scrum or Kanban
  • Familiarity with Test-Driven-Development

Our Story

position: SAP HXM iXp Intern - Agile Developer
description:
Requisition ID: 279774

Work Area: Software-Design and Development

Expected Travel: 0 - 10%

Career Status: Student

Employment Type: Intern

Career Level: NA


COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.


SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.


About the SAP Internship Experience Program


The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.


Three reasons to intern at SAP


1. Culture of collaboration : meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.

2. Project-driven experience : gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.

3. Gain visibility : with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.


About the team


We are a hardworking and fun-loving global team with open environment. We have lot of domain knowledge and technical experts in the team to learn from. Our SCRUM teams are completely in control of what and how projects are executed. We support flexible hours and a lot of learning opportunities for our newly boarded team members. Every two week we invite speakers from within the team or from other teams to talk about different projects, products, technical designs , etc to keep ourselves up to date.


What you’ll do:


Position title: SAP HXM iXp Intern – Agile Developer


Location: Palo Alto, CA


Expected start date: As soon as possible – with possibility of 1-year extension


In this role, you’ll:


+ Learn how core HR application work, what tools, technologies, and frameworks are used.

+ Work on new target architectural projects as decided by the SCRUM team.

+ Focus on coding, testing, and automating specific product features, being part of the SCRUM team.

+ Learn about standard cloud application development practices by applying them on real life cases.


Who you are:


We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.


+ Minimum BS degree in computer science or related field

+ Gained more than 1 year of experience in application development and automation

+ Object oriented programming, Database and Java (related technologies)

+ Logic and solving problems

+ Designing and executing.

+ Being supporting and accommodating

+ Adopting and Improvising

+ Any automation tool


Follow @SAPiXp onInstagram (https://www.instagram.com/sapixp/)and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!


WHAT YOU GET FROM US


Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If youre searching for a company thats dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment apply now _._


SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.


SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com , APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com , EMEA: Careers@sap.com ).


Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.


Additional Locations :Virtual - USA

The Simulation/Re-simulation team is a diverse group of software developers that focus on providing simulation and data manipulation tools to support the development activities of our scientists. The team enables virtual testing of our autonomous driving software before it hits the road. We are seeking a talented Software Engineering Intern to help develop and roll out the next generation of advanced tools to support virtual autonomous driving tests.

The Motional global headquarters are located at 100 Northern Avenue in Boston, MA. Nestled in the busting Seaport district with sweeping views of Boston Harbor and downtown Boston, the offices are located close to major transit lines and a quick walk to various restaurants and popular attractions.

What you'll be doing:
  • Development of software components and/or tools that will support the testing and evaluation of the performance of core autonomous driving systems (localization / perception / planning / control)
  • Work closely with different groups to provide solutions that make use of different data sources (real / synthetic) to support testing and benchmarking of algorithms in an automated way.
  • Collaborate with teams and stakeholders in offices around the world.
What we're looking for:
  • Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or a related field.
  • Fluency in Python and/or C++.
  • Experience with Linux work environment, software, and toolchains.
  • Excellent analytical, communication, and writing skills.
Bonus points (not required):
  • Experience in software development for robotics systems or complex system simulations
  • Experience with programming for multi-threaded systems
  • Experience with IPC and distributed systems
  • Database file manipulation using C++ / Python
  • Docker
  • GUI development using Qt / QML3
  • Unity game engine programming experience (C#)

Technical Intern

Job Summary:
We are seeking a creative staff member to provide new capabilities to our enterprise level applications. You will be working with a product team to create value add enhancements to the applications based on customer requests and the technical roadmap. The ideal candidate is a self-starter that has strong interpersonal and communications skills and able to be productive working remotely. This is an intern position.

Principal Accountabilities:
• Maintain and create enhancements for applications
• Assist in preparation for migration of on-premise application to Cloud
• Interface with developers and QA staff to understand the requirements and features of software releases and develop appropriate test plans
• Investigate, debug, and resolve a wide variety of problems that occur with software applications
• Provide on-going technical support to application users
• Create and maintain application technical documentation

Knowledge and Experience:
• Computer Science Majors preferred
• Experience with Programming Languages (e.g. C#, Java, Javascript, Python)
• Experience developing web applications
• Database knowledge and experience with SQL
• Experience working in a Linux environment
• Experience with HTML, CSS, ASP.NET, MVC/Angular is a plus
• Familiarity with Cloud Based Applications is a plus
• Experience with Agile/DevOps is a plus

Other Accountabilities:
Perform other duties as assigned

We’re innovators, changemakers, and collaborators. We’re more than just a software company — we’re a cloud-based powerhouse that creates products to make our customers’ lives easier. We’re revolutionizing the way people do business, and we ​want your ideas, your enthusiasm, and your passion​ to help us keep on innovating.

We love where we work, and you can, too.


What You’ll Do

Develop scalable, robust, and simple ​web-based solutions to solve complex business problems

Formulate, implement, and evaluate algorithms and database queries to support SaaS scalability and stability.

Implement new features ​and optimize existing ones to drive maximum performance

Use test-driven development, code reviews, and continuous integration ​to deliver high-quality software and rapidly fix bugs as they come up.

Work closely with, and incorporate feedback from​ other engineering team members.

Leverage agile practices, encourage collaboration, prioritization, and urgency to develop at a rapid pace.

Research, share and recommend ​new technologies and trends.


What We’re Looking For

We are hiring a Web Operations Intern to help build, develop, and maintain our cloud-based infrastructure.  Our goal is to “automate all the things!” and use Infrastructure As Code (IaC) practices. The ideal candidate is excited about building, maintaining, and (yes, occasionally) destroying infrastructure. We work closely with product teams to assess their needs and help them bring applications to fruition to bring value to our customers.


You may be the right fit if:

  • You care about complex systems and how things fit together and share data 
  • You have an interest in databases, how they work, and how to keep data safe
  • You are interested in how computational infrastructure works and have some familiarity with IaC concepts.  If you hear the word Terraform and don’t first think of the planet Mars, you instead think of deploying resources in AWS; this might be a good fit.
  • You have heard about host configuration tools such as Puppet and Ansible and may have an opinion about what’s best.
  • You are interested in helping software development teams successfully run applications in production.
  • You care about building reliable and robust systems
  • You are curious about application performance and the nitty-gritty details that affect performance across the stack 
  • You care about your team and our impact on our customers
  • You love learning about new technologies but understand the value of continuing using something old if it still does everything you need it to do.
  • You care about work-life balance and want your company to care about it, too; you'll put in the extra hour when needed but won't let it become a habit.

Must-Haves

  • BS, MS, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline
  • Hands-on work/internship experience developing web-based applications, preferably in a SaaS environment
  • Creativity, ability to solve complex problems without a roadmap
  • Experience working across all levels of the stack
  • Experience with some areas of our tech like Ruby on Rails, AWS, Linux, SOA
  • Familiarity with Agile software development processes: Scrum or Kanban
  • Familiarity with Test-Driven-Development

Our Story

AppFolio (NASDAQ: APPF) was founded in 2006 with the mission to revolutionize vertical industry businesses by providing great software and service. Our easy-to-use, cloud-based software helps our customers more effectively market, manage, and grow their businesses.

To find out more about what AppFolio has to offer, check out appfolioinc.com/careers.

Key tasks include engaging with unit managers to increase adoption, end user training, managing/leading meetings, and reviewing, assigning, and completing project tasks.


This role will also have a special project with the MyChart Bedside Mobile team. The challenge we face and will be working on, is making sure our clinical staff have the training and support to effectively engage with the patients and drive patient usage.

Behind all of this success is an amazing group of people who are passionate about bringing innovation to the marketplace, while providing quality and affordability to better the lives of people all over the world. If you share in our passion for teamwork and a vision for excellence, let's talk about a rewarding career at Glidewell! 

Essential Functions:

  • To program and develop in-house automation applications. Solve complex robotics problems with innovative solutions. Operate as a member of a functional team to deliver the well-engineered solutions and help manufacturing team meet the objectives.
  • Collaborates to design and develop complex software applications for autonomous machines and robots using C, C++, and / or C#.
  • Assists with evaluation and testing various robot hardware, sensors (Vision cameras, 3D scanners etc.) to find the most suitable equipment for various applications.
  • Works on hands-on integration of robotics software technology into automation machines.
  • Interacts with internal and external customers to understand and clarify customer needs.
  • Researches new technology in the areas of robotics and automation.
  • Provides technical support and consultation to staff and customers.
  • Maintains and documents developed software solutions for continuous improvement efforts.
  • Collaborates with industry consortiums, universities, or internal departments.
  • Performs other related duties and projects as business needs require at direction of management.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Must be currently pursuing a Bachelors or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Physics, or Mathematics.
  • Minimum two (2) years of experience developing C and C++ or C# applications.
  • Experience with OpenCV / computer vision.
  • Must possess effective oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel in a professional and effective manner.
  • Experience / knowledge of python, a plus.
  • Experience of .Net, a plus.

Job Description

Arc XP (www.arcxp.com) is a cloud-based digital experience platform that helps enterprise companies, retail brands and media and entertainment organizations create and distribute content, drive digital commerce, and deliver powerful multichannel experiences. A division of The Washington Post, Arc XP has powered the digital transformation of customers across the globe, currently serving more than 1,500 sites in 24 countries that reach more than 1.5 billion unique visitors monthly.

Join a team of engineers that build software to meet the needs of The Washington Post, while also making the same software available to other publishers, broadcasters and brands around the world via software as a service.

We are currently looking for a Product Management intern to join us this summer (or sooner!) to help us plan and execute the next phase of the Arc suite. The Product Manager intern will work with our team of Product Managers and Technical Product Managers to evolve Arc’s content authoring and commerce capabilities.

Ideal candidates should be currently enrolled in or have just completed a program in an accredited university or coding/product bootcamp. Computer Science and Business concentrations are highly relevant, but candidates with other backgrounds will be considered, especially if they have startup or other demonstrated entrepreneurial experience.  

Eligibility: Due to Covid-19, all internships will be 100% remote this year. However, working from DC or Chicago is a bonus.

The Post strives to provide its readers with high-quality, trustworthy news and information while constantly innovating. That mission is best served by a diverse, multi-generational workforce with varied life experiences and perspectives. All cultures and backgrounds are welcomed.

About the role:

We are looking for a highly-motivated and beauty enthusiasts student to join our Machine Learning Engineering team. We have a range of exciting projects to meet your technical interests including large-scale classification of short text, deep learning problems for recommender systems, causal inference and heterogeneous treatment effects, as well as unsupervised user segmentation.

This will be a 3-month long internship and will start in the Summer of 2021. Each intern will be assigned a mentor and have the opportunity to lead their projects and present their results to the wider organization.

What You’ll Be Doing;

  • Work with a dedicated mentor to scope a project that fits our business needs and your technical interests
  • Develop exploratory data analysis to make the case for your project
  • Develop ML models to solve business objectives. Projects include: NLP, recommender systems, data augmentation, causal inference, and unsupervised user segmentation
  • Document your work via internal wikis, design documents, recorded demos, and slide presentations

What We’re Looking For:
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelors, Master’s or PhD in Computer Science or related field
  • Solid programming skills in Python
  • Practical experience in one or more of the following areas: natural language processing, causal inference, recommender systems, or deep learning
  • Practical experience with cleaning, manipulating, and analyzing large data sets
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively as a member of a team

Time Commitment: 40 hours per week

About BFA INDUSTRIES:

BFA Industries inspires everyone to express themselves, making beauty accessible for all. Through product innovation, machine learning technology, and a community-first mindset, we democratize beauty by delivering not only personalized experiences, but a feeling of authentic self-expression. We’re home to the largest beauty subscription brands in the world: IPSY and BoxyCharm, as well as brand incubator, Madeby Collective, and personal care brand, Refreshments and have a beauty community that’s over 30M strong. Headquartered in San Mateo, with offices in New York, Miami, Santa Monica, and Argentina, BFA brings together a diverse group of entrepreneurial thinkers and creative problem solvers with a penchant for getting things done.

Company Description

Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins works with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate.Eurofins believes it is a global leader in food, environmental, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies.

In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 47,000 staff across a network of more than 900 independent companies in over 50 countries and operating more than 800 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialised clinical diagnostics testing.

 In 2019, Eurofins generatedtotal revenues of EUR € 4.56 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.

Internships are a great way for university students to learn about a technology or product they are passionate about while gaining practical work experience in a corporate environment.  At Fujifilm Sonosite, we are committed to finding talented students who share our passion for medical device technology and this internship reflects that commitment!  We have the opportunity, you have the talent!  Read on to learn more about what we are looking for and if you think you’ve got what it takes to be successful in this role, apply today!  

 

FUJIFILM, Sonosite, Inc . From sophisticated urban hospital emergency rooms to clinics in austere, remote villages, Fujifilm Sonosite systems are used by over 21 medical specialties and provide clinicians around the world with a cost-effective tool for improving patient safety and workflow efficiency. Fujifilm Sonosite holds a number of prestigious design awards and has in excess of 145 patents.


Job Summary:

The intern will assist the AI Technology team during the summer months of 2021. They will research state of the art approaches to machine learning, run experiments on AI models  to improve performance, label and manage data and report on results achieved.

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Become familiar with basic ultrasound imaging 
  • Research state of the art approaches to machine learning solutions 
  • Run various experiments on Deep Learning models for PIV/PTX/FF/Cardiac AI applications
  • Learn about existing Deep Learning solutions for PIV/PTX/FF/Cardiac AI applications
  • Research state of the art solutions to DL problems
  • Apply research to PIV/PTX applications
  • Document experimental results

Knowledge and Experience:

  • Working towards BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science undergraduate program with an interest in artificial intelligence.
  • Prefer some knowledge of Deep Learning
  • Linear algebra
  • Strong object oriented Python programming skills
  • Knowledge of computer vision algorithms preferred
  • GIT familiarity is desired
  • Prefer some experience with TensorFlow, but not required.
  • Jupyter notebook experience
  • C++ experience desired
  • Android development a plus

Skills and Abilities:

  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both within other groups in
  • Engineering and throughout the company.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, small team environment with minimal supervision.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to lift 25 pounds, with or without accommodations.

position: Business Analyst / SharePoint Consultant – Intern Job Description
description:
JourneyTEAM is more than just a place to work. We are an organization that values creativity, innovative thinking and diversity. We offer a great opportunity to work alongside highly intelligent and motivated people. Reach your potential by helping us reach ours. Our growth means exciting career opportunities for talented professionals. We offer competitive compensation, excellent training and a vibrant working environment. We have been awarded as one of the Utah Businesses “Top Places to Work” because of our culture and passion.

Internship Description

JourneyTEAM is seeking a motivated Technical Business Analyst Intern who is ready to apply knowledge of business practices and processes in a fast-paced, real-world, technical environment. The intern will assist in writing technical documentation, conducting research, analyzing data, defining business process, making recommendations, and implementing solutions to improve effectiveness and efficiency. This will be a valuable experience for any student pursuing a career in technical business administration or technical business analyst.

  • Location: Draper, Utah
  • Department: SharePoint / Knowledge Management
  • Type: Part Time/ Full Time
  • Duration: 3 Months
  • Compensation: $15 - $20 per Hour

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Able to quickly learn systems, processes, and procedures, grasp technical concepts, and adapt easily to change
  • Work with Clients to analyze business goals, objectives, and needs
  • Prepare documents to present findings and approach to client
  • Willingness to learn SharePoint, MS Teams, PowerApps, Power Automate, Forms, SharePoint Workflows and related technologies, to implement solutions for Clients
  • Can analyze and solve complex problems quickly and creatively
  • Demonstrate a strong technical background and be able to learn complex products and how multiple platforms work together
  • Participation on consulting projects with a team of 5 or more

Preferred Experience or Skills

  • Understand general software development methodology
  • Experience working with SharePoint On-Prem or SharePoint Online
  • Experience with Microsoft Teams
  • Ability to create workflows (Power Automate), PowerApps or InfoPath forms

Requirements & Qualifications

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Systems Engineering or related field of study.
  • Minimum 3.0 GPA
  • Manages time efficiently and multi-tasks effectively
  • Possesses strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Able to handle confidential and sensitive company information responsibly
  • Desire to be engaged in a fast-paced organization
  • Experience with Microsoft Office
  • Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong work ethic and attention to detail

Benefits

  • Practical experience with varied business activities
  • Shadowing, mentoring, and training opportunities with experienced and accomplished business professionals
  • Opportunity to attend business meetings and networking events
  • Flexible schedule for students
  • Compensation available
  • Gain hands-on experience in an IT position for a world-class consulting firm

COMPANY PROFILE:

Founded in 1993, JourneyTEAM has grown from a small software development shop into an award-winning, business technology consulting firm. They are a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner and serve technology needs of large public and private organizations, including many of the world’s best-known brands. JourneyTEAM’s expert level consultants dive deep into the dynamics of an organization and solve complex issues that improve a company’s sales, marketing, productivity, collaboration, accounting, and security. The company provides consulting and implementation services specifically for Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Office 365 solutions, including Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CRM), Microsoft Dynamics Business Central, Dynamics GP, Microsoft’s Enterprise Mobility and Security Suite, SharePoint, Okta and more.

At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

We are looking for exceptional individuals interested in working at intersection of big data analytics and EDA in an internship position. Primary responsibilities include researching and developing data platform components and applications in EDA and adjacent markets. You will work with a worldwide cross-functional team and collaborate to find innovative and practical solutions.

Qualifications

·       Pursuing MS or PhD in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering

·       Experience working with big data, such as Hadoop ecosystem, Spark, Kafka, etc.

·       In-depth understanding of data structures, algorithms, and distributed systems

·       Development experience in Python, Java, or Scala

·       Understanding of database fundamentals and familiarity with SQL

·       Familiar with working in Linux-based environments

·       Excellent verbal and written communication skills

We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.

Position: UI Front-End Engineer Intern

Location: San Jose, CA (Remote)

For over 10 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global data centers to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,500 companies and 100 Million threats detected a day.

We work in a fast paced, dynamic and make it happen culture. Our people are some of the brightest and passionate in the industry that thrive on being the first to solve problems.  We are always looking to hire highly passionate, collaborative and humble people that want to make a difference.  

What you’ll do:

  • Work closely with the agile development team, testing software in all phases of the development cycle from early drafts to final online products.
  • Review product requirements and software documentation for testability and to ensure the consistency with software features and performance.
  • Integrate the automated API & UI test cases into CI/CD system.
  • Create test summary reports and other related documentation.

What you should have:

  • Must be pursuing a Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field
  • At least 2 years of Java/API, REST API software development or testing experience
  • Experience with Redux, ES6, or Backbone.js is desired
  • Proficient experience in Linux/Unix working environment.
  • Good knowledge and experience in one or more of these languages - Python, Java, JavaScript.
  • Extensive experience in testing web services (API, Webpage)
  • Experienced in testing & automating web applications. Load/performance testing is a strong plus.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.

What You Can Expect From Us:

  • An environment where you will be working on cutting edge technologies and architectures
  • A fun, passionate and collaborative workplace
  • Competitive salary and benefits, including equity
  • The pace and excitement of working for a Silicon Valley Unicorn

Why Zscaler?

People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.

Learn more at zscaler.com or follow us on Twitter @zscaler. We are seeking a knowledgeable Intern - Project Manager (Remote) to serve as a resource and partner for the Delivery Managers in our Agile Portfolio Office. This role will have a focus on portfolio level reporting and analysis working collaboratively with all our software engineering teams and various functional departments to achieve organizational objectives. This role will be focused on applying and optimizing our use of metrics to understand our Agile processes and maximize our effective delivery of software. 

 

This role can be performed remotely anywhere in the US.

 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Run and evaluate daily and weekly portfolio management reports
  • Document and refine reporting procedures
  • Develop report templates and automate report functionality
  • Present and interpret report results to drive improvements using Agile, Lean, and Six Sigma principles
  • Contribute to ongoing project to replace Excel reports with EazyBI for Jira

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in a technical field (Math, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • Basic skills with Excel, Word, Power Point
  • Process Management knowledge or interest
  • Project Management knowledge or interest
  • Process documentation; Standard Operation Procedure (SOP) writing knowledge or interest
  • Agile or Scrum methodology knowledge or interest

PREFERRED SKILLS & EXPERTISE

  • Advanced skills with SQL, Excel pivot tables and/or VBA 

WHAT WE OFFER 

  • Competitive Compensation

JOB SUMMARY 

 The main functions of the Economic Research Analyst Intern is to assist staff economists and policy advisors with their research and contribute to the strategic priorities of the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta and the Research Division. 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  1. Researches state policy rules and writes code to interpret those rules for a national database of tax and transfer programs.
