  • Major in economics, statistics, computer science or related field preferred.
  • Intermediate to advanced R, Excel, Powerpoint, Word skills essential.

position: Business Builder Intern - Card Linked Offers (Fall / Winter)
description:
Business Builder Intern - Card Linked Offers

As a business builder intern you will explore, develop and build businesses around new project opportunities for numo's card linked offers portfolio.  In this role you match unsolved business problems with emerging technologies.  Our ideal intern is a creative thinker and explorer that dives into details to uncover and pursue high growth opportunities.  Ultimately the intern builds the business side by side with the existing team and the CLO leadership to drive growth.  Our interns develop expertise in current industry gaps and sees gaps that no one is talking about to shape the opportunities that we will pursue.

Responsibilities

  • Drive development of the product, technology and/or operations in our nascent businesses
  • Gather industry information and assess market landscapes to shape our strategy
  • Conduct due diligence, operational metrics assessments, competitive analysis, product and technology evaluation, reference calls, and financial and exit modeling
  • Articulate thoughtful analyses into recommendations/business cases for development

Requirements

  • Progress toward a Bachelor's degree required; Business, finance, computer science or related field preferred  
  • Progress toward an MBA or other post graduate work preferred
  • Prior experience in VCs, startups, or consulting preferred
  • Prior experience in banking (retail, commercial banking, wealth and asset management, investment banking), specifically in payments or card linked offers

Skills/Experiences

While there is no "ideal" profile for this role, we are looking for candidates with some combination of the following experiences / skills:

  • Ability to uncover needs / problems (both consumer and business) through consumer research, structured interactions, and discovery
  • Ability to synthesize findings into cohesive, succinct messages to crisply, concisely convey complex information to high level audiences in written and verbal forms
  • Ability to "pitch" ideas and convince the organization to continue pursuing ideas
  • Ability to work independently and drive multiple dynamic projects
  • Grittiness in uncovering information and insights (phone calls, visits, connections, etc.) – using more than just Google
  • Understanding of technologies required to stand up a digital product
  • Self-starter with technology background
  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves and tackle something hands-on
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and a focus on execution
  • Experience standing up business lines / new offerings / innovative products
  • Experience developing / launching digital products
  • Experience working on a cross-functional product / design / technical team
  • Experience in technology assessment and industry commercialization

Who we are

numo creates software for the financial services industry.  We are a team of technologists, designers, business thinkers, and academics that create software and data products.  The model is unique. We build innovative consumer and enterprise software in house by applying cutting edge approaches, technology, and data analysis techniques to financial service opportunities.  Through academic and corporate partnerships, we source our project ideas by understanding immediate business challenges at PNC. We work directly with staff inside the bank to build products that will create immediate value for PNC we architect products so that they can be spun off into standalone companies.

Johnson Controls invites you to apply for an internship located in New Freedom, Pennsylvania. This internship is designed to provide you with a positive work/training experience and challenging objectives. Specific identified internship responsibilities are outlined below.

How you will do it

The Engineering intern’s primary focus will be on a large-scale data collection, processing and analysis project that will benefit many chiller product lines.  This project will require close coordination with various global chiller factories and engineering colleagues.  The conclusion of this project will be a well-defined tool or process for easy access and analysis of required data sets.

The Engineering intern will also be exposed to chiller product engineering activities including general product sustaining projects, cost reduction projects and manufacturing improvement projects.  These tasks will give exposure to product testing, data analysis, test report creation.

This will be a full-time summer 2021 internship opportunity.  Starting date would be desired to be first availability at conclusion of spring semester.

Quality Assurance Intern, $13/hour, remote optional


Diverse Computing -- a local law enforcement technology company known for being an industry leader in customer support and intuitive software design -- is looking for a Quality Assurance Intern to join our team. This internship could either start immediately or during the upcoming summer 2021 semester. This internship will be remote only, but there is the option to work at our corporate headquarters located in Tallahassee, FL, once Covid restrictions are lifted. This internship would carry over for a minimum of 2-3 consecutive semesters with the opportunity for full-time employment after graduation. Ideally, we're looking for a student who would be graduating fall 2021, spring 2022, or later.

Working at Diverse Computing is different from most places; you’re not going to feel the “grind” here like you would at a typical internship. That’s because we offer a dynamic work atmosphere where we welcome creative ideas, collaboration, and flexibility. You’ll be working on projects that have a measurable impact on public safety, all while gaining real-world experience.

The ideal candidate for this internship would be someone who loves to analyze software test plans, is highly organized, and has meticulous attention to detail. In this internship, you’ll help the project management and development teams test actual software and design real testing strategies. If you’re a self-motivated worker who is ready for a challenge, this could be the ideal internship for you! Please read on for more info.


As the QA Intern you will:

  • Develop, maintain, and implement integration testing strategies and scenarios
  • Assist in preparation for User Acceptance Training (UAT)
  • Communicate with business/systems analysts and developers to understand system requirements
  • Identify and report issues in a bug tracking system
  • Provide status reports and regular updates to the project manager
  • Maintain testing documentation for your projects
  • Participate in production support and troubleshooting when required

Requirements

This job might be for you if:

  • You have a fundamental understanding of IT, database, and software development concepts
  • You frequently use MS Office and/or Google Docs applications
  • You have phenomenal attention-to-detail
  • Written and oral communication is your strong suit
  • “Organized” is your middle name (perhaps literally)
  • A strong work ethic is part of who you are
  • You have a naturally analytical mind
  • You go over all of your work with a fine-tooth comb, every time, because you always want to do your best
  • You have a strong imagination and can effectively envision real business situations
  • You’re currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Information Technology (IT); Management Information Systems (MIS); Information, Communication, and Technology (ICT); Computer Science (CS); Editing, Writing, and Media (EWM); or other related technology or communication fields
  • You are graduating this Fall 2021 or later

All applicants must:

  • Have availability to work for a minimum of 15-20 hours/week
  • Be able to commit to a multi-semester internship
  • Pass a background check and drug screening

Benefits

We ask a lot, but we give a lot in return:

  • We offer schedules that are flexible with your classes and school activities.
  • If you’re the right candidate, we’ll consider you for a full-time position at the conclusion of your internship.
  • We have an award-winning office culture that’s welcoming, fun, and collaborative. We’ve been recognized as one of the country’s best places to work and one of the fastest-growing companies in the U.S.
  • You’ll get to work on projects that help improve public safety.
  • You’ll have opportunities to get involved with local young professional groups, charity work, and further professional training if desired.
  • Working for a small but growing company means lots of chances for horizontal and vertical movement within our ranks.


Ready to apply?

  • Find more information about working at Diverse Computing on our website, diversecomputing.com/careers.
  • Click on the application link below and apply. Be sure to provide a cover letter that includes contact info for three professional references.

What you could be doing on a daily basis;


As an Intern on the Scrum team, you will be embedded on a team that works across applications on design, development, testing, documentation, implementation & maintenance. You’ll be partnered with a senior Scrum Master and work alongside them to learn the skills first-hand.


You’ll be assisting team members to track & communicate team velocity & sprint/release progress, removing team impediments, as well as engaging in the practice of core agile principles: collaboration, prioritization, accountability, continuous improvement.


This will give you the opportunity to network across VF teams, work on your presentation skills, organization skills, utilize mediation & negotiation skills, and learn strong teamwork & interpersonal techniques.


The types of strengths we would like you to bring;


+ Working toward a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business, Management or Information Systems (Junior or Senior status preferred)

+ Interested in retail, technology & business for a diverse global company


+ Have a can-do attitude, motivated & work well with others

+ Able to clearly communicate both written & verbally

+ *Knowledge of JIRA or other Enterprise Agile tool is a plus

+ *Familiarity with Agile Development Methodology is a plus


Our Intern Program runs from June 7th through August 13th, 2021! During your time with us, you will have opportunities for training that will enhance you as a professional, give back in our communities and of course have FUN with your colleagues! All VF internships are paid and offer you work that matters with some of the best teams around!

description:

This is an exciting time to be joining PSEG. Our commitments, which include safety, integrity, customer focus, and diversity & inclusion, are the fabric of our culture and help drive the success of our business. We are fortunate to have an outstanding workforce of diverse and highly skilled talent who move us forward in our operational excellence journey.  PSEG has more than 12,000 employees who are dedicated to the communities we serve and embody our vision: People providing Safe, Reliable, Economic and Greener Energy. Looking to put your learning to the test and apply your education through an exciting summer opportunity with a Fortune 300 energy company? Come join a winning team with PSEG's internship program. Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is a publicly traded (NYSE:PEG) diversified energy company headquartered in New Jersey, and one of the ten largest electric companies in the U.S.

PSEG is seeking 2 summer interns to work in the Electric Asset Strategy team in the following areas:

• Transformer Engineering Group: • Engineering and implementation support to assist the Reliability Centered Maintenance group with transformer analytics and design aspects for IBM Asset Health Performance Platform • Perform work with transformer data, systems, contractors, and the RCM group to achieve more efficient methods of equipment ranking compared to existing methods • Model testing with various data inputs to modify and enhance model accuracy • Summer project includes inputting additional in service system equipment data into CMMS/SAP to enhance equipment database • Identify TRV capacitors and arrestors in our system based off of the one-line drawings of various substations and properly enter them into CMMS • Transmission Engineering: • Provide support of engineering for hydraulic and mechanical design aspects of underground transmission system • Development of specifications and standards for installation of "pipe-type" and extruded cable systems (i.e. pressurization plants, valve cabinets, thermal dynamic and fluid expulsion calculations, piping design) • Validation and testing of the Company's Pipe-Type Cable leak detection thermal models • Examine field data collected from monitoring systems, examining accuracy of the model and its various inputs • Modify existing model to enhance data collection and model accuracy
Required Education/Skills: The successful candidate (s) must be actively pursuing a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or similar related major. PSEG recognizes institutions of higher education, which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent.

Preferred Skills:

3.0 GPA; .

All PSEG internship roles are paid at an hourly rate, however there are no benefits associated with these positions. Candidates are expected to work 40 hours per week over the summer period for the full 10-12 week period. We are targeting: Currently enrolled students, staying in the NJ/NY/PA metro area for the duration of the internship and able to commute to the assigned work location. Housing, transportation, immigration Support will not be provided in association with these positions. Description

 

About the role:

As a Software Engineer Intern at TQL, you willhelp develop and maintain our current business applications and web services. You will use your web development skills to develop applications and services to support many internal applications. This position will enrich your web development skills and give you the opportunity to work with the latest technologies.

  • Access to the latest emerging technologies through Microsoft partnerships and Pluralsight subscriptions
  • Work hard, play hard – Voted a 2019 and 2020 Computerworld Best Places to Work in IT

  • Build RESTful web services to support our ever-growing service layer and to support new and refactored websites
  • Support and maintain existing web applications, troubleshooting issues as they arise and recommending improvements
  • Test and document new applications and changes
  • Work with project owners and analysts during system design to determine needs and to plan solutions
  • Communicate with team members, project owners and other IT teams regarding project progress and issue resolutions

 

What you need:

  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
  • Strong GPA
  • Core proficiency in one or more of the following: C#, C++, JavaScript, Java, HTML, CSS
  • Ability to research, recommend and apply new solutions as they emerge
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Can effectively handle multiple projects in a fast-paced, changing environment
  • Self-starter with a strong work ethic, attention to detail and superior problem-solving skills
  • Ability to thrive in a collaborative, cross-functional environment

Job Description:

Leidos is seeking candidates for a Systems Integration Engineer for a mission critical program in Chantilly, VA. The Integration Engineer will apply technical knowledge and project management skills to integrate external programs with our services. The ideal candidate will enjoy learning new concepts and technologies, having a desire to take ownership for successfully integrating clients with our system.




Primary Responsibilities



+ Leverage your technical experience to understand a client’s functional goals and translate them into technical requirements. Expand your industry knowledge to include new concepts and technologies as our program evolves, and our client list expands


+ Leverage your project management skills to manage a client’s integration with us. Independently help clients identify the next steps to move their integration project forward. Reinforce SDLC best practices through a methodical approach to transition clients from development, test, into operational environments


+ Use your communication skills to explain to clients how their systems can integrate with ours. Advise clients on recommended integration methods


+ Using your attention to detail, follow standard procedures to configure our system to integrate with the client. Recognize when the client requires customizations to a standard solution

+ Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree program in Engineering, Computer Science or a related major.


+ System integration or software development, and experience integrating services from different systems

+ Troubleshooting software issues, investigating root causes, and recommending fixes


+ Using a command line interface to navigate Linux or Windows operating systems


+ Coordinating activities of an external group


+ Demonstrated ability to learn and apply new concepts and technologies


+ Strong problem-solving and excellent written and oral communication skills


+ US Citizenship required per contract


+ Eligibility to obtain a TS/SCI clearance. No clearance is required to start; chosen candidates will be screened for eligibility.





Preferred Qualifications



+ System administration skills in support of RHEL, SE Linux, Solaris, Windows, Apache, IIS


+ Knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC), Scrum, and Agile processes


+ Knowledge of Oracle Identity and Access Management (IdAM) suite, including OAM, OID, OVD, OHS


+ Knowledge of authentication standards using OAuth, SAML, and PKI

HBS installs, integrates and maintains the systems that keep facilities safe, secure, comfortable, productive and energy efficient. You will work with critical building management, HVAC and security systems  with the opportunity to work on a range of commercial and government buildings, health care facilities, airports and correction facilities. In this role you will provide support to our ICT/ Cyber specialists to design, engineer, configure, implement and commission Information

 

 

Have the opportunity to assist on high-level designs using the best of breed technology to support Honeywell systems, including servers, storage, virtualization, and networking. Exposure to/knowledge of virtualization technologies like VMware ESX and/or Microsoft Hyper-V to implement designs will be very beneficial.

 

Assist with technical OT/IT knowledge required to support integration requirements to support customer sites with a heavy focus on securely integrating systems via open building protocols into Honeywell software platforms.  Understanding of emerging IOT technologies as applies to building control systems (i.e. access controls, temperature sensing, smart lighting, facial recognition, navigation controls, RFID sensor controls, etc.)

 

Provide consulting based on current technical knowledge as to the design, procurement, configuration and implementation of the underlying architecture and technologies for new Honeywell based systems.

YOU MUST HAVE

 

Be in your penultimate (rising senior) year of Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Similar IT/ Systems degree. A major in Security would be highly desirable.

 

Be a citizen or have permanent residence for the United States at the time of your application.

 

Ability to travel locally as required to provide support at customer sites

 

WE VALUE

Self-motivated, ability to meet deadlines and work well under pressure, determine own work priorities, work independently and as part of a team.

Excellent analytical and problem solving skills

Ability to develop innovative and creative solutions in a complex multiple systems environment.

Some basic network fault finding capability

A good understanding of virtualization, networking, servers, storage, and enterprise applications

Excellent effective communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills, along with proven ability to interact professionally with clients

COMPANY DESCRIPTION


SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. Thats why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.


SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because its the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve peoples lives.


Contract Duration: 6 months


Contract Hours: 40 hours per week


Anticipated Start Date: April 2021


Office Location: Remote / Virtual


Purpose & Objective of Position


The Cybersecurity Compliance Automation Engineer (CCAE) will work on a mission-critical project that spans numerous international teams. In this role, the CCAE will find ways to successfully deliver while working with teams that have common goals, but different priorities, objectives, and points of view.


The CCAE will develop, test and deploy Compliance templates for all types of cloud infrastructure. Additionally, the CCAE will centralize Compliance log collection, reporting, and incident management.


The CCAE will gain experience writing scripts for a wide variety of systems and applications (load balancers, firewalls, storage devices, directory services, etc.). The CCAE will also develop integration points for application APIs, enrich scan data, and develop Executive and Operations dashboards.


The CCAE is a key member of the Continuous Compliance program. Continuous Compliance is a critical security component of SAP’s OneStrike initiative. The CCAE’s purpose and objective is to take written internal and external security compliance requirements and transform them into “Compliance as Code.”


Expectations & Tasks


The CCAE will write Compliance as Code templates for SAP cloud infrastructure. The CCAE will also contribute to the development of compliance reporting, system integration and incident management processes.


Skills / Competencies


The CCAE should have a general proficiency in software development, automation and cybersecurity. The CCAE will need to be a quick learner, and adaptable to changing technologies and security requirements.


Educational Requirements


+ Bachelor's in Computer Science or related field

+ Cybersecurity certifications such as CISSP and Security are beneficial, but not required


Qualifications


+ Software development experience

+ Automation experience

+ Experience with working in one of the Cybersecurity domains


WHAT YOU GET FROM US


Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If youre searching for a company thats dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment apply now _._

Description

We are looking for a full time Software Engineer Intern to develop embedded or application software for products at our Chandler, Arizona office. They will test software, perform software releases, quality assurance activities and performance maintenance activities on real Garmin products.




Essential functions and responsibilities in this role include:

  • New product design and development
  • Troubleshooting basic issue reports & implementing software solutions
  • Communicating status of work & providing visibility to supervisor
  • Learning how to use & apply various engineering tools as needed for the role
  • Planning technical work to meet team objectives
  • Applying design standards and procedures to implement basic designs
  • Thoroughly documenting work in an organized manner
  • Working collaboratively in a team environment to achieve individual & team goals

Qualifications

Qualified candidates for this role will have completed coursework in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a field relevant to perform the essential functions of this job description with a minimum cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.0.



Other requirements include:

  • Demonstrated strong and effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
  • Must demonstrate relevant experience and/or training in a low, mid, or high-level language such as C, C++, C#, Java, or other selected languages
  • Must possess relevant experience and/or training in data structures or object-oriented design methodology relevant to Garmin’s business need
  • A cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.0 and previous experience working in a team environment is highly preferred!

Garmin Intern Perks:

  • Social activities and service opportunities planned for interns
  • Paid time off
  • Paid holidays
  • Test cutting-edge Garmin products before they are released
  • No formal dress code
  • Assigned mentor to answer your questions and help you grow in your technical skillsets
  • Associate discount on consumer products
  • Paid, coordinated housing or stipend option for interns whose permanent address is located more than 50 miles from Garmin HQ
  • Housing stipend option for those at field locations (non-Olathe) whose permanent address is located more than 50 miles from the field location

position: Sales and Operations Analyst Internship - Paid and Remote
description:
Company Description

SquareTrade is the fastest growing company of its kind. We’re revolutionizing a $30b industry with service innovation and attention to customer satisfaction. We partner with some of the largest, most sophisticated retailers and carriers in the world (Amazon, Walmart, The Home Depot to name a few), consistently win industry awards, have received tens of thousands of 5-star reviews… and we’re just getting started. A member of the Allstate family, SquareTrade has headquarters in San Francisco and London. We are currently expanding in Europe and Asia Pacific, including Japan and Australia.

Job Description

We are looking for a curious, passionate, and detail-oriented individual to join us this summer as part of our Sales Operations Analytics Group.

In this role, you will write and refactor scripts to support channel partner reporting output and partner data ingestion, along with developing data structures and queries to support the new and existing businesses. You will collaborate and work closely with Sr Analysts to accomplish tasks and achieve project goals. Additionally, you will receive technical mentorship and feedback through code reviews and one on one meetings, experience in a project management organization, and be exposed to the benefits and challenges of working in a remote environment.

What's Great About This Role?

●  You will be working for a fast-paced and dynamic company with a “start-up feel”

●  This will be a project oriented program where you’ll be learning and contributing on day one

●  The program will offer opportunities to showcase and highlight your hard and soft skills along with providing you with business context and exposure to upper management

●  You will have regularly scheduled checkpoints with your mentors and team members throughout the program to help guide you in the direction that best suits your abilities and interests

 

 Responsibilities:

●  Work closely with your team to deliver outputs to efficiently support the business.

●  Attend regularly scheduled planning meetings, contribute ideas, and provide status updates.

●  Regularly check-in with your mentors to discuss personal goals and receive feedback.

●  Have fun and learn in a scrappy environment!

 

What Does Our Ideal Candidate Look Like?

●  Team player with documented experience on team-based side projects or classwork

●  Active listener who is open to direct feedback and learns from and fixes mistakes quickly

●  Strong fundamentals in Computer Science along with programming experience and familiarity with Python and experience with relational database systems (Postgres preferred)

●  Ability to learn new, large scale systems and form an understanding of them quickly through independent research

●  A thought leader;  vocal and willing to regularly contribute ideas to team discussions

Qualifications

●  Currently pursuing college degree related to Computer Science, Software Engineering, Database Development or related fields

●  Ability to work and deliver in a fast-paced, team environment

●  Technology, retail and e-commerce enthusiast



Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

The Team:  http://www.squaretrade.com/leadership  
 
SquareTrade is an Equal Opportunity Employer and complies with the San Francisco FCO

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We’re committed to growing high-performance teams where people can bring their whole-selves to work, and creating a greater force for good within our company, industry, and cities. We strive to hire and cultivate diverse teams, and respectfully challenge everyone to do their best regardless of background and experience. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Snap-on Incorporated is seeking a Desktop Engineering Intern in its I/T Department, in the Kenosha, Wisconsin General Office. This position is an in-person, long-term internship and will be expected to be onsite in the Kenosha General Office. This person will be a working member of the Desktop Engineering team. This resource will assist in the troubleshooting, development and deployment of Windows Images; assist with troubleshooting both hardware and software issues and build, test and troubleshoot other scripting and imaging tasks as needed.

 

If we are interested in moving forward with your candidacy, you may receive an email invitation from Spark Hire, or from a Snap-on representative, for a one-way video interview.



Requirements

  • Basic understanding of PowerShell/batch or other scripting languages is a plus
  • Ability to troubleshoot a variety of software/hardware

Skills/Experience required: This person must have

  • The ability to understand software and hardware configurations
  • The ability to troubleshoot scripts, install failures and hardware issues
  • Excellent communication, organization and documentation skills
  • The ability to troubleshoot moderate PC problems
  • Basic understanding of hardware, drivers and Operating Systems.

Hours for this position are Monday thru Friday – 8:00AM-4:30PM (Flexible with class schedule)

 

Snap-on is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.

position: Cloud Infrastructure Co-op - Office of the CTO
description:
Job summary


The Red Hat CTOResearch Group (https://research.redhat.com/) is looking for a Cloud Infrastructure associate to join us in Boston, MA. In this role, you will be a part of a team that supports software and systems that are a part of the research in theMassachusetts Open Cloud (https://massopen.cloud/) environment. The project will develop and integrate collection, analysis, and reporting systems for research users in Red Hat OpenShift environments. You will become familiar with technologies like Red Hat OpenShift, Ceph, Prometheus, Grafana, bare-metal server provisioning, Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), and user onboarding tools. You will work with software developers, operations engineers, and IT leaders for several New England academic environments to bring production-grade resource management tools to users, operators, and researchers as part of an open source development, test, and deployment project.


Primary job responsibilities


+ Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment

+ Build a scalable distributed system for capturing Open Cloud infrastructure utilization measurements, which can be indexed, and queried

+ Collaborate with Red Hatters to conceive, design, and develop services that will help academics and researchers use Red Hat products

+ Develop your ability to discover, debug, and resolve Linux system administration issues with minimal supervision

+ Become adept at working in an agile environment


Required skills


+ Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field

+ Ability to work full time from July-December 2021 (6 month co-op position)

+ Knowledge of any Linux-based operating system

+ Coding experience with C or Python

+ Knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals such as object-oriented design, algorithm design, data structures, problem solving, and complexity analysis

+ Good written and verbal communication skills


The following are considered a plus:


+ Previous code contributions to open source projects or code samples

+ Layer 2 and Layer 3 networking knowledge

+ Familiarity with Kubernetes, OpenShift, and OpenStack

+ Experience in JavaScript and scripting languages


About Red Hat


Red Hat (https://www.redhat.com/) is the world’s leading provider of enterpriseopen source (https://www.redhat.com/en/about/open-source) software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux, hybrid cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications, develop cloud-native applications, standardize on our industry-leading operating system, and automate, secure, and manage complex environments. Award-winning support, training, and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers, system integrators, application vendors, customers, and open source communities, Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future.


Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.


Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

Company Description

The Bosch Research and Technology Center North America with offices in Sunnyvale, California, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and Cambridge, Massachusetts is part of the global Bosch Group (www.bosch.com), a company with over 70 billion euro revenue, 400,000 people worldwide, a very diverse product portfolio, and a history of over 125 years. The Research and Technology Center North America (RTC-NA) is committed to providing technologies and system solutions for various Bosch business fields primarily in the areas of Human Machine Interaction (HMI), Robotics, Energy Technologies, Internet Technologies, Circuit Design, Semiconductors and Wireless, and MEMS Advanced Design.

The Bosch Research and Technology Center (RTC) in Pittsburgh, PA is focused on the research and development of cutting-edge technologies that will shape the future of the company’s products. Specifically, our lab works in the fast-paced field of the Internet of Things and Services (IoTS) – an exciting combination of business, technology and user experience that is driven by the rapid development of connectivity, mobile computing, social networks, and multimodal sensor fusion.

Job Description

Our team works at the intersection of AI and IoT for developing exciting Cyber-Physical Systems. We are looking for an enthusiastic research intern to develop a novel localization solution by using Wi-Fi Channel State Information (CSI) and RSSI. The focus is to use the localization solution for addressing novel use cases in the automotive applications.

Tasks & Responsibilities

  • Develop a novel localization solution using signal processing and AI-based techniques by leveraging Wi-Fi CSI and RSSI for automotive applications.
  • Evaluate the performance of the solution.
  • Summarize the findings and publish a high-quality research paper.
  • Show a proof-of-concept demo.
Qualifications

  • Strong background in Wi-Fi CSI signal processing and AI based techniques.
  • Strong background in machine learning, AI-based techniques, and time-series analysis.
  • Strong research and problem solving skills.
  • Publication records in leading venues (SenSys/IPSN) are a plus.
  • Prior experience of developing a Wi-Fi-based localization algorithm is a plus.


Additional Information

  • Major(s): Computer Science or relevant area
  • Degree level: PhD or MS – Current student or recent graduate
  • Location: Pittsburgh, PA
  • Duration: 14 weeks
  • Start Date: May 2021

By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce - EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled.

  • FIRST Robotics (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology)
  • AWIM (A World in Motion)

Worldwide Television Distribution is based in Culver City and responsible for licensing features, series and formats to linear and digital platforms worldwide.  The LA based Sales Analytics and Insights team collaborates with both home office and territory sales teams.

The Role
The Vice President will be responsible for building the analytics backbone for the TV sales distribution business, develop pricing models and advanced analytics techniques to support TV’s most strategic deals; help define deal strategies and collaborate with the teams around the world to obtain support and adoption of techniques and tools. The candidate must have

  • Exceptional analytical and financial modelling skills; background in business analytics and experience with data visualization tools.
  • Significant experience in bringing together business and analytics to deliver impact.
  • Ability to structure complex analytical problems and bring clarity in ambiguous situations.
  • Experience deriving and presenting insights to executives; be able to tell data stories through visuals.
  • Big picture thinker but also hands on and willing to dive into details. 

The Vice President will have three direct reports and an intern and will collaborate with regional analytics team members. The position will have an opportunity for international travel.

The Responsibilities
DEAL ANALYTICS & STRATEGIC INTIATIVES (40%):

  • DEAL ANALYTICS: Work with Sr Sales leaders to support major local/pan-regional deal negotiations. Provide Sales with actionable insights through deal analysis, title performance analysis and deal ROI analysis. Collaborate with various teams to provide recommendations on pricing, title curation and deal structures. Work cross functionally with sales strategy, sales planning, finance and research; build strong working relationships with Sr. executives in these teams.
  • STRATEGIC INTIATIVES: Lead efforts to provide analytics and tools/capabilities for SPE’s strategic initiatives. Work directly with the senior leaders driving these initiatives, pro-actively asses needs, succinctly communicate and get alignment and work cross-functionally to deliver outputs.

INNOVATION & TOOLS (40%)

Be a data and analytics evangelist in the organization. Promote and enable data-driven decision-making across the organization by creating capabilities that solve business problems.

  • DATA: Work with IT, Finance, Research and other internal teams as required to obtain needed data sources. Guide the team to clean and structure data such that it can be used rapidly for custom analysis and support tools. Guide with business logic along to shape technical path.
  • SELF-SERVICE TOOLS: Translate the analytics solutions for high impact business problems into self-service tools. Create business logic that the team then implements using data and analytics technologies (Tableau, Alteryx/Predictive Modeling Techniques, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence)
  • PRICING – Enhance methods/models used for pricing and deal valuations.
    • Bring thought leadership on emerging businesses of AVOD and SVOD - including strategies and tools for pricing and title curation. 
    • Bring analytical rigor on pricing and analytical frameworks. Develop techniques to evaluate SVOD title categorization and determine the percent and value of unsold product.
  • SPECIAL DATA PROJECTS – Work with other teams on strategic data projects.

BEST PRACTICES & THOUGHT LEADERSHIP (20%)

Push the organization towards new and improved ways to use data to draw insights and improve negotiations.

  • Lead discussions and annual conferences with Sales and Planners regarding new tools, analysis techniques that can help improve negotiations.
  • In collaboration with the regional teams capture best practices. 
  • Mentor Sales and Planning by packaging case studies and conducting regular sessions to share ideas/ approaches.

Qualifications

EDUCATION   

  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Statistics, Physics, Math, Engineering, Economics, Management, Finance, Data Science or Computer Science.
  • 7-10 years’ work experience.
  • Prior experience in management consulting or similar strategic roles (ideally with experience of running analytics projects or modules) and/or experience in an analytics role at an entertainment company.

SKILLS

  • Experience and skills to manage and nurture a team.
  • Ability to interact confidently with senior executives, be receptive but also have a point of view.
  • Ability to create a culture of collaboration with regional analytics teams by providing mentorship as needed.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills. Ability to tell a clear, concise, and actionable story with data.
  • Attention to the layout and design of how analytical information is presented.
  • Strong intellectual curiosity and love of problem-solving with a passion for getting involved to drive action for direct impact on business outcomes.
  • Self-motivated and able to operate independently with limited guidance and direction.
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, taking the initiative, managing multiple projects, and working under tight timeframes.
  • Has the courage to challenge ideas. 

*Sony Pictures Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected characteristics.

                  

* Sony Pictures - CA - Culver City Area & Studios

position: SHC - Northeastern Coop Program, Cambridge Inpatient
description:
Description
true
SHC - Northeastern Coop Program, Cambridge Inpatient 3154046

Summary


Working under the direct supervision of a licensed OTR, PT, COTA, PTA or SLP, provide routine direct patient care treatment programs, clerical duties, and light housekeeping activities to support the care of patients and the efficiency of the operation.  Collaborate with all members of the healthcare team to provide services to patients.


Key Responsibilities

  • Direct patient care treatment programs, such as range of motion and exercise programs, ADLs, ambulation, bed mobility, endurance training, and application of superficial modalities, fabrication of adaptive equipment, carryover of positioning techniques, and carryover of use of assistive devices are carried out in accordance with professional guidelines.
  • Patient objective and subjective responses to treatment is observed and accurately recorded.  Any changes are immediately reported to appropriate team member.
  • Clerical activities are performed, including recording services rendered to the patient, answering the phone, filing, and data entry to help the patient and facility run efficiently.
  • Cleanliness and organization of assigned areas is maintained and routine cleaning of equipment is performed per department guidelines.
  • Light housekeeping activities including changing linen, laundry, and other duties are completed to meet established objectives.
  • Documentation to support reimbursement is completed within organizational and regulatory guidelines.
  • Additional department, organization, or network activities are completed per established objectives.
  • PCC Organizational Values of Innovation, Collaboration, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence are upheld. 

Education/Degree


Required

  • High school diploma or equivalent required.  
  • Enrolled in the Northeastern PT Program. 

Preferred

  • Bachelor’s Degree or enrolled in Allied Health Program preferred.


Experience


Preferred

  •  Experience in hospital or outpatient setting is desirable. 

Skills (Specific learned activity gained through training (e.g. computer skills, keyboarding, presentation, CPR, ACLS, etc.)


Required

  • Effective verbal and written communication skills with English.
  • Basic skills in math and computer science.
  • Basic skills at establishing interpersonal relationships with patients, families, and staff.  
  • Computer proficiency required.  Microsoft office applications preferred with ability to learn new software.

 Preferred

  •  Highly developed communications and interpersonal skills, working with diverse population.
  • Work independently, be self-directed and contribute as a member of a team.
  • Anticipates challenges and develops and implements strategies for addressing them.
  • High level of service delivery. Demonstrate initiative with ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines and adapt to changing situations.
  • Attention to detail.

SRN is committed to diversity in the workplace which begins with respect and opportunity for all. SRN takes affirmative action to ensure that equal employment opportunity is provided to all persons regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, age, ancestry, veteran status, disability or any other basis that would be inconsistent with  any applicable ordinance or law. If you need a reasonable accommodation in coming to or participating in the interview process, please let us know.

SHC Spaulding Hospital Cambridge02138Internship/Co Ops

Software Guidance & Assistance, Inc., (SGA), is searching for a Market Research Manager for a Contract assignment with one of our premier Health Care Services clients in Conshohocken, PA.

Responsibilities:
  • Under the general direction of the Vice President of Market Research, and in partnership with cross-functional internal partners, this hands-on role works primarily on Voice of the Customer primary market research and related analysis.
  • This role requires significant coordination with cross-functional stakeholders.
  • The role also coordinates the work of preferred partner vendors to augment the team's capacity and identifies when an elevated level of expertise is warranted to support project objectives.
  • This role manages the CXI team's intern and may manage full time direct reports.
  • The Market Manager will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work while exemplifying company guiding principles.
  • In addition, the market research manager works closely with a number of key roles, stakeholders and functions across the organization to include but not limited to the following: business stakeholders (sales), financial analysts, customer operations, customer solutions, distribution operations and marketing.
  • S/he needs to be a creative thinker and propose innovative approaches to data collection and analyses.
  • The market research manager should know statistical methods and internal data sets to complete research projects.
  • In addition, the market research manager will understand and effectively employ a number of ways to visualize data in a way that is highly effective and persuasive.
  • Finally, the market research manager must be inherently analytical and have a high level of curiosity in getting to next level understanding of insights behind the data.
  • Excellent written and communications skills will also be a necessity for this role.
  • Reviews research briefs to understand objectives and consults on the design of surveys to ensure the data collected will facilitate the right analysis to generate findings that support the objectives
  • Independently programs and tests surveys, including the development of call to action and thank you messages, uploads respondent data, and deploys surveys
  • Integrates data from outside sources into Qualtrics and utilizes Qualtrics analytical tools to develop findings
  • Builds dashboards, provides training on optimal use, and continuously finds ways to improve data visualizations and incorporate new Qualtrics features within the dashboards
  • Calculates required respondents to achieve desired confidence level. Checks and ensures data validity. Identifies when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate.
  • Conducts analysis of Voice of the Customer data. Demonstrates strong proficiency with all Qualtrics analytical tools.
  • Identifies and integrates secondary data sources into the VOC analysis in order to improve the specificity and actionability of the analysis, findings and recommendations.
  • Demonstrates insightful quantitative understanding of a data set. Manipulates, analyzes and visualizes data to reveal trends in customer expectations and customer perceptions of company's performance. Identifies correlations in the data, including value drivers. Elevates key opportunities where improvement will have the greatest impact.
  • Actively participates with the CXI team in presentations and workshops where findings and recommendations to improve the CX are discussed and debated. Interprets VOC analysis and effectively communicates statistical concepts in way that makes it easy to understand and is not intimidating to non-technical audiences
  • With the hands-on support of the Vice President of Market Research, and preferred partners, prepares findings reports for senior executives. Using Microsoft PowerPoint, develops reports with clear, compelling, and easy to interpret data visualizations along with a narrative that translates the data into insights that convey a story or distinct point of view.
  • Becomes company's foremost expert use of Qualtrics, a best-in-class technology for research and analysis.
  • Continuously improves proficiency in utilizing all aspects of the tool, particularly those related to analysis. May support the training other associates.
  • Stays current on knowledge of new features/functionality and proactively brings ideas for how these can be applied to support the team's goals
  • Generates timely and concise communications appropriate for executive leadership to understand project status and pending issues.
  • Monitors response rates to surveys and proactively makes recommendations on when additional action is required to accelerate participation
  • Maintains a tracking program to report on budget allocated to donations in association with charitable giving for survey incentives
  • Collaborates with IT, preferred vendors, and others to problem-solve through data integration requirements, survey deployment decisions, and other operational considerations related to the VOC and customer experience programs
  • Manages the intern's workflow/priorities, reviews all work contributed by intern, and provides guidance and coaching to support the intern's professional development.
  • Proactively recommends ideas to improving efficiency and quality in the team's workflows, processes, and deliverables
  • Builds and maintains strong relationships across the organization through frequent and open communication/collaboration
  • Proactively seeks out and manages time to accommodate for continuous learning and development.

RequiredSkills:
  • Minimum of bachelors (advanced degree (Masters or PHD preferred) in data analytics, marketing research, statistics or computer science or related field;
  • Typically requires 3+ years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience.
  • Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
  • Knowledge of one or more market research platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth, SPSS, Medallion)
  • Proficiency in the use of statistical methodologies (regression, maxdiff, conjoint, Turf analysis, correlation, descriptive variables).
  • Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics and multivariate testing
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas.
  • Designs experiments, tests hypotheses and builds statistical models.
  • Employs a number of complex research methodologies (correlation matrices, turf analysis, conjoint analysis, max diff)
  • Highly skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics
  • Design, test and program surveys to support VOC programs and other insight projects
  • Designs qualitative and quantitative studies and aligns them to the proper use case.
  • Identifies audience size, sample size, confidence level and confidence interval necessary to meet statistical validation
  • Participates in team strategic planning sessions to support annual and long-range objectives.
  • Creates and manages research project plans and tracks key milestones
  • Works with commercial and functional stakeholders to define business problems and develop research methodologies to gather the necessary insights that inform recommendations
  • Possesses a high-level understanding of one or more business or functional areas.
  • Develops key business stakeholder relationships.
  • Leverages knowledge of internal and external data sources and leverages this knowledge to solve business problems
  • Data Requirements
  • Works with others to support data collection in support of research projects and integration of internal systems (e.g. Qualtrics with SFDC) to automate data transfer.
  • Works to combine customer experience data (e.g. satisfaction) and operational data (e.g. financial) to complete robust analyses and findings.
  • Solves business analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies.
  • Works in iterative processes with business stakeholders and validates findings.
  • Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
  • Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples.
  • Presents and depicts the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business and functional groups.
  • Highly effective visual depiction of data, trends, charts, graphs in compelling fashion.
  • Communicates and works with stakeholders and other SME's as required to meet project objectives.

SGA is a Certified Women's Business Enterprise (WBE) celebrating over thirty years of service to our national client base for both permanent placement and consulting opportunities. For consulting positions, we offer a variety of benefit options including but not limited to health & dental insurance, paid vacation, timely payment via direct deposit. SGA accepts transfers of H1 sponsorship for most contracting roles. We are unable to sponsor for Right-to-Hire, Fulltime, or Government roles. All parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply for all roles. Only those authorized to work for government entities will be considered for government roles. Please inquire about our referral program if you would like to submit a candidate for any of our open or future job opportunities. SGA is an EEO employer. We encourage Veterans to apply. To view all of our available job postings and/or to learn more about SGA please visit us online at www.sgainc.com.

COMPANY

AccuWeather, recognized and documented as the most accurate source of weather forecasts and warnings in the world, has saved tens of thousands of lives, prevented hundreds of thousands of injuries and tens of billions of dollars in property damage. With global headquarters in State College, PA and other offices around the world, AccuWeather serves more than 1.5 billion people daily to help them plan their lives and get more out of their day through innovative digital media properties, such as AccuWeather.com and mobile, as well as AccuWeather for Business (AFB), radio, television, newspapers, and the 24/7 AccuWeather Network.

Additionally, AccuWeather produces and distributes news, weather content, and video for more than 180,000 third-party websites. Among AccuWeather’s many innovative and award-winning features free to the public are MinuteCast® Minute by Minute™ forecasts with Superior Accuracy™. Further, AccuWeather serves more than half of Fortune 500 companies and thousands of businesses globally.

 

SUMMARY

The AccuWeather Product Intern will work across a variety of initiatives that impact the enterprise product portfolio. This role is an exciting opportunity that will enable the intern to gain experience from working across all of AccuWeather’s portfolio products, as well as supporting the product systems that are integral to bringing our product vision to life. The intern will work on a rotation that encompasses a variety of projects required to achieve our goals.

The intern is part of a team whose focus is to transform the existing suite of products used by more than 300 million consumers worldwide, as well as lead the next generation of innovative product development. This internship is an exciting opportunity to gain experience in product management and contribute to the development of impactful strategies that will include various skill development including feature definition, experience design and executing with teams. This internship is perfectly suited for someone with a passion for science, technology, and leveraging data to improve people’s lives.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

 Participate in projects and initiatives as prescribed by the product management leadership team; rotating through a variety of product disciplines throughout the course of the internship

  • Support the delivery of products, services, features and functions that contribute to the achievement of AccuWeather’s product goals
  • Undertake audience research to develop user profiles; who they are, the features they use and enhancements they want
  • Attend scrum team meetings comprising of engineers and product designers to learn how to execute against plans
  • Collect and analyze feedback from customers, stakeholders, and other teams to inform recommendations
  • Participate in the development of business cases to support elements of the product strategy; use your business acumen to lead research projects to understand the opportunity in detail
  • Ideate new opportunities for AccuWeather to develop products against consumer needs throughout the conversion funnel

 About you

  • Meticulously detailed. Mobile savvy. Strong business acumen
  • Creative thinker. Exceptional communicator. Collaborator by nature
  • Desire to learn. Curious mind

 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • You must be 18 years of age or older
  • Must be enrolled in a U.S. based college, university or trade school to qualify. Students who have completed at least two years of college are preferred
  • Marketing or Business majors preferred. Computer science or engineering most welcome to apply
  • Working knowledge of digitally distributed products and technology
  • Ability to interact and communicate with peers
  • Attention to detail

 

AccuWeather is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity to all applicants and existing employees and we evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity/expression), sexual orientation, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, marital status, political affiliation, religion, citizenship status, genetic information, veteran status, or any other basis protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. View the EEO is the Law poster here and its supplement here. The pay transparency policy is available here.

AccuWeather is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to

human.resources@accuweather.com

and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Are you a problem solver, explorer, and knowledge seeker – always asking, “What if?”

 

If so, you may be the new team member we’re looking for. Because at SAS, your curiosity matters – whether you’re developing algorithms, creating customer experiences or answering critical questions. Curiosity is our code, and the opportunities here are endless.

 

What we do 

We’re the leader in analytics. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence. Our curiosity fuels innovation, pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo and changing the way we live.

 

Opportunity

We’re not about coffee runs and boring busywork. Our SAS Summer internship program is focused on development, culture and community. We’ll help you grow professionally, thrive in an award-winning work environment and make memorable connections with your co-workers and fellow interns. From contributing analytical code to improving insights for our Fortune 100 customers, the potential to make a real impact is exciting. We’re proud to share that the SAS Intern Program was named one the 100 best internship programs in the United States for 2020! WayUp’s panel of industry expert judges and public votes, selected us to join the list of top intern programs.  Click here to view the list.

 

The Austin team is responsible for providing top notch support to our customers.  That means you will be interacting via email, phone or technical chat on a daily basis, working with some of the brightest people in the industry.

 

 

We need you to:

  • Be enrolled in a degree seeking program and not graduating prior to Summer 2022.
  • Have strong communication skills – both written and verbal.
  • Be a leader. You’re the one sitting in the front row of the class.
  • Embrace technology. You geek out over the latest and greatest!

What we’re looking for

  • You’re curious, passionate, authentic and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do.
  • You’re a college student enrolled in an accredited program.
  • You’ve got practical experience inside or outside of school or work. Do you enjoy fixing problems, think engineer, how about cars – ever had to fix your car?  We’d love to hear about it!
  • Information Technology, Electrical or mechanical engineering, Decisions Science, Computer Science
  • IT would be even more amazing if you loved working in a team, learning quickly either by yourself or from others. Must be confident and great at explaining things in simple terms
  • Work Hours: Available to work 10-20 hours during the academic year, and full-time hours during the summer of 2021

 

Why SAS

  • We love living the #SASlife and believe that happy, healthy people have a passion for life, and bring that energy to work. No matter what your specialty or where you are in the world, your unique contributions will make a difference.
  • Our multi-dimensional culture blends our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Here, it isn’t about fitting into our culture, it’s about adding to it - and we can’t wait to see what you’ll bring.

Additional Information

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status. SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Read more: Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law. Also view the supplement EEO is the Law, and the notice Pay Transparency  

  

Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications. The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience. Resumes may be considered in the order they are received. SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process. 

 

 All valid SAS job openings are located on the Careers page at www.sas.com. SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, for, or on behalf of SAS, please contact us at Recruitingsupport@sas.com before taking any further action.

UXUI DesignInternship


Program Overview:


Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv interns are in session from June 2, 2021 – August 13, 2021 and work approximately 40 hours per week.


About Ondot


Ondot, now part of Fiserv, has helped over 4,500 financial institutions modernize their credit and debit cards with digital technology. Over the last 10 years, Ondot has won numerous awards for its technology, and is excited to bring this innovation to Fiserv


The ideal candidate will be:


+ Obsessed about user experience and user-centric design.

+ An undergraduate or graduate student pursuing a degree in human computer interaction, industrial design, human factors, psychology, or related fields.

+ A motivated individual, who is passionate about advocating for, and empathizing for end users.

+ Have experience collaborating with designers to create research prototypes or other materials.

+ You can adapt and work well in a dynamic environment with rapidly changing priorities.

+ An active listener with a passion for understanding human behavior

+ A solid foundation and understanding of research methods used for uncovering customer insights

+ Have a good understanding of various UX research activities, and some experience supporting or conducting activities such as interviews and usability tests.

+ Have experience observing and note-taking during user research sessions

+ A collaborative, team player who has experience working effectively with others

+ You have some experience with qualitative and quantitative data analysis, and can make recommendations based on these observations.

+ You can summarize and communicate research findings with stakeholders and team members.

+ You are comfortable handling recruiting efforts, reaching out to potential participants by email or phone, and scheduling sessions.

+ Clearly communicate research findings with a strategic voice, with prioritized recommendations and potential design solutions to developers, designers, and project sponsors through visually compelling presentations and documents

+ Ability to use tools for user testing and follow Design thinking methodology.


Requirements of the Internship:


+ Progress toward completion of Bachelor's/Master’s degree in Computer Science, or other related fields by December 2021/ May 2023 with demonstrated academic achievement.

+ Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred)

+ Pursuing a UX Certificate preferred but not required

+ Understanding of Human Computer Interface or Psychology with special interest in Customer experience

+ Background or experience in writing, language or communication

+ Background or experience with design (i.e. Sketch and Figma)

+ Strong written and oral communication skills

+ Curiosity and willingness to ask a lot of questions


Learn more about Fiserv:


To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options.


We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.


Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.


We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.


We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.


Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.


We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.


Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us.


#FINT

Summary You will serve as a Program Manager and Lean Black Belt for the Undersea Weapons Department at Naval Undersea Warfare Center Division, Keyport, WA. Responsibilities You will oversee process improvement and production optimization, industrial engineering, modeling and simulation and related mathematical modeling, operations research, data modeling and data science initiatives. You will provide strategic planning for future requirements that include facilities, equipment, production management and human capital strategy development. You will formulate plans and facilitate courses of action with Navy, Department of Defense (DoD) and the broader Intelligence Community (IC) customers related to process improvement planning and policy-making, tasking, funding and project execution. You will engage directly with Division Heads when selecting projects and processes for Lean events. You will manage work ensuring individual and branch tasks are completed on schedule or early, at or below planned cost, and with the quality/performance required. Requirements Conditions of Employment Qualifications Your resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the ND-03 (GS-11 equivalent) pay band in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector. Specialized experience must demonstrate the following: As a professional engineer or scientist analyzing weapon system requirements utilizing statistics, metrics, or data analytical and modeling tools to determine and manage processes, technical capabilities, and requirements. Additional qualification information can be found from the following Office of Personnel Management websites: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/#url=List-by-Occupational-Series AND Professional Engineering Series, 0801 Mathematics Series, 1520 Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. Education Applicants must meet the following basic education requirements of the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Qualifications Standards Manual: Successful completion of a professional engineering degree. To be acceptable, the program must: (1) lead to a bachelor's degree (or higher) in a school of engineering with at least one program accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET); or (2) include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics. Such education must demonstrate the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to do the work of the position. OR Current registration as an Engineer Intern (EI), Engineer in Training (EIT), or licensure as a Professional Engineer (PE) by any State, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico. Absent other means of qualifying under this standard, those applicants who achieved such registration by means other than written test (e.g., State grandfather or eminence provisions) are eligible only for positions that are within or closely related to the specialty field of their registration For more information about EI and EIT registration requirements, please visit the National Society of Professional Engineers website at: http://www.nspe.org OR Evidence of having successfully passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) examination or any other written test required for professional registration by an engineering licensure board in the various States, the District of Columbia, Guam, and Puerto Rico The FE examination is not administered by the U. S. Office of Personnel Management. For more information, please visit: http://www.nspe.org/Licensure/HowtoGetLicensed/index.html. OR Successful completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences and in engineering that included the courses specified in the basic requirements under paragraph A (above). The courses must be fully acceptable toward meeting the requirements of an engineering program as described in paragraph A (above) OR Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's degree in an appropriate scientific field, e.g., engineering technology, physics, chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, or geology, may be accepted in lieu of a bachelor's degree in engineering, provided the applicant has had at least one year of professional engineering experience acquired under professional engineering supervision and guidance. Ordinarily, there should be either an established plan of intensive training to develop professional engineering competence, or several years of prior professional engineering-type experience, e.g., in interdisciplinary positions. OR Degree in mathematics; or the equivalent of a major that included at least 24 semester hours in mathematics. OR Combination of education and experience - courses equivalent to a major in mathematics (including at least 24 semester hours in mathematics), as described above, plus appropriate experience or additional education. Additional Information This position is covered by the Department of Defense Priority Placement Program. Additional vacancies may be filled by this announcement. A tentative offer of employment will be rescinded if the selectee fails to meet the pre-employment requirements, including failure to report to any of the scheduled appointments. If you are unable to apply online and request information about the Alternate Application process, please contact the Department of Navy's Employment Information Center. Policy information may be found at: http://www.secnav.navy.mil/donhr/Documents/CivilianJobs/FedCivAnnuitants.pdf ICTAP Applicants: To be considered well-qualified and exercise selection priority as an ICTAP candidate, displaced Federal employees must satisfy all qualification requirements for the position and receive a rating in the highly qualified category (score 85) or higher. Applicants who do not provide this documentation will not receive consideration as an ICTAP candidate. For more information about ICTAP eligibility please review the following link: https://www.usajobs.gov/Help/working-in-government/unique-hiring-paths/federal-employees/ictap/ Military Spouse Preference applicants will receive priority consideration at the Full Performance Level (FPL) and if determined to be Best Qualified at the FPL, and selected, must be placed at the FPL.
