Revance is daring to make a difference in the aesthetics market. Come be a part of our journey in setting a new standard. Our 2021 Summer Internship Program is scheduled to run from May/June 2021 until August/September 2021. This 12-week program is designed to provide students the opportunity to get a better understanding of a unique fintech platform (Hint MD) within the biotech pharma industry.   This is a paid internship as a temporary employee, working up to 40 hours per week in our Pleasanton location.

Dare to make a difference? Be ready to be feel valued, developed, engaged, and empowered. The Data Analytics team at Revance Therapeutics is looking for an audacious Data Analyst Pioneer (Intern). Yes, Pioneer! You will work alongside specialists within our group to help develop the future of our function.

What do we do? We are building an Integrated fintech platform designed to transform existing payment processing ecosystems and improve both aesthetic practice economics and patient experiences.

There is nothing like your own experience. An internship within the Data Analytics team at Revance Therapeutics not only offers an opportunity to build your skills and confidence, but also to work on projects that give you insight into who we are and what we do as a Biotech and Fintech Company (who’s growing at a rapid speed) as well as for the wider community. This is a unique opportunity to intern with an integrated digital services platform targeted to aesthetic practice payment services.

You will be assigned tasks to develop your understanding of what we really do, and you will build networks with your colleagues in Data Analytics and Software Engineering. Not only will you work on tasks that address the present needs but will help with tasks that drive value for the future of the team. Opportunity is at the heart of a career at Revance Therapeutics and our Data Analytics internship offers just that. 

 Essential Duties/Responsibilities
  • Work closely with Product team, QA Engineers, SME’s to determine appropriate data sources and to define data provisioning mechanism from building data pipelines to dashboards
  • Conceptualizing, developing, and maintaining dashboards and visualizations
  • Examine through large amounts of data, extract key insights, and communicate concisely
  • Identify key metrics and build executive facing dashboards to track progress of the business
  • Identify data automation opportunities and manage projects to refine the process by getting hands-on with the data stack
  • Improve the quality of existing data pipeline, data warehouse, setting up alerts on anomaly detections, well-thought out ETL, and clearly documenting the workflows
  • Learn and contribute to the design of data management and any future transformation of the data engineering landscape
  • Demonstrate flexibility as needed. Participate in manual testing, automated testing, put out fires (not literally) and troubleshooting when required.
  • Prepare presentations, reports, and analytics
  • Collaborate with intern peers to propose solutions to real business problems
  • Execute a group project with fellow interns
  • Participate in the mentoring sessions, guest speaker series, and training modules
  • Participate in a community service program
  • Assist with the engagement survey action plan project
  • Other duties as assigned

Education

  • Current 3rd or 4th year students pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics or related field

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Familiarity with ETL tools. Knowledge in Redshift and PostgreSQL is preferred.
  • Familiarity working in finance, sales.
  • Familiarity in data validation and data integrity testing.
  • Familiarity with the concepts of Data-Dictionaries.
  • Familiarity in BI/Reporting tools like Looker, Periscope, Quick sights, PowerBI.
  • Excellent analytical, troubleshooting skills, verbal and written communications skills.
  • Familiarity of working in a Scrum/Agile environment.
  • Ability to work in teams and cultivate relationships
  • Intellectual curiosity: seeking opportunities to develop
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Demonstrated leadership or initiative at school, work and/or community
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office—Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Demonstrated leadership or initiative at school, work and/or community

description:

Description

Summary

Working under the direct supervision of a licensed OTR, PT, COTA, PTA or SLP, provide routine direct patient care treatment programs, clerical duties, and light housekeeping activities to support the care of patients and the efficiency of the operation. Collaborate with all members of the healthcare team to provide services to patients.

  • Patient objective and subjective responses to treatment is observed and accurately recorded. Any changes are immediately reported to appropriate team member.
  • Clerical activities are performed, including recording services rendered to the patient, answering the phone, filing, and data entry to help the patient and facility run efficiently.
  • Cleanliness and organization of assigned areas is maintained and routine cleaning of equipment is performed per department guidelines.
  • Light housekeeping activities including changing linen, laundry, and other duties are completed to meet established objectives.
  • Documentation to support reimbursement is completed within organizational and regulatory guidelines.
  • Additional department, organization, or network activities are completed per established objectives.

  • Experience in hospital or outpatient setting is desirable.

Required

  • Effective verbal and written communication skills with English.
  • Basic skills in math and computer science.

position: Software Engineering Intern - Circuit Simulation R&D (Masters or PhD student)
description:
At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

The Circuit Simulation Intern will assist R&D staff in developing new algorithms and software for the Spectre circuit simulator.  Job duties may include hands-on experience in researching new algorithmic approaches, software engineering to implement new features, performing software validation and testing, and investigating performance/accuracy issues in the simulator.

  • Applicant should have previous exposure to the circuit simulation area and experience in EDA-relevant software development, particular C/C++ unix development.  

  • Background in one or more of numerical techniques for VLSI circuit simulation or related general numerical simulation algorithms (numerical linear algebra, computational electromagnetics, parallel numerical algorithms) or semiconductor device modeling is required.  

  • Applicant should be a candidate for an advanced degree in the electrical engineering, computer science, or related field.  

  • Understanding of analog/RF/custom IC design and verification practices is a strong plus.

Location

Work From Home MI

 

Job Summary

The Information Technology Department at Flagstar Bank is looking for summer interns to join their team. These positions will either follow a technical track related to application maintenance or a business track related to project management, communication and documentation.

As a Flagstar Intern you will have the opportunity to learn the daily functions and operations of our IT department. During this time, you will interact with team members and leaders to gain real-world experience by working alongside our team to learn our processes and improve efficiencies while expanding on the core concepts introduced throughout your college classes. Throughout your internship you will participate in multiple engagement sessions designed to enhance your career outlook, communication skills and business knowledge.

 

Job Responsibilities:

  • Creation of standards and guidelines for the System Development LifeCycle (SDLC) in support of the DevSecOps processes that are being introduced within Flagstar.
  • The focus will be on new development for Cloud based systems but could also cover areas related to legacy systems migration to the Cloud.
  • Development of the TOGAF Framework 9.2 for Flagstar.
  • This will require working alongside the Enterprise Architecture team as the TOGAF framework is designed and though initial rollouts.
  • Ensure compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations.  Complete all required compliance training.  Maintain knowledge of and adhere to Flagstar's internal compliance policies and procedures.  Take responsibility to keep up to date with changing regulations and policies.

  • Must have completed a minimum of 1 year in an accredited college or university
  • Programing experience is desired

  • Strong numeric and problem-solving capabilities
  • Ability to multi-task projects in an effective and productive manner
  • Must be able to demonstrate solid writing and verbal communication skills
  • Must be highly organized and have a strong attention to detail
  • Must be able to work from home independently and be a self-starter

position: Internship: Network Engineer & NOC Technician- Full Time
description:
Wisper Internet of Mascoutah, IL is looking to hire a full-time Intern: Network Engineer & NOC Technician to participate in our Internship Program. Are you a humbly confident student? Would you like to take your career to the next level with a growing company in the internet service industry? If so, please read on!
With offices located in Illinois & Missouri, we are a leading local wireless high-speed internet provider in the Midwest. While growing at a rapid pace, we provide service with a human touch. We provide service to rural communities where other providers do not.We believe in building leaders within all levels of our company. In order to exemplify our core values, we offer interns competitive pay, career development, & a positive work culture. The total number of hires & start dates are subject to workload & business conditions. Locations will vary based on project needs, & may include Mascoutah, IL, Joplin, MO, & Washington, MO.


Internship Functions:

  • Train with department management, professional and support staff in order to gain work experience utilizing an Educational & Implementation Phase
  • Gain working knowledge of applications & tools related to assigned functional area
  • Perform assigned tasks & project work with supervision
  • Other specific duties/tasks determined by department management
    1.Education Phase
    All participants in this program will go through each overview, regardless which track they select at the end of the three months.
    Month 1 (Basics Overview):
    Basic RF Propagation
    Basic Networking - TCP/IP, Subnetting
    Equipment Overview (Fixed Wireless Access Points, Backhauls, Switches, Routers)
    Month 2 (Engineering Overview):
    Basic Wireless Design
    Reading RF Propagation Maps
    Tower Design/Overview
    Month 3 (NOC Overview):
    NMS (Network Monitory System) Overview
    Ticketing/Escalation Process Overview
    Change Management Overview
    2. Implementation Phase
    All participants in this phase will be offered the opportunity to apply what they have learned & will select which track they enjoyed the most from their first 3 months of education, with the final track placement subject to department availability.
    Engineering:
    Month 4 - Running RF Propagation Models
    Month 5 - Designing Wireless and Fiber Backhauls
    Month 6 - Complete Site Design - Building design packages that include RF Propagation & BH Design for single & multisite design
    NOC:
    Month 4 - Network Monitoring and Ticket Creation
    Month 5 - Customer Resolution - Tier 1 Tickets
    Month 6 - Customer Resolution - Tier 2 Tickets

Internship Requirements:

  • Valid Driver's License
  • Ability to commit fully to the Program for 12 months in a full- time status with an understanding that no full-time position is guaranteed upon completion
  • Currently enrolled in a four-year Bachelor of Science degree program in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Information Technology, Information Systems Management, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering
  • Completed at least two years of undergraduate studies in one of the above fields
  • Eligibility to work & remain in the U.S. without sponsorship

Internship Desired Skills & Competencies:

  • Completed relevant coursework with a 2.5 or above GPA
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Enthusiasm for technology, paired with a love of learning
  • Personal accountability with ability to be punctual

Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:

  • Ability to pass a background check & drug screen
  • Work is performed indoors at a desk

Physical Requirements:
X-Light: Lifting 0-10 lbs. Moderate: Lifting 0-25 lbs. Heavy: Lifting 25 lbs.

In this role, you will help create next-generation sustainable metallurgy solutions as a member of the modeling team at Kennesaw R&D center. You will develop computer models for optimizing aluminum recycling and carbon footprint in rolled aluminum production. You will integrate these models with computational materials science and machine learning tools to design recycling-friendly alloys for circular aluminum economy. You will engage with the production and alloy development teams to advance sustainable alloy design efforts for automotive, packaging, and aerospace applications.

This co-op will start June 1, 2021 and end December 17, 2021 in a hybrid model of virtual learning and onsite lab practices.  Relocation assistance will be provided, if needed.


Responsibilities:

  • Development of computer models for estimating recycling performance of alloys
  • Application of developed models for optimization of alloy specifications for minimum carbon footprint
  • Deployment of the models in the cloud
  • Collaboration and communication of results with cross-functional team

Qualifications

  • BSc or graduate level degree in engineering with exposure to computer science or software development
  • Strong programming skills in Python and advanced visualization
  • Experience in computational materials science and machine learning methods
  • Program deployment in cloud systems
  • Familiarity with metallurgy, metal forming, or manufacturing processes

Novelis’ Global Research and Technology Center located in Kennesaw Georgia within the greater Atlanta metropolitan area is a cutting-edge full-service research and technology hub that employs approximately 200 people including world-class engineers metallurgists chemists and scientists. The facility includes state-of-the-art lab equipment and a diverse mix of product pilot lines that bring innovative solutions to customers in the automotive beverage can and specialty markets. Kennesaw provides a diverse and family-friendly place to live with countless museums cultural opportunities and educational institutions. Novelis is committed to the Kennesaw community and supports a number of local charitable organizations including Habitat for Humanity as well as FIRST Robotics aimed at encouraging young people to pursue the Science Technology Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) fields in order to spur the next generation of scientists and innovators. Novelis recognizes its talented and diverse workforce as a key competitive advantage. Novelis provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants. Staples is focused on our customer and our community. As a Software Engineer Intern for Staples, you will be part of a fast-paced, cross-functional team responsible for delivering world class software solutions that will be utilized across the retail setting. You will be challenged with identifying innovative ideas and proof of concept to deliver against the existing and future needs of our growing business.


The Staples Summer Internship Program is full time position for 8 - 10 weeks. As a member of our Software Engineering team, all interns will have regularly assigned work, will participate in team meetings and events, have an opportunity to network with other professionals in the field, and serve as a fully functioning member of our dynamic team. There will be ample opportunity to work collaboratively with other software engineering professionals on assignments that address current business issues and challenges them to build on their knowledge base and skill set.


Responsibilities:


Please note that when applying to this Intern position, you may be considered for a number of Technology roles within the Software Engineering team, such as a front-end or back-end developer, a quality engineer, a mobile developer, a release engineer, or an integration developer.


Your responsibilities as an Intern will vary based on the specific role and organization, and may involve;


+ Gathering business requirements and collaborating with business partners.

+ Researching, designing, testing, deploying and maintaining software solutions.

+ Interacting with engineers and other cross-functional teams such as Product Management, Release Engineering, Quality Engineering, Data Science, Data Security or Operations, to develop innovative solutions that meet Retail needs with respect to functionality, performance, scalability, reliability, realistic implementation schedules, and adherence to development goals and principles.

+ Identifying and fixing stability/scalability issues in a very time critical environment.

+ Participating in implementations, helping to resolve issues, and developing industry and product technical expertise.


Qualifications

Essential skills and experience:


+ Currently pursuing a Bachelors degree (rising junior or senior) or Master’s degree in computer science, software engineering, data science/analytics, data security or related technology fields.

+ Requires a GPA of 3.0 or higher


Preferred skills and experience:


+ Experience in systems software or algorithms

+ Familiarity with TCP/IP and network architecture

+ Knowledge of database technologies such as RDBMS, SQL & NoSQL technologies

+ Familiarity with REST or SOAP webservices

+ Knowledge of UNIX/Linux or Windows environments and APIs

+ Excellent implementation skills (C++, Java, Python)

POSITION SUMMARY:
Under the general direction of the Vice President of Market Research, and in partnership with cross-functional internal partners, this hands-on role works primarily on Voice of the Customer primary market research and related analysis. This role requires significant coordination with cross-functional stakeholders. The role also coordinates the work of preferred partner vendors to augment the team's capacity and identifies when an elevated level of expertise is warranted to support project objectives. This role manages the CXI team's intern and may manage full time direct reports. The Market Manager will have an attention to detail and be a proactive, critical thinker who is interested and able to work in a matrixed, team-oriented organization where all team members take responsibility for the quality and timeliness of work while exemplifying the company's guiding principles.

In addition, the market research manager works closely with a number of key roles, stakeholders and functions across the organization to include but not limited to the following: business stakeholders (sales), financial analysts, customer operations, customer solutions, distribution operations and marketing. S/he needs to be a creative thinker and propose innovative approaches to data collection and analyses. The market research manager should know statistical methods and internal data sets to complete research projects. In addition, the market research manager will understand and effectively employ a number of ways to visualize data in a way that is highly effective and persuasive.

Finally, the market research manager must be inherently analytical and have a high level of curiosity in getting to next level understanding of insights behind the data. Excellent written and communications skills will also be a necessity for this role.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Reviews research briefs to understand objectives and consults on the design of surveys to ensure the data collected will facilitate the right analysis to generate findings that support the objectives
Independently programs and tests surveys, including the development of call to action and thank you messages, uploads respondent data, and deploys surveys
Integrates data from outside sources into Qualtrics and utilizes Qualtrics analytical tools to develop findings
Builds dashboards, provides training on optimal use, and continuously finds ways to improve data visualizations and incorporate new Qualtrics features within the dashboards
Calculates required respondents to achieve desired confidence level. Checks and ensures data validity. Identifies when advanced analytical techniques are appropriate.
Conducts analysis of Voice of the Customer data. Demonstrates strong proficiency with all Qualtrics analytical tools.
Identifies and integrates secondary data sources into the VOC analysis in order to improve the specificity and actionability of the analysis, findings and recommendations.
Demonstrates insightful quantitative understanding of a data set. Manipulates, analyzes and visualizes data to reveal trends in customer expectations and customer perceptions of company's performance. Identifies correlations in the data, including value drivers. Elevates key opportunities where improvement will have the greatest impact.
Actively participates with the CXI team in presentations and workshops where findings and recommendations to improve the CX are discussed and debated. Interprets VOC analysis and effectively communicates statistical concepts in way that makes it easy to understand and is not intimidating to non-technical audiences
With the hands-on support of the Vice President of Market Research, and preferred partners, prepares findings reports for senior executives. Using Microsoft PowerPoint, develops reports with clear, compelling, and easy to interpret data visualizations along with a narrative that translates the data into insights that convey a story or distinct point of view.
Becomes the company's foremost expert use of Qualtrics, a best-in-class technology for research and analysis. Continuously improves proficiency in utilizing all aspects of the tool, particularly those related to analysis. May support the training other associates. Stays current on knowledge of new features/functionality and proactively brings ideas for how these can be applied to support the team's goals
Generates timely and concise communications appropriate for executive leadership to understand project status and pending issues.
Monitors response rates to surveys and proactively makes recommendations on when additional action is required to accelerate participation
Maintains a tracking program to report on budget allocated to donations in association with charitable giving for survey incentives
Collaborates with IT, preferred vendors, and others to problem-solve through data integration requirements, survey deployment decisions, and other operational considerations related to the VOC and customer experience programs
Manages the intern's workflow/priorities, reviews all work contributed by intern, and provides guidance and coaching to support the intern's professional development.
Proactively recommends ideas to improving efficiency and quality in the team's workflows, processes, and deliverables
Builds and maintains strong relationships across the organization through frequent and open communication/collaboration
Proactively seeks out and manages time to accommodate for continuous learning and development.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
Typical Education
Minimum of bachelors (advanced degree (Masters or PHD preferred) in data analytics, marketing research, statistics or computer science or related field;
Typically requires 3+ years of relevant quantitative and qualitative research and analytics experience.
Solid knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
Knowledge of one or more market research platforms (e.g. Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth, SPSS, Medallion)
Proficiency in the use of statistical methodologies (regression, maxdiff, conjoint, Turf analysis, correlation, descriptive variables).
Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics and multivariate testing
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge of one or more business/functional areas.

Work Complexity
Designs experiments, tests hypotheses and builds statistical models.
Employs a number of complex research methodologies (correlation matrices, turf analysis, conjoint analysis, max diff)
Highly skilled in running bivariate and simple multivariate statistics

Market Research
Design, test and program surveys to support VOC programs and other insight projects
Designs qualitative and quantitative studies and aligns them to the proper use case.
Identifies audience size, sample size, confidence level and confidence interval necessary to meet statistical validation

Strategic Planning & Project Planning
Participates in team strategic planning sessions to support annual and long-range objectives.
Creates and manages research project plans and tracks key milestones

Business Requirements
Works with commercial and functional stakeholders to define business problems and develop research methodologies to gather the necessary insights that inform recommendations
Possesses a high-level understanding of one or more business or functional areas.
Develops key business stakeholder relationships.
Leverages knowledge of internal and external data sources and leverages this knowledge to solve business problems
Data Requirements
Works with others to support data collection in support of research projects and integration of internal systems (e.g. Qualtrics with SFDC) to automate data transfer.
Works to combine customer experience data (e.g. satisfaction) and operational data (e.g. financial) to complete robust analyses and findings.

Analytics
Solves business analytics problems and communicates results and methodologies.
Works in iterative processes with business stakeholders and validates findings.
Develops experimental design approaches to validate findings or test hypotheses.
Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples.

Communications and Presentation
Presents and depicts the rationale of findings in easy to understand terms for the business and functional groups.
Highly effective visual depiction of data, trends, charts, graphs in compelling fashion.
Communicates and works with stakeholders and other SME's as required to meet project objectives.

Ideally this would be someone with healthcare experience and has done B2B work. Familiar with SPSS, Qualtrics, R, Sawtooth and other market research, statistical software.

Pocket Gems seeks to build the greatest mobile games and most compelling interactive entertainment in the world. That’s the mission our founders began with, in an apartment above a pizza shop back in 2009, and it continues to inspire us today. Since then, we’ve grown to over 200 people in San Francisco, and with $155 million in backing from Sequoia Capital and Tencent, we’re constantly breaking new ground in mobile entertainment.

Our products have been downloaded over 500million times by players around the world and have generated over $1 billion in bookings.In recent years, we’ve launched Episode, a mobile storytelling network and platform, and War Dragons, a visually stunning 3D real-time strategy game.

As our community of players continues to grow, we’re committed to building diverse and inclusive environments across our teams, and in our games.

As a summerSoftwareEngineer Intern, you will be a part of a small intern cohort, paired with an experienced software engineering mentor, collaborating cross-functionally with teams including other software engineers, product managers, artists, and designers to define our next generation of mobile games. During our10-week program, our interns are meaningful contributors to our live products, leaving the summer having made a tangible impact on their team while gaining technical and professional skills to set them up for future success!

Note: To be considered, you must be willing to work remotely out of one of the following states through the duration of the 10 week internship program: California, Washington, Colorado, or Texas

What You’ll Do:

  • Develop and code innovative features using groundbreaking technologies
  • Enjoy the freedom of writing native applications while exploring the latest cross-platform technologies
  • Participate in all aspects of the project life-cycle, from ideation to specification to release
  • Design and implement scalable, reliable and maintainable technologies for our iOS and Android gaming platforms
  • Work with innovative, great, fun people!

What You Bring to the Engineering Team:

  • Working toward a BA, BS, or MS in Computer Science or related technical discipline
  • Solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, software design and OOP
  • Passion and excitement for solving interesting problems and building great products!

Extra Gems For:

  • Programming experience in one or more of the following: C/C, C#, Objective-C, Java, Python, JavaScript, Mobile Software Development (iOS, Android)

Other Internship Perks:

  • An amazing summer packed with mentorship, networking opportunities, learning & development roundtables, fun intern events (escape room, intern olympics, jackbox), and of course projects with real business impact.
  • Read more about what we’ve been up tohere! 

Please Note:

  • We are looking for students going to U.S. universities,graduating in Winter 2021 or Spring 2022
  • Prior mobile/gaming experience isNOTrequired

Read more about what we’ve been up to! 

  • Pocket Gems Blog

At Pocket Gems, we're building teams that value originality, inclusivity, and accountability. While we believe we offer competitive perks, such as annual bonuses, unlimited PTO, 401k matching, and a generous benefits package, we hope to engage with talent based on ourcore values. 

Pocket Gems is an equal opportunity employer. position: IT Audit - Corporate Management Trainee / Internship
description:
Description

We are excited to identify diverse men and women to join this Management Trainee (MT) Program is specifically designed to develop leaders that will drive the future of our organization.

This program begins with a one week orientation at our corporate headquarters in Fort Worth, Texas.

During this time, MTs receive a company overview, interact with company leaders, and develop skills for a successful career. Additional training will vary by department. With hard work, the desire to learn, and the ability to develop relationships, career opportunities are endless.


Relocation assistance may be provided to those who are moving more than 50 driving miles from their permanent residence.


Management trainees in this position are primarily responsible for execution of analysis and testing as part of audits.

Management Trainees audit various information technology processes including application development, infrastructure, telecommunications, security, and operational technologies. Audits can also be focused on the revenue / finance and subsidiary governance processes, or operational processes:

Duties and responsibilities are as follows:
* Manage work assignments and timelines.
* Under supervision, develop detailed test procedures that address audit objectives and significant risks.
* Interpret and evaluate audit evidence.
* Document work performed with logical conclusions and appropriate audit evidence and support.
* Present audit results, both in written and verbal formats.

Opportunities exist to audit the following systems, departments and/or processes:
* Application Development
* Business Intelligence/Analytics
* Geographic Information Systems (GIS)
* Database Administration
* Information Security
* Network Management
* SAP
* Sensory Technology
* System Architecture
* Mobile & Web Development
* Project Management
* Telecommunications/Positive Train Control
* IT SOX and General Computing Controls


WORKING CONDITIONS:

  • Primarily an office environment, occasional travel required.
  • Normal office hours, Monday through Friday, with weekend or evening work as required.

Requirements

SPECIFIC REQUIREMENT:

  • Must have reliable transportation to and from work.

Additionally, qualified candidates must be able to:
* Demonstrate the ability to perform the duties and responsibilities listed above.
* Demonstrate leadership skills.
* Work effectively in a team environment.
* Express ideas and information in a clear and concise manner.
* Recognize and respond effectively to unexpected situations and tight deadlines.
* Demonstrate flexibility and adaptability to changing task priorities and work situations.
* Demonstrate ability to complete tasks regardless of obstacles.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
* Primarily an office environment, with some field activities.
* Normal office hours, Monday through Friday, with weekend or evening work as required.

SPECIFIC REQUIREMENT:
* Must have reliable transportation to and from work.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
* Cumulative GPA of 2.75 for engineering majors OR cumulative GPA of 3.0 for non-engineering majors.
* Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Graduate degree from an accredited university to be completed prior to hire OR have obtained a degree within the past three (3) years.
* Less than three (3) years of work experience in a professional work environment. When calculating work experience, EXCLUDE internships or positions held while in high school or college.


* Authorization to work in the US without Company sponsorship now AND in the future.
* Proficiency in MS Office Applications (specifically Outlook, Visio, Excel, Word, and Power Point).
* General understanding required of Information Systems, including knowledge of application development, database administration, business intelligence, personal computers, and/or local area networks.
* Strong drive for results as well as superior communications and teamwork skills to be able to gather information from employees to identify and resolve problems.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
* Cumulative GPA of 3.5 or above.
* Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Decision Science, Computer or Software Engineering, Management/Business Information Systems, Cyber Security, Electrical Engineering, Data Science and Analytics, OR any other Technical/Engineering related degree.
* Ability in any of the following is preferred: auditing, security, applications development, project management, mobile device development methodologies, database design, modeling, mining, data management, data warehouse concepts, network planning and implementation, and engineering and voice/video systems.
* Experience with one or more of the following programming languages and tools such as SQL querying/scripting, Tableau, Java, and Python.
* Experience in Cellular or Telecommunications related environment.


Additional Requirements:

BACKGROUND INVESTIGATION ELEMENTS:

  • Criminal history
  • Last 7 years of driving history
  • Last 5 years of employment history to include military service
  • Social Security number
  • Education

MEDICAL REVIEW ELEMENTS:

  • Medical evaluation
  • Drug Screen
  • Other elements as needed

Benefits

This role offers competitive benefit programs and services including, but not limited to

  • Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage
  • 401(k) Plan
  • Life Insurance
  • Incentive Compensation Plan (ICP)
  • Tuition Reimbursement Program

position: Car Multimedia Infotainment Tester (Kettering University Co-op Section A)
description:
Company Description

Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology - with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe. Welcome to Bosch.

Job Description

Kettering University Student Co-Op

Bosch Car Multimedia has created an environment that promotes innovation and collaboration. All associates of the division provide valuable input to the company, and interns are no exception to this. As a Bosch intern, you will gain excellent experience by being fully immersed in the testing process for CM products. With the highly interactive nature of the products developed in the division, testing is a crucial element to the development of these components. The tasks associated with position include:

  • System testing of Car Multimedia infotainment products.

  • Detection of software defects in highly complex in-vehicle infotainment.

  • Exposure to real-world business, as well as in-vehicle infotainment software development.

  • Support customers onsite, and road testing related to navigation, telematics, traffic, and other SXM services.

  • Coordination with global testing team to address and resolve hardware and software complications.

  • Provide missing data and/or information via testing and retesting.

Skills to be successful in this position:

  • Highly motivated with a strong work ethic.

  • Independent problem solving mindset.

  • Proficiency in problem solving, particularly in a technical environment.

  • Accountable for assigned tasks.

  • Highly detailed documentation skills.

  • Valid U.S. driver’s license, clean driving record, and safe driving skills.

  • Ability to follow previously established guidelines to provide high quality results.

  • Ability to have critical verbal communication with our OE customers.

  • Ability to multitask with complex tasks.

  • Basic understanding of software development.

  • Ability to adapt to a changing environment, as technology is always evolving.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

  • Must be legally authorized to work permanently in the U.S. Future sponsorship for work authorization is unavailable.

  • Currently enrolled with a qualified university.

  • Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or another related field.

  • Freshman or Sophomore class standing only.

  • Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.

  • Must be 18 years of age

  • Ability to travel occasionally.

Additional preferred skills:

  • Strong software skills.

  • Understanding of global business development.

  • Passion or interest in innovative technology.

  • Innovative and collaborative mindset.

  • Strong communications skills; written and verbal.

  • Proficiency in Windows based systems and Microsoft Office.



Additional Information

Indefinite U.S. work authorized individuals only.  Future sponsorship for work authorization unavailable. 

By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce - EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled.

BOSCH is a proud supporter of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics) Initiatives

·       FIRST Robotics (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology)

·       AWIM (A World In Motion)

You know us as the food and beverage company behind a lot of your favorites like Stouffer’s, Nesquik, Toll House, and Lean Cuisine, as well as new discoveries like Sweet Earth and Chameleon Cold-Brew coffee. Across our organization, we’re building a workplace where collaboration is essential, courage is rewarded, speed is encouraged, and agility is the norm to delight our consumers every single day!


Here at Nestlé USA, you are empowered to become a student of the business and deliver the best to our consumers. We’re inviting forward-thinking and courageous future leaders to embrace an entrepreneurial approach and start their journey of growth.


If you're a current technologist and analytically focused graduate student eager to make an impact on an enormous scale, take strides into greatness by joining Nestlé USA.


What To Expect


Our 12 week paid internship with the Digital Acceleration Team is an opportunity to drive high-visibility, high-impact global outcomes for Nestlé. The environment will challenge you to think differently about problem solving and is a phenomenal way to get a feel for working at Nestlé. You will have hands on involvement with a significant business project from start to finish and get experience you won’t find in the classroom. You will apply the analytical and coding knowledge you have gained in school in a real world setting, while being supported by a team that includes a project manager, buddy, and mentor. You will have an opportunity to develop your professional network and extend your own portfolio of work.


Our projects are challenging, engaging and represent current business challenges that need a fresh perspective. You showcase the work you have done on your project at an end-of-internship presentation to senior leaders in the Digital organization. The internship experience also provides interaction with senior management and collaboration with team members across the business.


Interns experience life at Nestlé in a hands-on environment. We encourage students to question why we do things the way we do, provide fresh ideas, and improve processes and products. You’ll be part of the action and working from day 1.


After Your Internship


Our intern program is designed to bring High Achievers into the Digital organization at Nestlé USA and is intended to be a feeder into a full time position. We match your skill sets and passion with positions in our Digital organization. High performing summer interns are offered the opportunity to join the Digital organization after graduation and start their careers at Nestlé.


Education Requirements


+ Graduate students pursuing Master of Science in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering (Operations Research, Industrial), Economics, Applied Mathematics and/or Statistics. Graduating between December 2021 and June 2022.

+ Showcases a strong level of academic success (Cumulative GPA 3.0+)


Preferred Skills


+ Coding skills for analytics and data analysis (SQL, R Python, etc.)

+ Experience with large data sets.

+ Results focused and can clearly speak to projects they’ve executed.

+ Passionate lifelong learners who are agile and stay abreast of the evolving technology and data landscape.

+ Embraces courage to propose new ways of operating and challenges the status quo.

+ Leverages their intellectual curiosity to aid in problem solving and distills complex information into simple ideas

+ Resourceful, self-starter who applies varied means to uncover answers and arrive at conclusions.

+ Fire from within to execute and deliver a successful end product and do it better than the competition.

+ Strong communicators who encourage others and excel in a team environment.


Perks


+ Competitive compensation package.

+ Exposure to senior leadership through project presentation and mentoring

+ Volunteer in a community service opportunity with one of Nestlé’s Share Valued Organizations (e.g. Boys & Girls Club of America & Nestlé Adopt-A-School Program)

+ Potential employment opportunities after completion of degree


The Nestlé Companies are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer seeking diversity in qualified applicants for employment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.


EOE M/F/D/V Nestle is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is looking for diversity in candidates for employment. All candidates must apply online at Nestlejobs.com

POSITION OVERVIEW

HomeWAV is looking for a Technical Writer Intern that will join our team for a 3-month program this summer. With the guidance of a mentor, this intern will complete a project that resembles the work done by full-time, professional Technical Writers. The Technical writer intern will deliver accurate, well-written, useful, customer-focused policies and procedure documentation. This position will also help with Service SOW's for HomeWAV's direct sites and help with training documentation for our Learning Management System. The ideal candidate has excellent writing skills and technical aptitude.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Write, develop, deliver, and maintain customer-facing, best-in-class user documentation.
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand and identify requirements and customer needs.
  • Analyze specifications and product descriptions and recommend the best documentation approach.
  • Follow established style and process guidelines to provide consistency and completeness.
  • Develop document templates to speed up document production and improve consistency.
  • Organize pre-existing spaces to consolidate and de-duplicate documentation and finding new ways to connect documents for easier discovery.
  • Demonstrated ability to write content that is clear, well organized, and grammatically correct.

JOB SUMMARY

Local Candidates only, this is NOT a permanent remote position.

The Data Scientist Co-op is responsible for processing structured and unstructured data, analyzing large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve the company by building data products to extract valuable business insights. In this role, the Data Scientist should be highly analytical with knack for data analysis, computer programming using Python, Data Science, databases and Big Data. The individual should also demonstrate passing for Machine Learning and Research. Responsibilities include but not limited to:

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collect data from various sources such as web APIs to internal databases encoded in SQL.

Identify and analyze patterns in the large volume of data supporting HFIs new business initiatives and the speed or sudden variations in data collection.

Organize and wrangle large datasets in order to get actionable insights from them.

Integrate and prepare large, varied datasets, architecting specialized database and computing environments.

Build predictive models using machine learning algorithms and programming knowledge to efficiently go through large datasets and apply treatments, filters and conditions to the data.

Apply exploratory data methods and predictive analysis to navigate a dataset and come out with some broad conclusions based on some initial appraisal.

Work closely with clients, data stewards and other teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound organizational decisions.

Responsible for modeling complex problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, data mining and data visualization techniques.

Responsible for complex data models and object relational database mapping while producing complex reports.

Validate findings using an experimental and iterative approach.

Create meaningful data visualizations that communicate findings and relate them back to how insights create business impact using Tableau.

Responsible for the design, development and creation of Tableau reports based on business requirements.

Review and provide technical solutions to projects which may be in different stages of the development life cycle.

Responsible for creation and maintenance of Python, Java and SQL queries and routines.

Write ad-hoc queries based on schema knowledge for various reporting requirements.

Ensures that all deliverables are thoroughly documented.

Others duties may be assigned.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

Proven experience as a Data Scientist.

Masters Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics, Applied Math or an equivalent combination of education and experience, Masters highly preferred.

Advanced programming knowledge with Python and SQL with hands-on experience.

Experience and expertise is Data Science discipline like machine learning using Python, data analysis, Big Data and data visualization with Tableau.

Previous experience with predictive modelling, machine learning and analyzing large amounts of data using frameworks like Keras, Tensorflow, Apache Spark, Hadoop etc.

Experience with the design and development of packages, code maintenance using version control tools like GitHub highly preferred.

Experience with Unix/Linux including basic commands and shell scripting.

Working Knowledge of SQL Loader & Import/Export utilities. ? Knowledge of Java with strong OOAD fundamentals.

In-depth knowledge of Tableau reporting tool.

Self-motivation and the ability to learn quickly.

Experience with cloud and database technologies like AWS, Google Cloud.

Working knowledge of job scheduling and monitoring tools.

Strong problem solving and analytical skills.

Experience working with multiple projects/tasks and the ability to prioritize.

Excellent written, communication and presentations skills.

WORKING CONDITIONS / WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Moderate noise level associated with open office work environment.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear; stand, walk, sit, use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, and reach with hands and arms. The employee occasionally will lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

Description

MERL is seeking a highly motivated intern to research multi-agent motion planning by combining optimization-based methods with machine learning. The ideal candidate is enrolled in a PhD program in Electrical, Mechanical, Aerospace Engineering, Robotics, Computer Science or related program, with prior experience in multi-agent motion planning, machine learning (especially supervised, reinforcement, and safe ML), and convex and non-convex optimization. If the situation with the COVID-19 pandemic improves before the internship is scheduled to start, this internship will be held onsite at MERL. Research Areas: Control, Dynamical Systems, Machine Learning, Optimization, Robotics

Company Description:

Quartet is a platform that makes it easier for people to get the best mental health care for them. Our technology and services reach people who need care, connect them to the right care, track the quality of their care, and support their care journeys. Backed by $160.5MM in venture funding from top investors like Oak HC/FT, GV (formerly Google Ventures), F-Prime Capital Partners, Polaris Partners, Deerfield Management, Centene Corporation, and Echo Health Ventures, Quartet partners with health insurance plans and health systems in 32 states across the country to help people get the care they need.

We are deeply committed to growing a diverse team and an equitable and inclusive culture where all Quartetians are empowered to be themselves and do their best work. We know this is vital in realizing our mission to improve the lives of people with mental health conditions. As part of our commitment to building a diverse team, we have signed the Parity Pledge and actively encourage applicants of all backgrounds to apply.

About Quartet's Internship Program:

“Quartet hires the best and brightest minds to get patients the right care, at the right time.”

Quartet employees, known as Quartetians, work together within a common set of values; we collaborate and make a difference through Building Trust, Amplifying Diverse Perspectives, Advocating Fiercely, Showing Up in Earnest and Embodying Kindness. We are driven by the knowledge and passion of our colleagues, our desire to put in quality work for the sake of our patients, and our recognition that every Quartetian has something important to say, value to add, and a life outside of work.

In our summer internship, you will get a hands-on introduction to working at a mental healthcare technology start-up and the opportunity to work alongside experts in their craft in a wide variety of disciplines. You will work on real projects that deliver real impact for people, receive mentorship and feedback, form lasting connections beyond your time here, and discover whether healthcare technology is the right career path for you.

About the team & opportunity:

The Data Science team at Quartet is charged with boosting Quartet’s efforts to improve quality and speed of mental healthcare, patient outcomes, and cost efficiency through innovation, research, and knowledge building.

Quartet is looking for an Intern to join the Data Science team for the summer. This person will work closely with the Algorithms Data Science team to use natural language processing, data analysis techniques, and machine learning to create an original research project. The Algorithms team is primarily tasked with building and deploying machine learning models and novel algorithms at scale to support core product use-cases like referral routing, patient identification, entity resolution and de-duplication, and more. If you enjoy an environment of intellectual curiosity and have a desire to help improve access to mental health care, we would be thrilled to hear from you!

Accountabilities:

  • Work independently and in collaboration with a data scientist on an original research project
  • Learn about an industrial use-case of natural language processing and machine learning to identify patterns in text data that helps route patients to the care they need
  • Make material improvements to our understanding of relationships between textual referral data, referring providers using our product, and patient acuity
  • Extend our current natural language processing pipeline to support broader patient needs
  • Communicate your observations and conclusions to a broad group of stakeholders

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in data science, computer science, engineering, informatics, or statistics
  • Strong statistical, data visualization, and object-oriented programming skills in Python
  • Competency in using Jupyter notebooks to organize and share your analyses
  • Comfort with the Linux command line, python environment management, and git for version control
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills
  • Self-starter who is curious, reliable, and knows where to look for the right answers
  • Ability to clearly communicate across disciplines and work collaboratively

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Working towards a Master’s or Ph.D. in data science, computer science, engineering, informatics, or statistics
  • Formal training in statistics and computer science
  • Familiarity with data transformation and extraction using SQL databases
  • Familiarity with working with text data, basic knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) techniques

 

Application Instructions:

Your cover letter must include the following information:

  • Why you are interested in Quartet Health
  • Three to five bullet points detailing what you want to achieve during your internship.
  • Your availability to intern on a full-time basis, and also what dates are you available to join full-time after your internship is complete?

Terms: 

  • Duration of internship: June 14 - August 20, 2021, commitment of 40 hours per week (Monday through Friday). All internships are paid.
  • Internship applications will be reviewed and accepted on a rolling basis, all applications must be submitted by April 30, 2021.
  • Due to COVID-19 precautions, this internship will be remote / virtual, so you can work from home in any location to participate. 

 

Employee Benefits for Quartet include: Unlimited vacation, volunteer opportunities, team events, mental healthcare coverage of 15 free therapy sessions + unlimited copay reimbursements, medical, dental + vision coverage, generous parental and military leave, commuter benefits, 401K, and stock option grants.

  • Experience with the Unity 3D engine

  • Knowledge of vector math

  • Skills to recognize, then adhere to the existing coding style and practices 

  • Strong problem-solving skills

  • Ability to work in a collaborative environment with ALL departments (engineers, artists, etc.)

  • Strong interest in making mobile-specific games

Preferred Additional Experience:

  • Knowledge of source control (Perforce, Git, etc.)

  • Android and iOS development experience

  • Web services

  • Unreal Engine 4 experience

  • Python

  • Knowledge of 2 or more programming languages: C#, C, C++, or Java

Job Purpose:

This position is responsible for the management, development, and user support of the GIS and other engineering systems and tools that are used in support of the outside plant and access network planning. Additionally, this position is responsible for designing, developing, deploying and maintaining a data base system for dashboards and reports within the engineering organization. These systems directly support the corporate strategic direction in the planning and design of CBT's evolving access and outside plant network to provide the best customer experience along with capital efficiency, ease of service and network reliability. This position has a direct impact on the success of corporate's network initiatives by supporting complex business problems through use of systems and data from multiple resources.

Essential Functions:

  • Perform advanced GIS functions including models, scripting and application development
  • Utilize GIS and associated software to produce, display, and analyze geographic information; creates case maps for internal and external customers
  • Develops ArcGIS Pro projects/layouts for the fulfillment of data requests as necessary
  • Designs cartographic and other visual graphic output
  • Assist with GIS mobile data collection processes such as ArcPad, Arc GIS for iOS or other related data collection technologies
  • Prepare, update, and maintain graphic displays, databases, reports, statistical information and maps as requested
  • Assists in the collection of various types of mapping data from both internal and external sources
  • Interpret various information from applications to GIS files, such as survey drawings, site development plans, subdivision plans, plats
  • Assist internal customers with map production and analysis of spatial database information
  • Provide technical support to train and assist system users in new and existing GIS applications
  • Organizes, creates, manipulates, enters and retrieves GIS data for reporting, analysis, and presentation purposes
  • Serve as GIS liaison between IT, Data Analytics, Network Ops, and external clients including setup and management of data connections
  • Set up and manage user access to GIS system including management of software licenses
  • Build compelling, interactive and actionable reporting and dashboards on top of structured data models that help in deriving meaningful business insights
  • Support the full lifecycle from requirements analysis through design and development as well as release and support phases
  • Produce models incorporating multiple data sources into reports and make recommendations which enable decision making
  • Provide ad-hoc reporting support and activities in a collaborative environment

Education:

  • Four years of College resulting in a Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
  • Bachelor's Degree in Geography, GIS, Computer Science, Planning, Engineering, Surveying or related field

General Work Experience:

2 to 3 years

Previous Work Experience:

  • 2 years experience working with engineering system and tools including working with large amounts of data from various data resources
  • Experience in the use and administration of Esri ArcGis as well as advanced GIS functions including models and scripting
  • Advanced knowledge of GIS-related software, products and services: Python, C#, Sql.
  • Experience with visualizations within Power BI (or similar) using multiple sources such as SQL server, Excel, Esri ArcGis
  • Skill in researching, compiling, and summarizing statistical data and information materials
  • Utility industry background preferred with knowledge of utility infrastructure components
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships and communications with internal and external customers
  • Ability to work remotely, organize work, establish priorities, meet established deadlines, and follow up on assignments with a minimum of direction
  • Python, JavaScript, Java, SQL preferred

Special Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Esri ArcGis experience is required
  • Oracle and Sql database experience required

Supervisory Responsibility:

Co-op, intern or contractor resources as needed

Overview



Vectrus strives to bring high performance, operational excellence, and customer focus to every aspect of our business. In a rapidly changing and complex world, we continue to push to be a top innovator and achiever in the software development field and are proud to serve in our country's defense. We're seeking dedicated innovators and achievers to help us expand on our mission to provide high quality software solutions in the areas of RF modeling/simulation, spectrum sharing, and interference deconfliction applications. As either a Entry Level Software Engineer or an Engineering Intern at Vectrus, you will be provided the opportunity to learn from our professional software development team while you provide support to multiple DoD Program Offices as well as our commercial customers. You will work alongside our software development team to develop full software applications, RF modeling applications, quick-response custom tailored software applications, and many other related software engineering tasks.



Responsibilities



Major Job Activities:





• Work as part of an agile software development team to implement multi-user database-driven RF spectrum deconfliction and related software applications for our customers. • Design/develop/modify software. • Profile tools and improve performance as required. • Write and review software documentation. • Coordinate with team members to ensure problem resolution, appropriate risk reduction, and user satisfaction. • Work with our team to conduct software engineering best practices, such as code reviews, unit testing, and software static analysis. Be able to implement new software development process metrics as required by our customers.





Material & Equipment Directly Used:





Real-Time Spectrum Analyzers (RSA), Signal Generators, servers, and basic computers.





Working Environment:





Work will be performed in an office environment approximately 90% of the time. Some laboratory work may be required. Local travel is required with the possibility of regional and international travel roughly 5 to 10% of the time.



Qualifications



Minimum Qualifications :





Education/Experience/Certifications:





Associates (2) year degree or in pursuit of a Bachelor’s (4 year) degree from an accredited College or University in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Programming, or related field with: • Experience preparing technical documents, test plans/reports, analytical evaluations, and presentations. • Ability to obtain a SECRET Security Clearance. • Must be a U.S Citizen.








Preferred Qualifications:





• Past experience in with software development • Past experience performing RF modeling and simulation. • Active SECRET Security Clearance.








We are committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace that values and supports the contributions of each individual. This commitment along with our common Vision and Values of Integrity, Respect, and Responsibility, allows us to leverage differences, encourage innovation and expand our success in the global marketplace. Vectrus is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability. position: Research Internship - Fall 2021 (NLP, Computer Vision, or Machine Learning)
description:
Type: Internship
Experience: PhD/Graduate Students

Who we are:

Dataminr puts real-time AI and public data to work for our clients, generating relevant and actionable alerts for global corporations, public sector agencies, newsrooms, and NGOs. Our leading AI platform detects the earliest signals of high-impact events and emerging risks from vast amounts of publicly available information. Our real-time alerts enable tens of thousands of users at hundreds of public and private sector organizations to learn first of breaking events around the world, develop effective risk mitigation strategies, and respond with confidence as crises unfold.

Dataminr is making its mark for growth and innovation, recently earning recognition on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500, Forbes AI 50 and Forbes Cloud 100 lists. We also earned accolades for ‘Most Innovative Use of AI’ from the 2020 AI & Machine Learning Awards.

Join our team and help the world manage risk in real time. You’ll work with 600+ talented people across seven offices, united by our passion to collaborate, make a difference, and have fun while doing it!

Who you are:

You’re a Ph.D. candidate who has published in top tier conferences and are passionate about having a positive impact on the world. You are enthusiastic about working on some of the most challenging problems in AI, working in a highly collaborative environment and directly contributing to products while advancing the state of the art. You are very creative, can work independently, and are an excellent collaborator and communicator.  

Responsibilities:

  • Perform research to advance the state of the art and solve specific problems at scale in one or more of the following areas: NLP, HCI, Machine Learning/Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Complex Networks.
  • Work closely with a diverse, interdisciplinary team on a specific project to be completed during the internship.
  • Excel in placing a human-centered focus on the work (context, end-user impact, etc), finding solutions that work in practice and have significant impact.

Minimum qualifications:

  • Must be enrolled in a Ph.D. program in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related field.
  • Ideal candidates will have had prior internship experience.
  • Outstanding publication record in the candidate’s field of study (ACL, CVPR, CHI, WWW, RecSys, ICCV, NIPS, ICML, etc.).
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently, set up experiments and demonstrate progress through principled used of metrics.

Dataminr is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Individuals seeking employment at Dataminr are considered without regards to race, sex, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, genetics, marital status, pregnancy, unemployment status, sexual orientation, citizenship status or veteran status.

CSX Technology Internship Program-047339 

Description

 

Summary: 

Interns sought to work within the Technology Department for a 12+ week immersion in CSX methods and culture. Individuals will complete challenging assignments in a collaborative team environment, directly contributing to innovation, transformation, and delivery of corporate results. Internships provide an opportunity for candidates to preview full-time opportunities at CSX, gain practical experience, build professional networks; they also allow CSX to actively engage tomorrow’s most promising talent. 

Primary Activities and Responsibilities:  

Interns will be placed with a technology team based on their skills, aspirations, and active company initiatives. Interns may work with teams including: Applications Development (Angular and Java web development), Data Science Analytics, Cybersecurity, Agile Delivery, Infrastructure (including Automation, Cloud), User Experience, IT Operations, Integrations/API, Project Management, Robotics/Drones, and Service Support. 

Regardless of team placement, all technology interns play an important role in advancing and delivering Technology initiatives. The expectations of these compensated positions include, but are not limited to:  

  • Active contribution in a dynamic, agile team environment 
  • Adherence to best practices for developing and maintaining secure systems 
  • Root-cause analysis to iterate improvement and increase reliability and efficiency 
  • Engagement across teams and stakeholders, to ensure shared understanding and value delivery 
 

Qualifications

 

Minimum Qualifications:  

  • Must be at least 18 years of age   
  • Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related major field of study from an accredited institution. 
  • Cumulative minimum GPA of 3.0 ( based on a 4-point scale)  

Preferred Qualifications:  

  • Cumulative GPA of 3.3 (based on a 4-point scale)  

Knowledge and Skills:  

  • Knowledge of web (angular/java) programming concepts and technologies  
  • Knowledge of relational and/or graph database concepts and functions  
  • Knowledge of Agile, DEVOPS, cybersecurity, and integration practices and concepts 
  • Strong collaboration, communication, interpersonal, and influence skills 
  • Problem-solving, analysis, organizational, and time management skills 

Job Requirements:  

  • Communicate effectively and professionally with peers, leadership, stakeholder audiences  
  • Work within established deadlines  
  • Willing and able to work days and hours as assigned  
  • Successfully complete a background check and drug test 

Environmental Conditions:

  • Work inside an office environment
  • Work outside in all weather conditions
Safety Commitment:
Safety is a way of life at CSX, encompassing every aspect of company operations. Guided by a policy of ensuring the safety of our employees, our customers, and the communities we serve, CSX works relentlessly to prevent accidents and injuries.  Not only is it the right thing to do, but when a company puts safety first, everyone benefits: the employees and their families, the customers, and the communities.
 
Company Profile:
CSX Corporation, a Fortune 500 company headquartered in Jacksonville, FL, is a multi-modal freight transportation company serving customers across North America.  Through its primary subsidiary, CSX operates the largest railroad in the eastern United States with operations in 23 states, the District of Columbia, and two Canadian provinces.  CSX also includes an integrated intermodal company which serves customers with its own truck and terminal operations as well as a dedicated domestic container fleet.  Other CSX subsidiaries provide technology and real estate support to the company.  These subsidiaries combine to allow CSX to deliver efficient freight alternatives to customers in a variety of industries, including coal, chemicals, automobiles, metals, agricultural and forest products, food and consumer goods.
 
Closing Statement
At CSX, two of the company's core values are People Make The Difference and Safety Is A Way of Life. We are committed to offering our team members the most competitive compensation and benefits package available, unlimited opportunities for development and growth throughout an exciting and rewarding career, and the safest work environment possible.
 
CSX is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. SWBC continues to be a strong and stable employer during these challenging times and a vast majority of our interviewing and on-boarding is being done virtually due to COVID-19.

SWBC is seeking talented students to join our College Intern Program in San Antonio, Texas. This is an exciting opportunity for college students who are motivated and eager to learn within their educational field of study.

Interns will gain practical hands-on experience and training that will provide an opportunity for growth, learning and development within the financial services industry.  Full-time and part-time paid internship opportunities will be available in numerous departments, which may include: Information Technology, Accounting, Marketing, Human Resources, Mortgage, Insurance, Legal, PEO, Lender Placed Operations, Financial Institutions, Investment Services and Training. Interns will be placed within a specific division based on interest, experience, academic coursework, SWBC’s business need, and flexibility with college/university schedule.

Why you'll love this role:

As an SWBC intern, you will be learning on the job in real-time from talented professionals within the financial services industry. We will develop, teach, mentor, and support your efforts throughout the internship. Our interns are given projects that are impactful and meaningful to SWBC, so interns will feel they are a valued team member of our SWBC family.

Essential duties include the following:

  • Build awareness and gain exposure to the Financial Services Industry while growing your talents.

  • Learn key technical skills to apply acquired knowledge and assist in problem solving.

  • Gain practical, hands on experience that will provide an opportunity for growth.

  • Work alongside and shadow team members while expanding your knowledge base with the ability to further develop your skills.

Serious candidates will possess the minimum qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Cyber Security, Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related program at an accredited university/college.

  • Expected graduation date of December 2021 or later.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Strong analytical and interpersonal skills required.

  • Detail oriented and possess excellent follow up skills.

  • Must be organized and adapt well to change.

  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment.

  • Passion and desire for learning and a proactive energy for getting things done.

  • Display maturity and a high level of professionalism.

  • SWBC is a Substance-Free Workplace and requires pre-employment drug testing.

  • Please note SWBC does not hire tobacco users.

SWBC offers*:  

  • Competitive overall compensation package
  • Work/Life balance 
  • Employee engagement activities and recognition awards 
  • Years of Service awards
  • Career enhancement and growth opportunities 
  • Emerging Professionals and Mentor Program
  • Continuing education and career certifications 
  • Variety of healthcare coverage options
  • Traditional and Roth 401(k) retirement plans 
  • Lucrative Wellness Program

*Based upon employee eligibility 

     

Additional Information:

    

SWBC is a Substance-Free Workplace and requires pre-employment drug testing.

    

Please note, SWBC does not hire tobacco users as allowed by law.
